story:
Per il testo in italiano clicca qui o vai sotto
+++ June 26th 2015 update:  even though we didn't raise the money trough a crowdfunding, we are now started to build the FarmLab.
The July 24-25-26th  there will be a course about straw bale building.

see: http://www.costadelgrillo.com/news/costruire-co...
+++
Costa del Grillo (*) Farm was born 4 years ago with a vision of efficient self sustainability. It all begins with this sentence "The passion for horses and the love of nature have found home". From that moment we try to shape our lives observing nature and interacting with her as much as possible to live in harmony.

The aim of this project is to build the First FarmLab in the valley and the First straw-bale construction in the province.

The straw-bale Lab gives us the opportunity to transform locally the land's products, such as medicinal herbs, honey or jam, following our vision and to share this experience with the local and world community.

With your contribute you give a boost to the valley economy and help us to demonstrate how nature can be part of life!
(*) Costa del Grillo means Cricket's Ridge



The Project

We set a low budget because we want to build the Lab with our hands, with your support and with the help of those people who will join us during the building process next springtime. Since we strongly believe in this project, we are going to build the lab in any case but your help is essential.

The construction is quite simple: a single pitch roof attached to the existing barn, one-story and two rooms. One room is the Lab with all law's prescription. The second room is a storage. The building consists in a wooden structural frame infilled with straw bales and rendered with a breathable lime-based system.

The Perks

We are happy to give you the unique experience to be a part of Costa del Grillo Farm.
  • Adventure Day: which consists in one day at Costa del Grillo for you, your partner or your family. Depending on your attitudes, we can walk or horse-ride  discovering some wonderful and mystic places nearby the Farm. If you prefer, you can stay at the farm: we'll teach you how to cook some typical Italian food.
  • Lavender Products: our 100% natural essential oil and or Lavender Water.


  • 2015 Photo Calendar: a printable calendar with the Costa del Grillo Pictures, for those who don't want to miss to be part of the project team.


    The Idea

    At Costa del Grillo Farm we are used to develop ideas for saving energy, recycling and save resources. Among other things, the light in the horse zone is served by an off-grid solar system meanwhile the club house is heated with a Rocket Mass Heater that allows us to use firewood in a more efficient way. The last summer we build a Wood Oven with 100% recycled material and insulate with horse manure.

    The windy days have inspired us to protect our stables by building a straw-bale wall, acting as a windshield. And last but not least, we are very proud to host the first productive prototype of ARETHA System (an idea of Roberto's father developed with the Politecnico di Milano University together a bunch of retired researcher) which gives us hot water.

    Few month after the farm birth, we felt the urgency to have a laboratory for transforming the land's fruits, knowing too that was too much challenging for our resources.  Sharing our vision with Massimo, a local Designer Architect, we realized that dreams always come true if you follow the right direction. A Straw-Bale building is something that can be a reality in few month.

    • Because is aligned with our vision efficient self sustainability
    • Because we use a low impact material such as straw and wood
    • Because the main material (straw) is produced nearby the farm
    • Because the building process is simpler and can mostly be done with our hands
    • Because the building process could be a party far all those people who want to learn a different lifestyle
    • Because, once productive, the FarmLab can become a meeting point for all those who are committed to the rebirth of this beautiful valley

    We are ready

    Thanks to you we can to achieve the goal because everything is already set up such as the project and all permits.

    Massimo followed some straw-bale construction courses and we are setting up a network of people that will happily teach us at Costa del Grillo how to build in such way.

    So we are ready to start the next springtime.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Share this project! Use the share tools that are in this page. Talk about of this project to your friends, or... simply visit Us!



      Versione Italiana

      L'azienda agricola Costa del Grillo è nata 4 anni fa con una visione di efficiente sostenibilità. Tutto è cominciato con questa frase: "La passione per i cavalli e l'amore per la natura hanno trovato casa". Da quel momento cerchiamo di modellare la nostra vita osservando la natura e interagendo con lei quanto più possibile per vivere in armonia.

      Lo scopo di questo progetto è quello di costruire il primo FarmLab nella valle e la       prima costruzione in balle di paglia in provincia.

      Il Laboratorio in paglia ci dà la possibilità di trasformare in loco i prodotti della terra, come le erbe officinali ad esempio, seguendo la nostra visione permettendoci inoltre di condividere questa esperienza con la comunità locale e globale.
      Con il vostro contributo date una spinta all'economia  della valle e ci aiutate a dimostrare come la natura possa essere parte della vita!


      Il Progetto


      Abbiamo impostato un budget basso perché vogliamo costruire il laboratorio con le nostre mani, con il vostro sostegno e con l'aiuto di quelle persone che si uniranno a noi durante il processo di costruzione la prossima primavera. Poiché crediamo fortemente in questo progetto, costruiremo il laboratorio in ogni caso, ma il vostro aiuto è fondamentale.
      La costruzione è molto semplice: un tetto a singola falda collegato al fienile esistente, un piano e due locali. Un locale è il laboratorio con tutte le prescrizioni di legge. Il secondo locale è un magazzino. L'edificio è costituito da un telaio strutturale in legno tamponato con balle di paglia e intonacato con un sistema a base di calce traspirante.

      I benefit

      Siamo lieti di offrirvi l'esperienza unica di essere parte del team di Costa del Grillo.

      • Adventure Day: che consiste in un giorno a Costa del Grillo per voi, il vostro partner o la vostra famiglia. A seconda delle attitudini, siamo in grado di camminare o andare a cavallo alla scoperta di alcuni luoghi meravigliosi e mistici vicino alla fattoria. Se si preferisce, è possibile stare presso l'azienda agricola dove è possibile partecipare ad alcune attività agricole oppure seguire alcuni corsi di cucina locale.
      • Lavender Products: il nostro olio essenziale di Lavanda puro al 100% e/o l'Acqua di Lavanda.


      • 2015 Photo Calendar: un calendario con le foto di Costa del Grillo, per coloro che non vogliono perdere l'opportunità di fare parte del team.



      L'idea

      A Costa del Grillo siamo abituati a sviluppare idee per il risparmio energetico, di risorse ed il riciclo. Tra le altre cose, la luce nel maneggio è servita da un sistema solare autonomo (off-grid) mentre la club house è riscaldata con una Rocket Mass Heater che ci permette di utilizzare legna in modo più efficiente. L'estate scorsa abbiamo costruito un forno a legna con il 100% di materiale riciclato e isolato con fango e letame di cavallo.

      I giorni di vento ci hanno ispirato a proteggere le nostre stalle con la costruzione di un muro antivento fatto con balle di paglia. E, ultimo ma non meno importante, siamo molto orgogliosi di ospitare il primo prototipo produttivo di Aretha System (un'idea del padre di Roberto sviluppata con il Politecnico di Milano ed un gruppo di ricercatori in pensione), che ci dà l'acqua calda.

      Poco tempo dopo la nascita dell'azienda, abbiamo sentito l'urgenza di avere un laboratorio per trasformare i frutti della terra, sapendo anche che era troppo impegnativo per le nostre risorse. Condividendo la nostra visione con Massimo, un geometra locale, ci siamo resi conto che i sogni si avverano sempre se si segue la giusta direzione. Un edificio in paglia è qualcosa che può essere una realtà in pochi mesi.

      • Perché è allineato con la nostra visione di efficiente auto sostenibilità
      • Perché utilizziamo un materiale a basso impatto come la paglia e il legno
      • Poiché il materiale principale (paglia) è prodotto nelle vicinanze della fattoria
      • Poiché la costruzione è semplice e può in gran parte essere fatta con le nostre mani
      • Poiché il processo di costruzione potrebbe essere un'occasione per tutte quelle persone che vogliono imparare uno stile di vita diverso
      • Perché, una volta produttivo, il Laboratorio può diventare un punto di incontro per tutti coloro che si impegnano per la rinascita di questa bellissima valle

      Noi siamo pronti

      Grazie a voi  possiamo per raggiungere l'obiettivo, perché tutto è già impostato, come il progetto e i permessi di costruire.

      Massimo ha seguito alcuni corsi per realizzare costruzioni in paglia e stiamo allestendo una rete di persone che fortunatamente ci insegneranno a Costa del Grillo come costruire in questo modo.

      Siamo quindi pronti per iniziare già dalla prossima primavera.

      Altri modi per aiutarci

      Condividi questo progetto! Usa gli strumenti per la condivisione che sono in questa pagina. Parla di questo progetto ai tuoi amici, oppure... semplicemente vieni a trovarci!

Adventure Day: which consists in one day at Costa del Grillo for you, your partner or your family. Depending on your attitudes, we can walk or horse-ride  discovering some wonderful and mystic places nearby the Farm. If you prefer, you can stay at the farm: we'll teach you how to cook some typical Italian food.

Lavender Products: our 100% natural essential oil and or Lavender Water.




2015 Photo Calendar: a printable calendar with the Costa del Grillo Pictures, for those who don't want to miss to be part of the project team.







   The Idea
 At Costa del Grillo Farm we are used to develop ideas for saving energy, recycling and save resources. Among other things, the light in the horse zone is served by an off-grid solar system meanwhile the club house is heated with a Rocket Mass Heater that
allows us to use firewood in a more efficient way. The last summer we build a Wood Oven with 100% recycled material and insulate with horse manure. 

The
windy days have inspired us to protect our stables by building a
straw-bale wall, acting as a windshield. And last but not least, we are very proud to host the first productive prototype of ARETHA System (an idea of Roberto's father developed with the Politecnico di Milano University together a bunch of retired researcher) which gives us hot water.
Few month after the farm birth, we felt the urgency to have a laboratory for transforming the land's fruits, knowing too that was too much challenging for our resources.  Sharing our vision with Massimo, a local Designer Architect, we realized that dreams always come true if you follow the right direction. A Straw-Bale building is something that can be a reality in few month.  Because is aligned with our vision efficient self sustainability
 Because we use a low impact material such as straw and wood
Because the main material (straw) is produced nearby the farm 
 Because the building process is simpler and can mostly be done with our hands
Because the building process could be a party far all those people who want to learn a different lifestyle

Because, once productive, the FarmLab can become a meeting point for all those who are committed to the rebirth of this beautiful valley
    We are ready
 Thanks to you we can to achieve the goal because everything is already set up such as the project and all permits. 
Massimo followed some straw-bale construction courses and we are setting up a network of people that will happily teach us at Costa del Grillo how to build in such way. 
So we are ready to start the next springtime. 
   Other Ways You Can HelpShare this project! Use the share tools that are in this page. Talk about of this project to your friends, or... simply visit Us!

Versione Italiana
L'azienda agricola Costa del Grillo è nata 4 anni fa con una visione di efficiente sostenibilità. Tutto è cominciato con questa frase: "La passione per i cavalli e l'amore per la natura hanno trovato casa". Da quel momento cerchiamo di modellare la nostra vita osservando la natura e interagendo con lei quanto più possibile per vivere in armonia. Lo scopo di questo progetto è quello di costruire il primo FarmLab nella valle e la prima costruzione in balle di paglia in provincia. Il Laboratorio in paglia ci dà la possibilità di trasformare in loco i prodotti della terra, come le erbe officinali ad esempio, seguendo la nostra visione permettendoci inoltre di condividere questa esperienza con la comunità locale e globale. Con il vostro contributo date una spinta all'economia  della valle e ci aiutate a dimostrare come la natura possa essere parte della vita!






Il Progetto



Abbiamo impostato un budget basso perché vogliamo costruire il laboratorio con le nostre mani, con il vostro sostegno e con l'aiuto di quelle persone che si uniranno a noi durante il processo di costruzione la prossima primavera. Poiché crediamo fortemente in questo progetto, costruiremo il laboratorio in ogni caso, ma il vostro aiuto è fondamentale. La costruzione è molto semplice: un tetto a singola falda collegato al fienile esistente, un piano e due locali. Un locale è il laboratorio con tutte le prescrizioni di legge. Il secondo locale è un magazzino. L'edificio è costituito da un telaio strutturale in legno tamponato con balle di paglia e intonacato con un sistema a base di calce traspirante.I benefit

Siamo lieti di offrirvi l'esperienza unica di essere parte del team di Costa del Grillo.

Adventure Day: che consiste in un giorno a Costa del Grillo per voi, il vostro partner o la vostra famiglia. A seconda delle attitudini, siamo in grado di camminare o andare a cavallo alla scoperta di alcuni luoghi meravigliosi e mistici vicino alla fattoria. Se si preferisce, è possibile stare presso l'azienda agricola dove è possibile partecipare ad alcune attività agricole oppure seguire alcuni corsi di cucina locale.


Lavender Products: il nostro olio essenziale di Lavanda puro al 100% e/o l'Acqua di Lavanda.






2015 Photo Calendar: un calendario con le foto di Costa del Grillo, per coloro che non vogliono perdere l'opportunità di fare parte del team.


L'idea 
A Costa del Grillo siamo abituati a sviluppare idee per il risparmio energetico, di risorse ed il riciclo. Tra le altre cose, la luce nel maneggio è servita da un sistema solare autonomo (off-grid) mentre la club house è riscaldata con una Rocket Mass Heater che ci permette di utilizzare legna in modo più efficiente. L'estate scorsa abbiamo costruito un forno a legna con il 100% di materiale riciclato e isolato con fango e letame di cavallo.

 I giorni di vento ci hanno ispirato a proteggere le nostre stalle con la costruzione di un muro antivento fatto con balle di paglia. E, ultimo ma non meno importante, siamo molto orgogliosi di ospitare il primo prototipo produttivo di Aretha System (un'idea del padre di Roberto sviluppata con il Politecnico di Milano ed un gruppo di ricercatori in pensione), che ci dà l'acqua calda.

 Poco tempo dopo la nascita dell'azienda, abbiamo sentito l'urgenza di avere un laboratorio per trasformare i frutti della terra, sapendo anche che era troppo impegnativo per le nostre risorse. Condividendo la nostra visione con Massimo, un geometra locale, ci siamo resi conto che i sogni si avverano sempre se si segue la giusta direzione. Un edificio in paglia è qualcosa che può essere una realtà in pochi mesi.

Perché è allineato con la nostra visione di efficiente auto sostenibilità
Perché utilizziamo un materiale a basso impatto come la paglia e il legno
Poiché il materiale principale (paglia) è prodotto nelle vicinanze della fattoria
Poiché la costruzione è semplice e può in gran parte essere fatta con le nostre mani
Poiché il processo di costruzione potrebbe essere un'occasione per tutte quelle persone che vogliono imparare uno stile di vita diverso
Perché, una volta produttivo, il Laboratorio può diventare un punto di incontro per tutti coloro che si impegnano per la rinascita di questa bellissima valle


 
Noi siamo pronti
Grazie a voi  possiamo per raggiungere l'obiettivo, perché tutto è già impostato, come il progetto e i permessi di costruire.

Massimo ha seguito alcuni corsi per realizzare costruzioni in paglia e stiamo allestendo una rete di persone che fortunatamente ci insegneranno a Costa del Grillo come costruire in questo modo.

 Siamo quindi pronti per iniziare già dalla prossima primavera.



 Altri modi per aiutarci
Condividi questo progetto! Usa gli strumenti per la condivisione che sono in questa pagina. Parla di questo progetto ai tuoi amici, oppure... semplicemente vieni a trovarci!

story:
Our Project 

With rising ocean levels and a changing climate, sustainability has become an important concept here and around the world. What better place is there for the development of sustainable practices than our educational institutions? Colleges and Universities have the capacity to be social innovators in practices that support a transformation for sustainability. They are the training grounds for our future leaders, the breeding ground for research and can become models of best practices. Tracing a path to sustainability means to lower our ecological footprint but it is also about forming communities; learning to live a healthier lifestyle; teaching the future generations; and learning from our mistakes. This is where we come in. We are here to support sustainable campus practices by building an international community.

This summer, four students from Dawson College will embark on a six week internship to  two Universities in the State of Morelos, Mexico to share ideas about sustainability and learn new practices. While in Mexico, we will work on the day to day maintenance of existing projects at the Universities and upon our return, we will share our new knowledge with the students and faculty at Dawson. 

However, to make this cross cultural exchange of knowledge and sustainable values possible we need your help, whether this be through giving a donation or spreading awareness. All the money collected from this campaign will be used to support student driven sustainability initiatives in Mexico, such as medicinal gardens, waste management projects, and bringing the natural world into the classroom. The students in Cuernavaca are very excited to connect with the Canadian interns, sharing knowledge, experiences, and working together to create a sustainable future. 

Thank you for your help and support,

Sincerely,

Morgen, Ali, Ella & Mikayla 


**PLEASE NOTE**

The money is going to be transferred to Garry Beitel's (Mikayla's father) paypal account.  Be reassured that all the money fundraised will go to the project as soon as the campaign is over. Thank you for your understanding.

Make sure to leave in your billing address and we will send you a tax receipt!

Thank you!

__________________________________________

Notre Projet

Madame, 

Monsieur,

La montée du niveaux des océans et les changements climatiques ont donné de l’importance au concept du développement durable, partout autour du monde. Quel meilleur endroit y a-t-il pour intégrer ce concept en devenir, que dans nos établissements scolaires? Les cégeps ainsi que les universités ont la capacité d’être des innovateurs sociaux dans des pratiques qui favorisent  une orientation vers le développement durable. Ces établissements constituent le terrain d’expérimentation de nos futurs leaders et l’endroit idéal pour que de brillantes idées puissent se concrétiser. Pour nous diriger vers une société durable, nous devons réduire notre empreinte écologique, mais aussi créer des liens forts entre les communautés, apprendre à vivre de manière saine, enseigner aux générations futures et apprendre de nos erreurs. C’est dans cet esprit que nous voulons soutenir des pratiques écologiques et durables en bâtissant une communauté internationale.

Cet été, quatre étudiantes du collège Dawson feront un stage de six semaines, dans deux universités dans l’État de Morelos au Mexique, pour partager des idées sur le développement durable et enrichir leurs connaissances sur le sujet. Pendant notre séjour au Mexique, nous allons travailler à la poursuite de projets existants dans les universités; à notre retour, nous pourrons partager ces nouvelles connaissances avec les étudiants et les membres du personnel de Dawson.

Si nous voulons réaliser cet échange multiculturel de valeurs et de pratiques vertes, nous avons toutefois besoin de votre aide, que ce soit par un don ou par la sensibilisation à notre projet. Tous les dons amassés serviront à soutenir des projets de développement durable poursuivis par des étudiants mexicains, comme la création de jardins médicinaux, des projets de traitement de déchets et la transposition de la nature dans un contexte scolaire. Les étudiants de la ville de Cuernavaca ont très hâte de rencontrer les stagiaires canadiens afin de partager savoir et expériences en plus de travailler ensemble pour créer un avenir vert.

Merci de votre aide et de votre appui,

Cordialement, 

Morgen, Ali, Ella & Mikayla 


**VEUILLEZ NOTER**

L'argent collectée sera transférée dans le compte Pay Pal de Garry Beitel (le père de Mikayla).  Rassurez vous que tout l'argent amassé ira directement vers le projet une fois la collecte terminée. Merci de votre compréhension!

Assurez-vous de nous laisser votre adresse pour que nous puissions vous envoyer un retour d'impot !

Merci! 



____________________________________________

Get to know us better!

So who are the interns anyway? Get to know us through these little introductory texts!

INTERN #1: Mikayla Salmon-Beitel

Hello! My name is Mikayla and I am in my second semester of Environmental Science at Dawson College in Montreal, QC. I am also the co-president of the Dawson Green Earth Club, a group of students committed to protecting the environment. I love hiking, biking, and exploring the world around me. In my spare time, I love to bake and dance, but I really need to brush up on my salsa! I cannot wait to work at UPEMOR University this summer, getting inspired by all the wonderful sustainability initiatives the students have created and finding ways to implement similar projects back at home. The reality of our rapidly changing environment is one that affects the entire planet, personally touching each and every one of us. By working together cross-culturally, I am confident we will find solutions. Adiós! See you this summer!

INTERN #2: Ella Martin

Hi I'm Ella! I'm also in my second semester of Environmental Science at Dawson with Mikayla, as well as the internal secretary of the Green Earth Club, and a volunteer with Sustainable Dawson. I'm super interested in a whole lot of things like bees and protists and clouds and Victorian literature and medical history and a slew of arts and crafts, but mostly I just really enjoy learning about the natural world, how it works, and most importantly, how to preserve it. This trip is such an exciting opportunity to be able to actually go and realize some of the things that we've been learning about over the past few months, and I can't wait to see all of the inventive and amazing projects the students in Mexico have been working on, and help out as best we can. Campus sustainability is a very new thing, and every small development being made is so exciting. It's inspiring to see everything that can be done to make the world a better and more sustainable place when you have a group of dedicated and creative people, one step at a time!

INTERN #3: Morgen Bertheussen

Hi, I’m Morgen! 

I am in my second semester at Dawson studying in environmental studies. I love the outdoors and trying new things that will know to push me to my full potential. I have had a growing interest for the environment since the past three years, ever since I became a vegetarian. Having the opportunity to go on a Sustainability Internship in Mexico is so amazing, because it combines my biggest passions: the environment, travelling, and diving into the unknown. I am ever so grateful to be one of the four awesome students to be going on this adventure, and I can’t wait to bring back everything we’ve acquired over there on campus sustainability initiatives.

See you on the flip side,

INTERN #4: Ali Byers

¡Hola a todos! Hello everyone! Bonjour tout le monde! 

My real name is Alberta but everyone calls me Ali. I'm in my second semester at Dawson in the Social Sciences' Environmental Profile. Like Mikayla and Ella, I am involved in the Green Earth Club and have been since I started cegep in September. I'm a proud green freak and my preferred mode of transportation is my bicycle. I've been on two short bike trips and I'd love to go on more in the future. I'm a photographer and I plan on sharing lots of pictures here while we're away. My non-environmental interests (yes they exist) include books, travelling, museums, potlucks, and thrifting.

I'm from Montreal and I love my city but it would be even better if it was more eco-friendly. Green cities are, in my opinion, the way of the future and I'd love to see Montreal head in that direction. There are initiatives all around us like collective and/or roof gardens, bike paths, and green buildings but there is always room for improvement. By going to Mexico and learning about their sustainable initiatives I believe that we will be able to contribute not only to sustainable campuses but to green cities as well.

There exists a well-known saying that encourages us to think global, act local; in this case we are going to learn global, make it local and I couldn't be more excited.

story:
The Project

Founded in 1999, Waterkeeper Alliance is a global movement that unites more than 240 Waterkeeper organizations working on the water and in their communities to fight for our right to swimmable, drinkable and fishable waters.  Together, we patrol and protect more than 2 million square miles of rivers, streams and coastlines on six continents. 

Waterkeepers respond to environmental disasters, like Superstorm Sandy in 2012 and the 2014 toxic chemical spill that poisoned entire water supply systems in West Virginia.  Based on our years of collective experience, Waterkeeper Alliance developed rapid response protocol for deploying our highly trained, independent teams of experts to the scene when disaster strikes, to document impacts and protect the communities and waterways affected by the disaster.  As natural and human-made disasters on our waterways occur with increasing frequency and intensity, Waterkeeper Alliance needs your help more than ever before to expand our rapid response programs.  

Our Approach Works

Five elements define Waterkeeper Alliance's rapid response protocol:  When a Disaster (a super storm, chemical spill, etc.) creates an immediate Danger (waterway contamination, flooding, etc), Waterkeeper Alliance takes Action (responding to the scene, capturing photos and videos, collecting water samples, and communicating danger to the public) to expose the Truth (polluters and government downplay the dangers and cover up impacts).  As news of a disaster breaks, our experienced teams rapidly deploy to the scene, using boats and aircraft to evaluate impacts, assist citizens, and alert the public.  Even after the immediate danger has passed, Waterkeepers continue to monitor impacts and cleanup efforts, and we advocate for long-term Solutions to prevent a similar disaster in the future.  

Your Support

We need $100,000 so we can respond to disasters faster and farther afield.  Our approach works, but we need to expand our reach so that no matter where a disaster strikes, we can be there to protect waterways and communities. 

Your support will help us protect our most important natural resource:  clean water.  By meeting our goal, we'll be able to acquire state-of-the-art water testing equipment and documentary tools like GoPro video cameras.  Your contribution will also help us cover boat and aircraft operational costs and other travel expenses.  We also seek to train local Waterkeepers and build regional disaster response teams. Your support will allow us to be among the first to arrive on the scene of the next disaster, exposing the truth and empowering affected communities.


The Perks!

Support us and you’ll earn our sincere thanks and some cool stuff!

If we don’t meet our goal, all funds raised will be spent on training regional disaster response teams and buying new equipment.

Regardless of your ability to support our campaign we invite everyone to stay informed about the important work we do by regularly visiting www.waterkeeper.org and by using the Indiegogo sharing tools to find new ways to help.

story:
We are building an "Eco-Friendly Server Farm" powered by Green and Clean energy to meet :

  • High computing efficiency that can serve all kinds of computation needs
  • Total cost should be low as possible
  • Server Farm should be environment friendly

The Idea of having Green Computing Farm actually originated when we realized the needs of computational powers in various sectors.
Primarily considering the image processing needs of Medical Institutes, which most institutions are deprived of mainly due to high financial and technical costs involved with Server Farms. If computational help is provided to such institutions there can be better health service available to the community.
Same is with various R&D projects as they can neither afford having their own Computing Farm nor can afford to pay high rate of computation available at Public Server farms.

Keeping the basic objectives at place, we planned The Green Computing Farm infrastructure that would utilize clean and renewable energy resources.
One of the chief consumables at Server Farm is Electrical Energy for obvious reasons; and the traditional power source is Expensive and mostly generated utilizing now-renewable natural resources (coal/gas/petroleum/etc) thereby adding toll to our Environment.
To counter this challenge the Server Farm will be powered by Eco-friendly energy source derived from Bio-Gas and Solar Energy.

A Server farm can be used for wide variety of applications such as :
• Image and Video processing
• Computational Biology and Chemistry
• Fluid dynamics simulation
• CT image reconstruction
• Seismic analysis
• Ray tracing
• BIG data processing - Data Mining, Map-Reduce & Analytics
• 3D Model rendering
• and much more...

It looks like your project is a combination of Computing farm + Dairy farm, Who's on your team ?



Where we will use the funds ?

We are using flexible funding for our project

For what Cost
Construction of Buildings $ 68,000
CO2 based Cooling Plant $ 17,000
Bio-Gas Digester $ 18,000
Generators $ 35,000
Other Custom Machinery $ 17,000
Server Machines $ 45,000
Solar Panels $ 100,000
   
Total $ 300,000

Here's a pie chart for the same :


Details of the Complex -


Do you have land required for all this ?

We have 10 acre of land, that we own, reserved for this project. Initial phase of this project will occupy only 5 acres of land. This is where we will build our Green Computing Farm -


From where will you get that much buffalo dung ?

We will be purchasing some buffaloes for our dairy farm, we have our own budget for that. Also we will be collecting buffalo dung from nearby villages and feeding all that into our digesters.

The manure coming out from the digesters will be distributed to the farmers and used for growing healthy food.

What about the water needed for the animals in this project ?

There are two water canals near the location of our server farm so there is more than enough water available to us. But water is a scarce resource, so we will be designing buildings such that we harvest rain water as much as possible.

How does this project benefits to community ?

A typical CPU in a computer never runs at it's full potential all the time. In fact it's usage is only 4-5% (maximum) 99% of the time. So we will also be not able to use 100% computing power that we will get from our servers to it's full potential all the time.

That's why to maximize the efficiency of our server farm we will be providing our computing power free of cost for medical research.

We will ensure that our servers does not sit idle doing nothing. They will be providing their computing power to medical institutes that need it the most.

The computational capability of the servers is expected to be enormous so a part of it would be utilized for the good of the community, mostly by Medical Institutes and other R&D programs.

In developing countries the most scarce resource is 'quality education'.


Since we will also be producing dairy products from the dairy farm and selling it to the market. We will be using that money to open a school for the nearby village children and provide computer education free of cost.

How long it will take to get the server machines up and running ?

It will take 10 months to get everything up and running.

  • Month 1 will be used for resource planning.
  • Month 2-7 (6 months) will be consumed in construction work.
  • Month 8 will be used for server installation & configuration.
  • Month 9 Alpha testing
  • Month 10 Beta launch


What are technical specs of each server machine ?

All our servers will be powered by LINUX.

That server machine would be costly, how does it fit in your budget ?

Each server machine will be built using commodity hardware to keep the costs minimum.
Most of the server machines will be built with the funds we already have.

What about perks ?

We will be providing our server machines at cheapest rates to all the contributors on IndieGoGo.

Typical rates in the market for such a server will cost you more than $2 per hour. Here's your chance to contribute and get yourself the cheapest hours on High Performance servers.

***Note : There is NO expiry date for the computing time you get. Use it when you need it the most.



Stretch goals

If we reach $400,000 -

  • 5 additional Server machines will be added
  • Larger cooling unit for server room will be installed, so we won't have to purchase when we expand.

If we reach $500,000 -

  • 20 additional Server machines.

If we reach $1,000,000

  • 50 additional Server machines.
  • Construction of free school will be started along with the server farm.


You talk about being Eco-friendly, but there is not a single tree in your Model ?

There will be plenty of trees in the real world complex. We removed trees from the 3D model to make it clear and easy to understand. Also to reduce the rendering time.

What happens if you don't reach your funding goal ?

If we don't reach our funding goal with IndieGoGo Campaign, the funds raised will be used for project development with less number of servers and solar panels installed in the initial phase.
It will take us more time to add more server machines to the computing-farm if we don't reach our funding goal. Small or large contribution, each one counts.



Help us build this Green Computing Farm by contributing and sharing on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Domenico Patanè and I'm one of the co-authors of a photographic book on Etna volcano one of the most fantastic worldwide volcanoes.

Mount Etna is not only a volcano and offers many natural itineraries and places to visit. It is also possible to easily explore its central craters and every year it attract hundreds of thousands of tourists, even though the best time to visit Etna is during a lava-producing eruption (and this can happen often).

In the book, almost finished, we wanted to bring together beautiful photos, stories and science of Etna. The reader and those who visit this volcano will be immersed in a photographic journey (the visitor will take home a souvenir) and may satisfy the palate and other senses, along with the  intellectual curiosity.

The narrative follows the seasons and the four elements of nature, that change and mark the journey of our life,  but also that of the volcano.

This book, written in Italian and English, will be a quality book, 8.3 inches tall by 11.7 inches (horizontal A4 format) wide with excellent quality paper. There are about 300 photos inside the book and they will be printed in color and some of them in black and white. The book is almost completed, and it will likely be between 220 and 240 pages with a color cover.

It is a tale of nature, beauty, discovery,  science. I hope you enjoy it.


What We Need & What You Get

I want to sell enough advance copies of the book to cover the printing costs, which are substantial for a photographic book. A graphic designer is creating the layout and cover for the book, and I hired a professional editor to make sure the book doesn't have any errors, so it will look great and will be fun to read. I'm also designing an eBook if you prefer that format.

By accepting pre-orders for the book, I'll have seed money to cover the costs, and I can have a better idea of how much interest there is in this book so I can better estimate the total number to order. To thank you for supporting this project, you'll be able to choose from a number of possibilities (see the entire list below). The book and perks will be delivered on November 2014.

NOTE: For this campaign, I am not charging shipping fees. To ship your book to you, I will ask that you send me the amount  when the book is ready to ship to cover those costs. If you need to have the book shipped, I can let you know when the book is done how much your shipping fee will be (if applicable).

The Impact

Mount Etna has been designated a Decade Volcano by the United Nations and in June 2013, it was added to the list of UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

Mount Etna, located in Sicily (Italy), is the most active volcano of the European continent and one of the most dynamic volcanoes in the world. Because it is located in a densely inhabited region since Greek times, it offers the largest historical record of volcanic phenomena and therefore represents the cradle of volcanology. The frequency of Etna’s eruptive episodes is very high as in 2000 when 64 spectacular lava fountains arose in five months only and as in the last year when 19 lava fountains occurred forming huge ash plumes up to 9 km high. Since the 1990's, more than 200 summit explosive events (from lava fountain to sub-Plinian) and numerous effusive events have occurred. Some of these effusive eruptions produced large lava flows, such as the 1991-93 eruption, while in other cases lava flows covered contemporaneously both main flanks of the volcano as during the 2001 and 2002-2003 multivent eruptions. Following, further eruptions occurred in 2004, 2006, 2007 and 2008-2009.

In recent years, Etna has been intensely active, producing more than 40 lava fountaining episodes between 12 January 2011 and late-December 2013. Etna's New Southeast Crater (NSEC) remained in a state of quiescence until the late evening of 21 January 2014, when a series of Strombolian explosions heralded the onset of lava emission from new vents at the eastern base of the NSEC cone. For the next two months, this rather classical "persistent" summit Strombolian activity has been accompanied by subterminal lava effusion. In June and August 2014, two episodes of mild Strombolian activity and lava emission occurred from the NSEC, and in July-August 2014, Strombolian activity and lava emission also occurred from new vents on the east flank of the Northeast Crater (NEC).

On the basis of the particular and frequent eruptions described briefly above, Mount Etna is unique and represents one of the most formidable natural phenomena of the planet Earth. 

Etna volcano is characterized, better than any other volcano on Earth, by good accessibility and intense fruition from the sea to its summit vents. Tourism and use of land for agricultural purposes and forestry, as well as the preservation of the natural environment, is a challenge for nourishing the culture of knowledge and conservation of volcanoes, corners of the world where people can see and touch the vitality of planet Earth and realize how these forces created the earth's crust on which we live. For this reason, in 2013, UNESCO recognized Etna volcano as a World Natural Heritage site.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What

Tales by Trees is a net positive art & design company from Finland. Our mission is to create beautiful and meaningful objects that rebuild the planet, piece by piece. Our products increase natural resources.

 

The Seed

The Seed is a minimalist design sculpture that decorates your home or office. Made from sustainably grown Nordic birch and designed by award winning Finnish designers Elina Helenius and Saara Renvall, it is beautiful for the eye, soothing for the touch, and a symbol of the forest.

The Seed is both a conversation and a conservation starter. The price includes:

  • A minimalist sculpture made from sustainably grown Nordic birch
  • Each Seed is unique, separately stamped and individually numbered
  • Size: 23 x 16 cm (9.0 x 6.3 in)
  • Weight: 1.6 kg (3.6 lb)
  • 50 trees planted
  • 10 m2 (about 100 square feet) of forest protected
  • Comes in eco-friendly packaging
  • Carbon neutral home delivery included in price
  • A net positive product that increases natural resources
  • Delivery: June 2018

Most home decor is not made in very environmentally friendly ways. We offer the Seed as a totally guilt free, net positive alternative that is measurably good for the planet.

The trees planted will remove over 50 times the CO2 that the Seed's manufacturing and transportations have released into the atmosphere, while the forests conserved protect over 20 times the natural resources that have gone into making it. The trees will be planted in tropical Africa to combat climate change, while the forest conservation is done in Finland.

On average, 25 Seeds can be made from one sustainably grown birch tree. Therefore, each felled tree results in 1250 new trees planted and 250 m2 (about 2500 ft2) forest protected.

 

The Book Trilogy

This is the book series where it all started. The award winning trilogy consists of three inspirational modern fairytales that examine our relationship with nature. These archetypal fables talk about all of us, but from the narrative perspective of trees. This is the first time these books will be available in English print editions.

The Carpenter: The emperor's chief carpenter is given an order to make whatever he most wants to. He immediately knows what he must build. But the challenge that he faces has serious consequences on his life and the people he loves. (32 pages. 14 illustrations.)

The Knight: A young knight spends his entire life preparing for a battle against a dragon that threatens the kingdom. But the task proves impossible for a mortal man. In the end, only the help of a princess can defeat the monster. (32 pages. 15 illustrations.)

The Seafarer: A royal prince longs for the sea that reminds him of his mother. He dreams of sailing away, but his city is surrounded by a desert with no trees from which to build vessels. Things change when he trades his crown for three seeds that are said to be from the Great World Tree itself. Can he find his mother and what she means to him? (40 pages. 15 illustrations.)

The books were written by Iiro Küttner, an award winning screenwriter, playwright and professor of screenwriting at Aalto University, Helsinki. They were illustrated by Ville Tietäväinen, a celebrated author and illustrator whose graphic novels and other works have been published in numerous countries. The English translation is by Owen F. Witesman, working closely with the author.

The books don't only discuss nature but we have made sure that they are also beautiful, environmentally friendly objects. The price includes:

  • Three artistic hardcover books printed on FSC certified paper from sustainable sources
  • Winner of Finland's Most Beautiful Book Series
  • Language: English
  • Intended audience: Grown-ups and mature children
  • 25 trees planted
  • 5 m2 (about 50 square feet) of forest protected
  • Comes in eco-friendly packaging
  • Carbon neutral home delivery included in price
  • A net positive product that increases natural resources
  • Delivery: June 2018

The trees planted will remove over 30 times the CO2 that the books' printing and transportations have released into the atmosphere, while the forests conserved protect over 20 times the natural resources that have gone into making them. The trees will be planted in tropical Africa to combat climate change, while the forest conservation is done in Finland.

 

Attention, gift shoppers!

While our products will be delivered in June 2018, if you are looking for a truly sustainable gift for someone, you can definitely get a Seed or our book series as a gift for someone! You can even download one of the following digital cards that explain what these net positive products are, how they help the environment, and when they will be delivered:

  • Digital card: The Seed (pdf)
  • Digital card: The Book Trilogy (pdf)
  • Digital card: The Seed & The Book Trilogy pack (pdf)

 

Net Positive Products

 
 

Both the Seed and the book trilogy are made using our innovative net positive model. Working together with scientists, artists, designers and organisations around the world, we have come up with ways to create art & design that gives back to nature more than it takes out.

We strongly believe that this is the future: products that increase natural resources, instead of depleting them.

     

    Why

    One scary word: overconsumption.

    Almost every product that you buy decreases natural resources.

    Even products that you typically consider green or sustainable actually do this. This is because when people talk about sustainability, they usually only think about material use. But the life cycle of a product has far more aspects to it: the resource use and emissions generated by the production, as well as the packaging and transportation of a product are often a totally overlooked strain on the environment and a major part of any product’s ecological footprint.

    Yet, we cannot make things out of nothing.

    Global consumption is currently almost twice what our planet can provide each year. This overconsumption drives climate change and biodiversity loss around the planet. Soon, we would need two planets to sustain ourselves. But we only have one.

    We want to combat this with products that give back more than they take out from the environment.

     

    How

    Our net positive model allows us to put more back into nature than we take out.

    It follows the principles of net positivity that have been developed by the Net Positive Project, a collaboration between Forum for the Future, WWF, the Climate Group and other organisations.

    Our net positive model is the result of countless tests, designs and detailed calculations that we have done over the past years, and it will continue to evolve as we learn more and constantly seek better ways of doing things.

    You can read more about our model on our website, including details about the ecological impacts that the Seed and the book series have, and how the products are net positive.

    At the moment, our positive impact is carried out by tree planting and forest conservation. The trees are planted in tropical Africa where they have the best chance of combating climate change. This is done in collaboration with the US based NGO Trees for the Future. Meanwhile, the forests are conserved in Finland together with the Finnish Natural Heritage Foundation to increase local biodiversity and provide sanctuaries for animal species, resulting in a healthier planet.

    We will create more net positive art & design products in the future, while also diversifying our positive impact to cover more methods and regions around the world.

     

    Who

    We are a team of scientists, artists, designers and business people who want a better future for the planet.

    You can find more information about us on our website at talesbytrees.com.

     

    What can you do?

    In addition to backing us, you can support us hugely by telling your friends and family about our campaign! Every time you share our campaign it has the potential of doing good, while of course also helping our campaign. Thank you so much!

     

    FAQ

    Why do you cut trees? Why not use recycled wood?

    For the Seed, we use only certified, sustainably grown wood. Wood is a versatile, renewable material that is biodegradable and ecologically friendly. The trees felled for the Seed have grown to maturity and no longer sequester CO2 from the atmosphere with the rate that they did while growing. It is also important to stress that these trees come from managed, commercial forests, where cut trees are automatically replaced by new ones. We would never use wood from old growth forests, or indeed any wild forests. Finland is the most forested developed country in the world, with over 70% forest coverage, and our forests are currently used well below their sustainable capability.

    Naturally, we fully support the use of recycled and upcycled materials. For the Seed, we spent a lot of time investigating possibilities like naturally fallen trees (storm felled, etc.), recycled wood, as well as upcycled sources. The problem there is, however, that in our experience setting up meaningful production pipelines with these materials is still very challenging, indeed nearly impossible, especially if you want to maintain high-quality control, as we do. The reality also is that even if we used recycled wood, its manufacturing, as well as the production, transportation, packaging and everything else would still be accounted for as using natural resources and causing emissions. While recycled and upcycled materials definitely offer sustainability possibilities, ultimately they are no magic bullet, or in themselves net positive.

    That said, we will definitely continue to investigate recycled resources for future Tales by Trees products.

    Are the books printed on recycled paper?

    The books are printed on paper certified as FSC Mix. This is made from both recycled and sustainably grown sources, and gives us a great balance between sustainability and high quality paper fit for an art book.

    What about the packaging and delivery?

    All of our packaging is made from FSC certified recycled materials. We have designed our packaging solutions in a way that minimizes material use. For delivery, we use carbon neutral shipping worldwide.

    Why do you plant trees in Africa and protect forests only in Finland?

    While we are a Finnish company, the reason we have chosen to focus our planting efforts in Africa is that tropical trees grow faster and annually sequester far more CO2 from the atmosphere than Nordic trees do. As a result, tropical trees have a much bigger and faster impact on combating climate change than their Nordic counterparts. These trees also help local communities.

    Meanwhile, Finland already enjoys more than 70% forest coverage. Forests in the Nordics are also carefully maintained and currently used below their sustainable capacity. It therefore makes sense to focus our reforestation efforts on countries where forest coverage is much smaller and where the forests are currently far less sustainable. With that said, in the end, we do indirectly plant trees also in the Nordic Countries. Since we only use materials from sustainably managed forests, each tree felled is guaranteed to be replaced by a new one.

    The reason why we have chosen our home country Finland as our first conservation target has to do not only with logistics, but also with the types of forests that grow here. As mentioned earlier, Finland has plenty of trees and forests, but most of those forests are actually managed for use, and the number of protected wild forests could and should be higher. By protecting forests, we can increase local biodiversity and provide sanctuaries for animal species, resulting in a healthier planet.

    Our plan is to diversify our positive impact to cover more methods and regions around the world in the future.

    How do you prove your claims?

    Our calculations are available on our website. The linked page also includes information about tree planting and conservation partners. We want to be transparent about our model and warmly welcome any comments or suggestions that you may have.

    Why should I buy your products? Why not just donate to charity?

    It is not our intention to compete with organisations that do tree planting and conservation. On the contrary, we work together with them. Our mission is to create art & design that is not only beautiful to look at, but which is net positive and increases natural resources with every purchase.

    If your primary concern is tree planting and conservation and you do not want our products, we are the first ones to tell you not to buy them, as it would be a waste of natural resources to create something that you don't need. Instead, use your money directly to support the causes that you feel passionate about!

    But for anyone looking for home decor or inspirational books to read, our products are designed to offer a net positive option.

    Why art and design and not functional products?

    We are an art & design company. We strongly believe that art & design is at the heart of humanity, just like forests are the lungs of our planet. The books are where it all began for us, while the Seed feels like such a perfectly symbolic first product for our forest based company.

    Art & design objects also have long lifecycles and can last for generations, which is good for the environment. They bring comfort to your daily life and unite us as people. The Seed is a perfect conversation starter, just like it is a conservation starter. The book trilogy asks, what is your relationship with nature.

    Naturally, as art & design, these products are not for everyone, and that is fine. These things are, after all, a matter of taste.

    What about duties?

    In some part of the world, import duties may apply.

    EU: No import duties for any of our products.

    US: To the best of our understanding, there is no import duty on purchases for personal use when the value is under $800.

    Rest of the world: Please check with local authorities.

    Where can I learn more about Tales by Trees?

    You can find our website at talesbytrees.com and definitely check us out on social media as well! Especially our Facebook page is very active, with some 130,000 followers.

    I would like to write or talk about your campaign in my [insert media here]. How do I proceed?

    Sounds great! Check out our media page and get in touch!
story_txt:
WhatTales by Trees is a net positive art & design company from Finland. Our mission is to create beautiful and meaningful objects that rebuild the planet, piece by piece. Our products increase natural resources. The SeedThe Seed is a minimalist design sculpture that decorates your home or office. Made from sustainably grown Nordic birch and designed by award winning Finnish designers Elina Helenius and Saara Renvall, it is beautiful for the eye, soothing for the touch, and a symbol of the forest.The Seed is both a conversation and a conservation starter. The price includes:
A minimalist sculpture made from sustainably grown Nordic birch
Each Seed is unique, separately stamped and individually numbered
Size: 23 x 16 cm (9.0 x 6.3 in)
Weight: 1.6 kg (3.6 lb)
50 trees planted
10 m2 (about 100 square feet) of forest protected
Comes in eco-friendly packaging
Carbon neutral home delivery included in price
A net positive product that increases natural resources
Delivery: June 2018
Most home decor is not made in very environmentally friendly ways. We offer the Seed as a totally guilt free, net positive alternative that is measurably good for the planet.The trees planted will remove over 50 times the CO2 that the Seed's manufacturing and transportations have released into the atmosphere, while the forests conserved protect over 20 times the natural resources that have gone into making it. The trees will be planted in tropical Africa to combat climate change, while the forest conservation is done in Finland.On average, 25 Seeds can be made from one sustainably grown birch tree. Therefore, each felled tree results in 1250 new trees planted and 250 m2 (about 2500 ft2) forest protected. The Book TrilogyThis is the book series where it all started. The award winning trilogy consists of three inspirational modern fairytales that examine our relationship with nature. These archetypal fables talk about all of us, but from the narrative perspective of trees. This is the first time these books will be available in English print editions.The Carpenter: The emperor's chief carpenter is given an order to make whatever he most wants to. He immediately knows what he must build. But the challenge that he faces has serious consequences on his life and the people he loves. (32 pages. 14 illustrations.)The Knight: A young knight spends his entire life preparing for a battle against a dragon that threatens the kingdom. But the task proves impossible for a mortal man. In the end, only the help of a princess can defeat the monster. (32 pages. 15 illustrations.)The Seafarer: A royal prince longs for the sea that reminds him of his mother. He dreams of sailing away, but his city is surrounded by a desert with no trees from which to build vessels. Things change when he trades his crown for three seeds that are said to be from the Great World Tree itself. Can he find his mother and what she means to him? (40 pages. 15 illustrations.)The books were written by Iiro Küttner, an award winning screenwriter, playwright and professor of screenwriting at Aalto University, Helsinki. They were illustrated by Ville Tietäväinen, a celebrated author and illustrator whose graphic novels and other works have been published in numerous countries. The English translation is by Owen F. Witesman, working closely with the author.The books don't only discuss nature but we have made sure that they are also beautiful, environmentally friendly objects. The price includes:
Three artistic hardcover books printed on FSC certified paper from sustainable sources
Winner of Finland's Most Beautiful Book Series
Language: English
Intended audience: Grown-ups and mature children
25 trees planted
5 m2 (about 50 square feet) of forest protected
Comes in eco-friendly packaging
Carbon neutral home delivery included in price
A net positive product that increases natural resources
Delivery: June 2018
The trees planted will remove over 30 times the CO2 that the books' printing and transportations have released into the atmosphere, while the forests conserved protect over 20 times the natural resources that have gone into making them. The trees will be planted in tropical Africa to combat climate change, while the forest conservation is done in Finland. Attention, gift shoppers!While our products will be delivered in June 2018, if you are looking for a truly sustainable gift for someone, you can definitely get a Seed or our book series as a gift for someone! You can even download one of the following digital cards that explain what these net positive products are, how they help the environment, and when they will be delivered:
Digital card: The Seed (pdf)
Digital card: The Book Trilogy (pdf)
Digital card: The Seed & The Book Trilogy pack (pdf)
 Net Positive Products  Both the Seed and the book trilogy are made using our innovative net positive model. Working together with scientists, artists, designers and organisations around the world, we have come up with ways to create art & design that gives back to nature more than it takes out.We strongly believe that this is the future: products that increase natural resources, instead of depleting them. WhyOne scary word: overconsumption.Almost every product that you buy decreases natural resources.Even products that you typically consider green or sustainable actually do this. This is because when people talk about sustainability, they usually only think about material use. But the life cycle of a product has far more aspects to it: the resource use and emissions generated by the production, as well as the packaging and transportation of a product are often a totally overlooked strain on the environment and a major part of any product’s ecological footprint.Yet, we cannot make things out of nothing.Global consumption is currently almost twice what our planet can provide each year. This overconsumption drives climate change and biodiversity loss around the planet. Soon, we would need two planets to sustain ourselves. But we only have one.We want to combat this with products that give back more than they take out from the environment. HowOur net positive model allows us to put more back into nature than we take out.It follows the principles of net positivity that have been developed by the Net Positive Project, a collaboration between Forum for the Future, WWF, the Climate Group and other organisations.Our net positive model is the result of countless tests, designs and detailed calculations that we have done over the past years, and it will continue to evolve as we learn more and constantly seek better ways of doing things.You can read more about our model on our website, including details about the ecological impacts that the Seed and the book series have, and how the products are net positive.At the moment, our positive impact is carried out by tree planting and forest conservation. The trees are planted in tropical Africa where they have the best chance of combating climate change. This is done in collaboration with the US based NGO Trees for the Future. Meanwhile, the forests are conserved in Finland together with the Finnish Natural Heritage Foundation to increase local biodiversity and provide sanctuaries for animal species, resulting in a healthier planet.We will create more net positive art & design products in the future, while also diversifying our positive impact to cover more methods and regions around the world. WhoWe are a team of scientists, artists, designers and business people who want a better future for the planet.You can find more information about us on our website at talesbytrees.com. What can you do?In addition to backing us, you can support us hugely by telling your friends and family about our campaign! Every time you share our campaign it has the potential of doing good, while of course also helping our campaign. Thank you so much! FAQWhy do you cut trees? Why not use recycled wood?For the Seed, we use only certified, sustainably grown wood. Wood is a versatile, renewable material that is biodegradable and ecologically friendly. The trees felled for the Seed have grown to maturity and no longer sequester CO2 from the atmosphere with the rate that they did while growing. It is also important to stress that these trees come from managed, commercial forests, where cut trees are automatically replaced by new ones. We would never use wood from old growth forests, or indeed any wild forests. Finland is the most forested developed country in the world, with over 70% forest coverage, and our forests are currently used well below their sustainable capability.Naturally, we fully support the use of recycled and upcycled materials. For the Seed, we spent a lot of time investigating possibilities like naturally fallen trees (storm felled, etc.), recycled wood, as well as upcycled sources. The problem there is, however, that in our experience setting up meaningful production pipelines with these materials is still very challenging, indeed nearly impossible, especially if you want to maintain high-quality control, as we do. The reality also is that even if we used recycled wood, its manufacturing, as well as the production, transportation, packaging and everything else would still be accounted for as using natural resources and causing emissions. While recycled and upcycled materials definitely offer sustainability possibilities, ultimately they are no magic bullet, or in themselves net positive.That said, we will definitely continue to investigate recycled resources for future Tales by Trees products.Are the books printed on recycled paper?The books are printed on paper certified as FSC Mix. This is made from both recycled and sustainably grown sources, and gives us a great balance between sustainability and high quality paper fit for an art book.What about the packaging and delivery?All of our packaging is made from FSC certified recycled materials. We have designed our packaging solutions in a way that minimizes material use. For delivery, we use carbon neutral shipping worldwide.Why do you plant trees in Africa and protect forests only in Finland?While we are a Finnish company, the reason we have chosen to focus our planting efforts in Africa is that tropical trees grow faster and annually sequester far more CO2 from the atmosphere than Nordic trees do. As a result, tropical trees have a much bigger and faster impact on combating climate change than their Nordic counterparts. These trees also help local communities.Meanwhile, Finland already enjoys more than 70% forest coverage. Forests in the Nordics are also carefully maintained and currently used below their sustainable capacity. It therefore makes sense to focus our reforestation efforts on countries where forest coverage is much smaller and where the forests are currently far less sustainable. With that said, in the end, we do indirectly plant trees also in the Nordic Countries. Since we only use materials from sustainably managed forests, each tree felled is guaranteed to be replaced by a new one.The reason why we have chosen our home country Finland as our first conservation target has to do not only with logistics, but also with the types of forests that grow here. As mentioned earlier, Finland has plenty of trees and forests, but most of those forests are actually managed for use, and the number of protected wild forests could and should be higher. By protecting forests, we can increase local biodiversity and provide sanctuaries for animal species, resulting in a healthier planet.Our plan is to diversify our positive impact to cover more methods and regions around the world in the future.How do you prove your claims?Our calculations are available on our website. The linked page also includes information about tree planting and conservation partners. We want to be transparent about our model and warmly welcome any comments or suggestions that you may have.Why should I buy your products? Why not just donate to charity?It is not our intention to compete with organisations that do tree planting and conservation. On the contrary, we work together with them. Our mission is to create art & design that is not only beautiful to look at, but which is net positive and increases natural resources with every purchase.If your primary concern is tree planting and conservation and you do not want our products, we are the first ones to tell you not to buy them, as it would be a waste of natural resources to create something that you don't need. Instead, use your money directly to support the causes that you feel passionate about!But for anyone looking for home decor or inspirational books to read, our products are designed to offer a net positive option.Why art and design and not functional products?We are an art & design company. We strongly believe that art & design is at the heart of humanity, just like forests are the lungs of our planet. The books are where it all began for us, while the Seed feels like such a perfectly symbolic first product for our forest based company.Art & design objects also have long lifecycles and can last for generations, which is good for the environment. They bring comfort to your daily life and unite us as people. The Seed is a perfect conversation starter, just like it is a conservation starter. The book trilogy asks, what is your relationship with nature.Naturally, as art & design, these products are not for everyone, and that is fine. These things are, after all, a matter of taste.What about duties?In some part of the world, import duties may apply.EU: No import duties for any of our products.US: To the best of our understanding, there is no import duty on purchases for personal use when the value is under $800.Rest of the world: Please check with local authorities.Where can I learn more about Tales by Trees?You can find our website at talesbytrees.com and definitely check us out on social media as well! Especially our Facebook page is very active, with some 130,000 followers.I would like to write or talk about your campaign in my [insert media here]. How do I proceed?Sounds great! Check out our media page and get in touch!

story:
Hi I am Christopher Jackiewicz I will be cleaning up Lake Dolores in Newberry Springs California.

Why the funding is needed and where it's going?

Some people have asked how they can help clean up the 267.41 acre park which is planned to start in either Oct or Nov 2012 depending on weather. First the park has to rezoned from residential to commercial and conditional use permit has to be approved.

In the parks current state everything has to be brought in including power, food, water, and restrooms.  All funding will be used to help provide these needed services and equipment such as hard hats, gloves, brooms, trash bin rentals.

Everyone that contributes $5.00 or more will be given a signed 8 1/2" x 11" certificate of appreciation and have their name put the supporter wall at the park for all park visitors to see.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially I understand that, you can help in other ways.

Want to help in person or donate supplies or services to the clean up effort? Keep an eye on OasisThemepark.com for the dates and times. Then come on out I would be happy to meet you. I will be the really big guy with the long hair wearing the bright orange vest. Some days will be filmed for the documentary movie being made about Lake Dolores.  http://waterparkmovie.com/ so if you are camera shy just let me know.
 

You can also help by getting the word out by telling others.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools and tell your followers on twitter, foursquare, Facebook and other social sites what you will be apart of.

story:
THE GREAT LAW OF THE IROQUOIS CONFEDERACY -
In our every deliberation, we must consider the impact of
our decisions on the next seven generations.

 

THE STORY
The next generation has a better idea on how to run the family farm. Life on the Appleton farm is tough, and today, enough is enough. Hector, the eldest son and heir makes a once-in-a-generation decision to get off government tobacco subsidies to GO ORGANIC.

Between smoking his pipe and naps on the sofa reading comics, Gramps is out stealing real estate signs - a vain attempt at slowing down the encroaching suburbs. Sheriff Dan has him in his scope. Hector's sister, Cassandra, an anxiety-ridden self medicated teen worries how they'll rent the bees they're going to need to pollinate the orchard. Bee colony collapse disorder is just one thing setting her off today - white nose syndrome in bats is another. To calm down, she's discovered yoga with Tuvan throat singing and a side of alcohol. Granny just died of emphysema. Dad died 10 years ago. Enough. The tobacco is coming out and broccoli is going in.

Long Term: The episodic drama series will follow their journey to become fully certified organic.

STYLE - Magic realism
THEME - Resilience of the American farmer to overcome tragedy and adversity.
GENRE - Family Drama

 
THE BIG PICTURE

SHORT TERM: Fiction Narrative - Independent Film for Festivals (Colony Collapse)
LONG TERM: Back door pilot project - Production of episodic TV drama series (Seven Generations) based on these characters and their journey toward organic farming.
It's time for TV to go Organic.

This request is to fund production.

WHY
The power of story.
The Organic farming message can reach and engage a larger mainstream audience, sharing deep concerns about sustainability, healthy, organic farming.

THE IMPACT
Global Warming - threatens life on Earth. Climate change - it's already here.
There is no other dramatic TV series about farming issues. This project will spotlight farming practices, and inspire urgent action for essential species recovery. There's a revolution going on in local food production and distribution, farmers' markets, cooperative farm shares, direct sales to local restaurants and grocers - all in the name of reducing chemical-ridden, pesticide tainted, hormone and antibiotic infected farming which is destroying our health, our land and our future.

We hope more of us will do more to "make a difference," in every aspect of our lives.

Bee Colony Collapse Disorder - research continues for solutions to this worldwide phenomenon threatening agriculture.

FACT: No bees + no pollination = no food.

FACT: In 2009, the Federal Government funded $202,918,426 in tobacco farm subsidies.

FACT: Nicotine (tobacco crop) is just one ingredient in toxic pesticides affecting bee populations. Global Warming and Climate Change are another.
Documentaries about the environmental crisis may be award winning, but basically "preach to the choir."

Of great concern is our food supply and farmers having to sue conglomerate corporations to protect the genetic integrity of seeds.

In Anna Lappe's book, Diet for a Hot Planet, she makes it clear: industrial food production is killing us. Growing and eating locally is going to play a larger part in our survival. (Her mother wrote Diet for a Small Planet. Remember that book?)

PROJECT HISTORY
In 2009, I became very interested in the global bee crisis known as CCD,
colony collapse disorder, and wrote a one act play, Colony Collapse, about a brother and a sister on opposite sides of the argument: pesticide/agribusiness vs. organic/sustainable. The play garnered attention in a writing competition as a semi-finalist. This was encouraging so I re-wrote it as a short film. The new film version had two staged readings: private for members only through New England Script Writers, and public at the 1st Annual San Francisco Green Film Festival in March 2010. The San Francisco audience suggested it become a TV series, as those attending the reading wanted to know more about the characters, seeing great potential for story lines to encompass the various aspects of the food/farming revolution. The script continues to receive raves, and my writing group, Harvard Square Script Writers, has been instrumental in developing the script we will shoot this summer.

The script has been work-shopped, critiqued and put before test audiences and is ready to move into production.

SHARING A COMMON VISION
The right people show up!

From staffing and actors, to locations and equipment, people are joining the team.
We now have an organic farm for our location, two of our leading actors and one supporting actor. We have organic farmers, free range chicken and meat producers, a goat dairy, and a local bee keeper who rescues swarms, all wanting to participate from consulting to wrangling animals. Casting will continue as soon as funds are available for our LA casting trip. Key staffing will commence when we know what we can offer. We'll take this project to film festivals to build the audience in preparation to present this concept as an episodic drama TV series.

WHAT WE NEED
Money for production insurance, equipment rental, food, editors, actors and crew.

Everyone deserves to be paid for their work, including film artists. Many ingredients are a labor of love, and many necessities do show up, yet we still will need to feed the cast and crew. Editors just don't work for free. Neither does a Director of Photography. Also there are the costs of production insurance, permits, business papers and contracts.

Working with professional standards is a must. That means hiring professionals and assembling the best team the budget will allow.

WHAT YOU GET
Oh...the goose bumps of right action.

You know what we're talking about! When it works, it works.
At the junction of passion and commitment when the time is right and an idea is about time, we will use our combined talents and resources to make a difference, and "be the change we wish to see."

Please see the list of incentives - from a DVD copy of the final project and raffles for organic food, on-set visits and red carpet events, to IMDB producer credit and an opportunity to become involved as an executive producer on our core creative team. There are many ways to join us - and enjoy those goose bumps!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP - Help us MAKE SOME NOISE.

We need your help to Unleash DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others.'

If any of this has inspired you, please re-post this page link to your friends, your FB page, Tweet it, Sound it out!

If you would like to become involved on a deeper hands-on level, there is plenty to do. Please write and let us know what you'd like to work on - whether you are a director or director of photography, a post production supervisor, of if you have any resources to help us launch.

We can do this.

It's right action. We will use our combined talents and resources to make a difference, and "be the change we wish to see."

We will make this movie and we will take it to television.

Please, join us. Get on board. Just $25.

Weeds found an audience and we will too.

Our demographic is anyone who eats.

Similar shows include Northern Exposure, United States of Tara, Private Practice
