story:
Our Story

Local Surfers have developed a plan to restore and preserve Uluwatu from rubbish and sewage.
About the place:
Uluwatu, on Baliï¿½s Bukit Peninsula, was cemented into the surfing hall of fame when Rusty Miller and Steve
Cooney paddled out for the filming of Morning of the Earth in 1971
ï¿½ The combination of perfect reef formation, optimum swell
direction, and seasonally predictable winds has lead to
Uluwatu becoming one of the most highly visited waves on
the planet, with over a quarter of a million* surfers visiting
annually
ï¿½ Uluwatu has cultural significance for more than just surfers ï¿½
it is also one of the most sacred ocean temples in Bali. It is
deeply important for local communities and also attracts
many tourists to visit the site

The Impact

Without a rubbish collection system and sewage treatment plan, the problem will surely spiral out of control and this beautiful and magic place will one day be unsafe for surfers, ruining not only the livelihoods of residents but also the community pride of a place literally living off of waves. 


Our Vision: Turn the world famous Uluwatu Surf Break with its associated marine and land environments into a pristine and healthy Surf Heritage Area for the benefit of the Coastal Community for present and
future generations


What We Need & What You Get

We need funds and you get a clean and sustainable Uluwatu; something to be proud of.


Here's the breakdown:


We need an estimated $5000 US for the solid waste management which includes the collection bins including one large cement bin, salaries of three local ladies to collect rubbish and carry up the long steps, pick-up by ecoBali for recycling, education seminars for local businesses, composting facilities and storage containers for used cooking oil which is currently being dumped into the once beautiful ravin, now it's a cess pool. WE CAN FIX THIS!


The Liquid Waste Program is a much larger project that we've almost finished designing but have not yet implemented because of lack of funds. It will include waste water gardens and environmentally friendly processing tanks from BioSave of Bali. The total estimated costs is $50,000 US, but this is our first shot at indiegogo so we're just aiming for sustainability in the solid waste program.  




Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our website and facebook page: http://ecosurfrescue.moonfruit.com/ and http://www.facebook.com/ESRUluwatu

It will include waste water gardens and environmentally friendly processing tanks from BioSave of Bali. The total estimated costs is $50,000 US, but this is our first shot at indiegogo so we're just aiming for sustainability in the solid waste program.   




Other Ways You Can Help
Visit our website and facebook page: http://ecosurfrescue.moonfruit.com/ and http://www.facebook.com/ESRUluwatu

story:
What's at stake...

Hello, I'm Tim Tynan, producer, PhD student, and educator in Madison, Wisconsin. Like you, I'm concerned about the environment, tribal sovereignty, and the influence of big business in government. Today I'm especially wary of the mining dangers posed to one of the most precious and pristine ecosystems in the Great Lakes: the sloughs (pronounced "slews") at Bad River. 


The Bad River and Kakagon sloughs compose the largest undeveloped wetland system on the Great Lakes. Because of its size, uniqueness and varied plant life, the Kakagon Sloughs is a designated National Natural Landmark. The 16,000 acre Bad River-Kagagon complex is diversely populated with over 28 plant communities and is home to over 70 rare plant and animal species. Groups like The Nature Conservancy and the Bad River Watershed Alliance have been working tirelessly to maintain the quality of the watershed in partnership with the Bad River Band of Lake Superior Chippewa.  The Wisconsin Wetlands Association named the Kakagon-Bad River Sloughs one of Wisconsinï¿½s 100 Wetland Gems, noting the ï¿½extensive size and high quality of these Great Lakes coastal wetlands.ï¿½


But to the native people at Bad River, the sloughs are much more. Because of the abundant wild rice (manoomin) the sloughs are a cultural and spiritual treasure like no other. In fact, the meandering channels and bayou-like wetlands have been so coveted over the years, the Ojibwe have maintained a protective--almost secretive--relationship with the sloughs. But now, faced with perhaps the greatest threat the sloughs have ever faced, few people outside Bad River truly recognize what is at stake. 


The Short Films and Stunning Images

The video above is just a tiny sample ("teaser") of what we hope to accomplish with this campaign. The goal of this campaign is to produce the first in a series of visually impressive, short (10 to 15 min) films about the sloughs, wild rice, Bad River, and the people likely to be most impacted if a mine were to open in the vicinity. The goal is simply to impress upon others what is at stake here. The short films will join a larger traveling exhibit about the same topics and will also include live narrators, artifacts, and other stunning images. We hope the exhibit can start making the rounds later next spring. 


Your Contribution, Your Perk

Thankfully, nearly all the production time and work will be donated for this project. The $2400 is for licensing the footage, pictures, music, and compensating elder interviewees who participate in this first short film, "The Bayous of the North". 


Every contributor will receive a post-card thank you note featuring one of the images in the film. Contributors who give $25 will also receive a pound of hand-harvested wild rice from the sloughs. Those who give $50 will receive the wild rice and a limited-edition print of one of the stunning images in the film. If you give $100, you will receive the wild-rice and your print will be signed and framed! Want to be listed in the credits as an Associate Producer, then give $500-- you also get the wild rice and framed image! Executive Producers include anyone who gives $1000 and up.  In addition to the credit acknowledgement, wild rice and framed image, Executive Producers also receive a special recognition certificate to be included in the traveling exhibit.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this link and request others to share! This effort is so much larger than a fund raising campaign. This outreach and education initiative is critical to protecting the ecological and cultural treasures in and around the Bad River Indian Reservation.

story:
Our Story

Despite restoration efforts, over half of the world's mangroves have been destroyed by developers and others in recent times. Recife has beautiful mangroves. They protect coastal areas from erosion and offer a quiet marine region for young organisms, oysters, sponges, shrimps, mud lobsters and critical species of fish and birds. Come mid July I will be working for a nonprofit called Centro Escola Mangue in Recife in North East Brazil to raise awareness of their importance. Please support me in my efforts to conserve this important habitat.


The Impact

Supporting Centro Escola Mangue will ensure that the mangroves in North East Brazil are preserved for years to come.


What We Need & What You Get

The money raised will be 100% used by Centro Escola Mangue to raise awareness of mangroves and change behaviors among the people that have the most direct impact on their survival, in this case middle class people in Recife. 


Specifically, your money will be used to help educate children at school about the importance of mangroves, send a class of children to deforested areas to plant mangrove seedlings or create other materials to convince the people of Recife that mangroves matter.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make some noise about mangroves. More to come!

story:
Peterborough Greenspace Coalition

                                        PARKS NOT PARKWAYS

The Peterborough Greenspace Coalition is an alliance of four local citizens’ groups and numerous individuals, working to protect and preserve greenspaces in the City of Peterborough, Ontario. 

Our current campaign — PARKS NOT PARKWAYS — comes out of a common belief that Peterborough neither needs nor wants a new 4-lane, walled street through Jackson Park and the beautiful Parkway Greenspace and Trail.

We believe the Parkway is not a wise investment of over $66 Million of our tax dollars. We can think of many improvements the city needs more than an expensive new road. You may even want to keep your money in your pocket and not put the City further in debt.

Citizens have repeatedly said “NO” to the Parkway. The 1991 City Mayoral election was won on a “NO Parkway!” campaign. When given a chance to vote on the Parkway in a 2003 referendum, we said "NO" by a wide margin. Council then instructed City staff to remove the Parkway proposal from the City Plan, which was never done!

The current council has suddenly brought the issue back to life — spending over $1 Million on a so-called Environmental Assessment proposal which will cut a swath through historic Jackson Park. This would contravene an agreement with the Nicholls Trust, which donated the park, and the City's own by-law. As well, it would replace one of the City's most beautiful cycling and walking trails with a four-lane arterial road, and 2.5 km of sound walls (not to mention multiple new intersections slowing down traffic).

Our first Indiegogo campaign allowed us to print and distribute over 3,500  pamphlets, 300 lawn signs, 500 buttons and produce a beautiful and informative booth at the local GreenUp Expo.  We are about to launch the next phase of our campaign, to save Jackson Park and the Parkway Greenspace and Trail from being destroyed forever.  This is an expensive proposition and we need your continued support.

Every dollar raised in this campaign will be used for direct costs related to public awareness and community mobilization, under the management of the Coalition’s volunteer leadership. 

We do not have City coffers to dip into to fund our message.  Please join us with whatever contribution you can make.  For more information, to view alternatives to the Parkway, and to contact us, visit parksnotparkways.ca 

Please also order a sign, join our mailing list, come out to the November 20th public meeting at the Evinrude Centre, and call your Councillor to tell them what you think.

                     We do not want or need a $66 million walled street!

                                       Peterborough, it’s a natural!

                     Let’s keep it that way—green, natural, and beautiful.

story:
Hello, it's so nice to meet you!

Welcome!

Grow Organic Kids works on the ground with schools to visualize, strategize, layout and implement permaculture & sustainability principles to transform campuses into gorgeous, thriving living laboratories.

Inside these gardens (living laboratories), kids have a space to learn fun ways to experiment with growing their food while receiving education that aligns with the common core curriculum standards.

G.O. Kids also assists in the long term care and maintenance of every garden we help to implement.

This ensures that the process is enjoyable & simple for teachers and that this becomes a lasting solution for schools.

After months of connecting with businesses, school administration, teachers, students and parents, we have discovered ways to implement a successful program. With all of this information, our first garden is ready to take flight in our first pilot school,
Spring 2014!


What the Project Looks Like

We have created a permaculture-inspired layout for Calibre Academy that includes rainwater harvesting (collecting rain water), raised garden beds, compost bins, storage space and more.

In the first phase, we will teach the administration, teachers and students how to build raised garden beds and prepare the area for planting. 

In the second phase, the kids will begin experimenting and exploring garden vegetable options, seasonal plants and different organic fertilizers and other methodologies to keep pests out.

Additionally, our curriculum development team has created beta lesson plans that align with the common core standards. This means, traditional classroom based lessons will be moving outside into the garden for a hands-on experience.


How We Invest the Funds

Grow Organic Kids has an amazing team of passionate, savvy volunteers who are dedicated to making this first pilot school a model of excellence that can be replicated around the state and eventually, the country. 

The funds raised will be instrumental in helping us build the best!

Here is exactly where the money raised will go:

1. Materials for the raised garden beds;
*Wood, soil, compost, seeds, fencing, posts, tools, etc. 

2. Rain water collecting barrels and runoff systems

3. Composting bins for the cafeteria and for outside

4. Shed to store tools and materials

5. School starter kit (Including tools, 

6. Parent and community starter kits (educational and experiential materials for at home) 

7. Vibrant posters for the cafeteria promoting healthy eating and living


Your Impact 

Our first pilot school, Calibre Academy, has just over 700 students enrolled on their campus. Each student will have an opportunity to experience the garden and take this experience with them to their families and into their communities.

The immediate ripple effect is both exciting and necessary in building a generation of happy and healthy children who are empowered to make a difference in the world.

Moving beyond Calibre Academy with an excellent model will touch thousands and thousands of lives over the next several years.

Today, it starts with one.


Other Ways to Help

Thank you for coming by!

If you feel inspired by what's happening, please share it with family and friends via social media, e-mail or a good old fashioned phone call. :) The more friends, the merrier!

P.S. We  have excitedly collaborated with The Fusion Foundation as our 501c3 sponsor, so your donation qualifies as tax deductible (chat with your accountant to see if this works for you).

story:
1:1 Impact

When you buy your t-shirt, a child in need will be very happy to get one !

The mission is to make clothes, shoes and more to donate in the future.

The first donation will be for children. I hope to make contact to orphanages and homes for children in need, this year. The next big step will be shoes for refugee camps, where many people need shoes…

Anything you choose to do will help Activist and people in need !


This is it, Activist is my dream project. Buy your organic t-shirt, get 20% discount, free global shipping and support a person in need…1:1 !

The video above, is from the trusted factory, who will make our organic t-shirts. 

100% organic cotton | No child labor, only decent work conditions | Ethically Produced


I´m Martin, a 40 year old award winning photographer, connecting my dots…

I really want this project to happen, so I also offer personal art prints for nearly nothing. I´m also ready to guide you to become a better photographer on 1:1 basis and I offer a very good deal on photo sessions. View all the great perks on your right.

Helping others is my main drive with Activist. Here I can combine the beauty of helping people, while working with all the things I love: Charity, Photography, Design, Communication and Art. 

The 1:1 concept makes so much sense to me. One product sold, one donated to a human in need !

Activist is already looking into our next step: Shoes for people in need. With €20 contribution you support research, development and design of our first pair of shoes. A small contribution, with a big impact !

Activist is like a full circle, where, no matter what we do, we help others !


Our supplier ( Video ) is the most award winning organic clothing manufacturer that I know of and I did my research…



What We Need & What You Get

€ 14.300 is the goal. This is to make sure that Activist will get a good start. We need to order a high volume of t-shirts, from the factory, in order to get a good price. We offer 4 different t-shirt designs, to hopefully match something you like. We also pay for the donation to a person in need, each time a t-shirt is purchased. We give free worldwide shipping.

Love is the message. Love is fundamental. Love is all there is.

Love to other people, our planet, our future - with love we all come a long way !

If that´s a little too much for you, we made two other t-shirts with Activist logo.

You get about 20% discount from future retail price, when you order your t-shirt here.

As photographer, my work has won numerous international awards. My highlight is the APA American Photographic Artists Grand Prize, where my portrait was selected over 1800 images ! 

I have worked with and learned from masters like: Annie Leibovitz, Albert Watson and Ellen von Unwerth. What I´m saying is, that I know a thing or two about photography.

I´m ready to give you my best tips, advice and knowledge on a 1:1 basis via Skype and email. I will give you 10 hours of my time, all included for only € 500 !

I nearly give my personal work away for only: € 300 a 75x50 cm print. Any image I ever did is for sale. High-end Lambda print quality, made to last 100 + years !

I will be happy to guide you to make the right choice, send samples for your home or office. View some examples here:

https://www.facebook.com/print.screen.soby

You may also choose a photoshoot with 10 images for you, your family or business for only € 800 !

Premium Contributors are people or companies. For € 1000 we will include you on our Premium Contributor list on Facebook and also on our future website. You can add: name, logo and link. It will make you look good and it´s an inexpensive add for your company. View: https://www.facebook.com/activist.today to see our first Premium Contributor, click info and scroll down. Unlimited timeframe.

Unique Portrait

I will travel anywhere in the world and spend a day with you, to do your unique portrait. 

I will give you my full focus and attention to do my very best. Quality takes time...

This perk include:

Travel expenses.

Full copyright, I give you the full copyright. It´s a buy out.

1 unique 80x100 cm framed final art print. Museum standards. Aluminum board, acrylic glass or wood frame - you decide - I´m all yours ! € 3.000. 

- my strongest portrait ever won Grand Prize at APA, American Photograhic Artists. Seleceted over 1800 images ! 

Everyone will get what they asked for. You may contact me personally at any time: mail@martinsoeby.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Help share this campaign: http://igg.me/at/activist  - this is the most important link right now..

We also have a Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/activist.today

Please post links on Facebook, like our page, email your friends with our links, tweet, instagram etc…it all helps and it´s ok if you can´t afford to donate or purchase.

The copyright on all Activist images belong to me, so you are welcome to screen shoot and use them, you can also contact me for pictures, logo and interview for blogs etc.

Any press inquiries are welcome.

Thank you very much for your support, in any way !

I´m all in on this project,

Martin Søby

Activist Founder

mail@martinsoeby.com

story:
NOVI Africa is a 501c(3) non-profit organization and all donations are tax deductable.

Green Sky

100,000 Homes out of Darkness
150,000,000 kg CO2 Eliminated

Solar Benin Energy is an on-going off-grid electrification project of the U.S. based 501c(3) nonprofit organization NOVI Africa. Solar Benin Energy strives to improve the quality of life in rural Benin by providing access to affordable solar electricity. We insist on reliability and making electricity available to all.

We believe access to clean safe energy should be a right, not a privilege. Help us fight for this right.

                 

The Problem-

Miles away from such basic necessities as running water and electricity, the country of Benin, West Africa Needs Your Help to Improve the Quality of Life for Their Residents. 

Imagine daily life without your cell phone. Or your refrigerator. Or watching television.  Or listening to the radio.  Or even the absence of even one light bulb in your home. Now you can understand how challenging life is for the residents of Benin who had no access to such a basic human necessity as electricity – until now.  You can help make a difference and light up Benin.

While working on the ground in rural villages we have had the opportunity to meet Kristin Strong, a Peace Corps Volunteer. Her story moved us and is our inspiration for Green Sky Movement.

Here is a story she told us.

“Imagine your newborn smoking...? 

Working as a Peace Corp volunteer living in rural Benin, West Africa has opened my eyes up to things unimaginable. I live in Lahotan, a remote village that rests several kilometers away from running water and electricity. I help out at my health center a lot. During the first few months in village I witnessed my first birth. It went on late into the night. The sources of light used by the midwife were kerosene lamps. Several of these lamps were spread throughout the room. Smoke emitted by these lamps contains high amounts of black carbon polluting our environment and causing severe health risks. The first thing this newborn breathed in, was the smoke produced from these harmful kerosene lamps. I imagine the future of that newborn. Like any other child in the village, she would also one day be studying by kerosene lamps. But it doesn’t end there….

Mothers in Lahotan do household chores at dawn using these same kerosene lamps while watching after children. The black carbon emitted by kerosene lamps affects everyone; children, adults, and our environment. This is happening in villages all throughout Benin and Africa.”

                                                      

Our Solution: Green Sky Fund-

-Mini Solar System (MiSS)

We have designed an affordable unique solar electricity system called MiSS (Mini Solar System). MiSS powers up to 20 lights, television, cell phone, radio, and accessories. MiSS includes everything you need to power your home, making electricity available anywhere you go. With every installation of MiSS a family will have electricity for life. No expensive monthly electricity bills or power outages. No hazardous kerosene lamps polluting the environment.

  

                       

Green Sky Fund-

We need your support to produce 100 Mini Solar Systems (MiSS) to provide electricity for 100 African homes in need.

We are not an average solar company just bringing light to Africa. We go beyond. We help families light up their entire household. We help people have access to television and radios, which provides news and information that leads to knowledge and better education. We are here to improve people’s lives and help Africa move forward.

We need your support to raise $50,000 to launch our Green Sky Fund. The fund pays for home solar electricity systems to be produced, distributed, and installed. We aim to reach families throughout all of Africa. We do not hand out solar electricity systems to people. Majority of Beninese have incomes that allow them to repay the production cost of their solar system. The repayment of the first 100 units installed will fund the production of 100 more units, which will then go to 100 new households and the system will keep on giving. This is not a one-time project; your donation will constantly have an impact on improving family’s lives from year to year.

The $50,000 we are seeking will be devoted as follows:

Production of sufficient MiSS units for all of Benin: $30,000

Labor and materials to install all of the MiSS units: $12,000

Training and orientation for all residents to familiarize them with how to use the system as well as safety precautions: $8,000

For every 100 solar systems installed you will be helping our environment by eliminating approximately 150,000 kg of CO2 being emitted into the atmosphere. You will be bringing electricity to over 600 Africans. You will also help each family save on average $200, which would have been spent on diesel for generators, lamps, batteries, and candles. This means more African families will be able to afford to send their children to school. 

                                         We have the right technology. 
                                         We have affordable financing. 
                                           We have Solar Technicians. 
                                     With your support we will succeed.

     


Green Sky Team-

Oloufounmi Koucoi-Founder and Director

Herve Binazon-Program Coordinator

Kristin Strong-Campaign Manager

Gabin Koucoi-Solar Energy/Electrical Engineer

Jessica Fell-Regional Distribution Coordinator/Financial Advisor

To learn more about Green Sky contact okoucoi@gmail.com or kristinmariestrong@gmail.com or visit our website at www.solarbeninenergy.wix.com/english

story:
TICKETS: http://www.whaleextravaganza.com/tickets.htmlAly Laughlin in Provincetown, MA

THE STORY:

Aly Laughlin is currently planning a summer charity drag show which will take place in Provincetown, Cape Cod at the Provincetown Town Hall, during Whale Week 2013. The net proceeds from the event will go to the whale conservation efforts World Wildlife Fund and the Provincetown Center for Coastal Studies. 

The Venue: The Provincetown Town Hall

Aly has always been passionate about animals and conservation. At the age of 8, she had her first personal encounter swimming with a dolphin named Bailey at an interactive educational program in Bermuda. She loved it so much, she came back the next day and the teacher let her help teach the class. Recently, she decided that she needed to do something to address the strange (mostly negative) relationship humans have had with cetaceans [dolphins, whales, and porpoises] throughout history. She realized that the best place to start would be where she could embrace her love of these magnificent creatures -- and her love of drag artists -- in Provincetown, MA. This event will combine these loves, celebrating the relationship of humans and nature through art, beauty, and simplicity.

In conjunction with the Whale Extravaganza Drag Show, Aly has also launched her own non-profit organization, Whale Extravaganza Fund, Inc., which aims to celebrate and raise awareness for whales and other animals through all kinds of artistic endeavors; this is just the beginning.
 
Aly & Bailey
 
THE CAST:

Raja, "RuPaul's Drag Race" Season 3 Winner

Tammie Brown, "RuPaul's Drag Race" Season 1 & "RuPaul's Drag Race All Stars"

Jinkx Monsoon, "RuPaul's Drag Race" Season 5

Rainbow Frite, American Repertory Theater's The Lily's Revenge

Raquel Blake, American Repertory Theater's The Lily's Revenge

Brini Maxwell [HOST], "The Brini Maxwell Show" 

Left to Right: Raja, Tammie Brown, Jinkx Monsoon, Brini Maxwell, Rainbow Frite, & Raquel Blake
 

Having these fabulous well-known performers will help to exponentially increase the awareness of the need for conservation.
 

OPERATIONAL COSTS:

The operational costs for this event will include the performance fees, venue, lighting and sound, insurance, police detail, and all necessary licensing. For an event of this scale, we are keeping operational costs to the absolute bare-bones minimum, so that we can raise as much revenue as possible for the charities.
 

ABOUT THE CHARITIES THIS EVENT WILL HELP:

WORLD WILDLIFE FUND 

"WWF documents and protects critical feeding and breeding areas and migration routes of whales. We work to establish whale sanctuaries, help shift shipping lanes and curtail seismic surveys that disrupt feeding grounds. We strive to increase awareness of the need for whale conservation at national, regional and international levels.   We also create opportunities for local communities to be involved with and profit from whale conservation initiatives."
(http://worldwildlife.org/species/whale)

 

PROVINCETOWN CENTER FOR COASTAL STUDIES

"The Provincetown Center for Coastal Studies sits at the end of the land and the beginning of the sea.  Our vantage point, at the tip of Cape Cod, allows us to work in the midst of an extraordinary ecosystem where all things converge.PCCS has studied marine mammal biology and ecology since the 1970s. Our work has focussed largely on humpback whales and North Atlantic right whales, but has also contributed to the understanding of a range of other marine mammal species. 
Since 1984, the Center for Coastal Studies has freed more than ninety large whales from life threatening entanglements, using techniques developed by Center staff. The Center is the only organization on the east coast of the United States federally authorized, by National Marine Fisheries Service, to disentangle large, free swimming whales, such as the humpback and the critically endangered North Atlantic right whale. Over the years PCCS has also disentangled other marine animals, like dolphins and porpoises, seals and sea turtles."
(http://www.coastalstudies.org/who-we-are/mission.htm)

 

ABOUT THE PRIZES:

These prizes are all incredibly unique one-of-a-kind designs by Aly Laughlin herself. Not only will you be supporting a great cause, but you'll be rocking some fabulous trendy merchandise that everyone will be jealous of!

'Moby the Whale' Magnet (4"x6")

'Moby the Whale' Greeting Card (It's blank inside for you to use however you please!)
 
'Moby the Whale' Signature Tote Bag (100% natural cotton canvas)
 
'Moby the Whale' Signature Tote Bag (100% natural cotton canvas)
 
Mens 'Moby the Whale' TShirt (100% Ultrasoft Ring-Spun Cotton)
Womens 'Moby the Whale' TShirt (100% Ultrasoft Ring-Spun Cotton)
 
 
Mens 'Ned the Narwhal' TShirt
 
 
Womens 'Ned the Narwhal' TShirt
 
Mens 'Bailey the Dolphin' TShirt
 
Womens 'Bailey the Dolphin' TShirt
 
 
Mens 'Lizzy the Beluga' TShirt
 
 
Womens 'Lizzy the Beluga' TShirt
 
 
Mens 'Moby the Whale' Polo (100% extra heavyweight ring spun cotton)
 
Womens 'Moby the Whale' Polo
 
 
'Moby the Whale' iPhone 4/4s Case
 
 
 
'Ned the Narwhal' iPhone 4/4s Case
 

SIZING:

Bailey the Dolphin says: "Find your size here!" 

'Bailey the Dolphin'

LICENSING AND COPYRIGHT INFO:

Ned the Narwhal says: "We have obtained all necessary licensing for the images, videos, and music used on this page."

'Ned the Narwhal'

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Not everyone can contribute financially, and having just graduated from performing arts school, Aly understands this more than anyone. But you can absolutely help contribute in the following ways:

-Spread the word to your friends and family!

-Post a link to this page!

 

 

'Lizzy the Beluga'

story:
Please note: Indiegogo requires "Integers" for the amount. :-) For those of us that don't remember much of math class an Integer is a number without a decimal point. So $20 will work but $20.00 will not. Crazy huh? But that's how Indiegogo set it up. If you have questions on this please call us at 800.326.3524 and we will help.

Thank you for your consideration!

Scrappy Products is an American manufacturer of eco-friendly/sustainable fabric products. Scrappy is a division of Banner Creations an eco-friendly banner, flag and table cover manufacturer. Scrappy was born out of our responsibility to do the right thing for the environment and add another revenue stream in this extremely difficult economy for small business. We use our banner scraps and/or 100% recycled plastic water bottle fabrics to make our products.  What we do has had numerous positive environmental impacts.

  1. The fabric we use is made from 100% recycled plastic water bottles. How this helps; ten 1 liter bottles are up-cycled into fabric to make just 1 of our grocery bags.
  2. If the consumer uses a couple of our bags for a year instead of paper or plastic he/she is not creating the waste of an estimated 1200 throw away bags. Our bags are washable and dryable so you can use them year after year, unlike the ones made in China. That's a big impact one consumer can have.
  3. Our bags can be recycled, sent back to the mill and made into carpet backing.  But our Scrappy Products are very strong and durable so that won't be needed for a very long time.

Bag Styles

Our flagship bag styles are Tote, Grocery, Utility, and Zip Tote. Here are some of the marketing images we're using to headline our bags, including our ability to print custom designs from a customer's uploaded & print-ready artwork.

 

Our Next Steps

We need capital to purchase a new water-based (Eco-friendly) printer for our products. This piece of equipment is the core of our business and is critical. It would be our first purchase. We also need funding to purchase our American made raw materials. Finally, we need to develop a marketing plan that fits our vision while at the same time dramatically increasing sales. We need more than social networking to bring our product to market.

We launched the scrappyproducts.com website in July of 2012 and have had a small but steady stream of business. And we now have a very happy and loyal customer base that loves our products. We want to continue and accelerate that trend.

Please help us continue what we love to do and are so passionate about. With your help we can all do good for the environment.

story:
Update:  Our Indiegogo Campaign is Over, But We Are Still Taking Pre-orders For HayTag!


The interest in HayTag from distributors, resellers, and other partners has been overwhelming so we are pressing forward as planned with HayTag!  You can place a pre-order here and we will deliver your HayTag by March 30, 2013!

 

What is HayTag?

Think of HayTag as “dogtag 2.0” -- a better way to keep pets safe and secure using smartphones and a new long-range and lightweight wireless technology.  With HayTag, pet owners quickly locate a lost pet and get alerts when a pet leaves (or enters) a designated area. Owners can immediately organize a lost pet search among other HayTag users with their smartphone. And none of this requires invasive microchips or costly GPS collars.

1 in 3 Pets Go Missing, Yet Most Are Never Found

Every year, nearly 10 million pets go missing and according to the SPCA, the average recovery rate for lost dogs is less than 20%, and recovery rates for lost cats are less than 5%. Today, recovering a lost pet relies on outdated techniques like posting "lost" flyers in your neighborhood, calling local shelters and vets, and searching frantically by foot or car -- usually in vain. Some pets are "microchipped", but four competing microchip "standards" and only a 12" read range means the odds of your lost pet being recovered via microchipping are so slim many veterinarians do not even recommend spending the money. GPS-based collars are bulky, have a short battery life, and can cost more than $400 each, not including monthly subscription fees. There is a better way.

HayTag:  Easy To Set Up, Easy To Use

 

HayTag consists of a tiny, lightweight tag that you attach to your pet’s collar and activate with your smartphone using a small HayTag adapter. Upon losing a pet, HayTag users can quickly scan the neighborhood to locate their pet using the free HayTag application available on the iPhone AppStore. Don’t have an iPhone? HayTag also supports iPad and iPod Touch. HayTag does not require a fixed “base station” and there are no monthly or annual subscription fees.

Solar Powered = No Recharging or Replacing Batteries

With HayTag, you’ll never have to worry about recharging a battery or replacing a dead one. HayTag’s wireless technology, called DASH7, achieves long range with amazingly low power draw, making the use of solar power on long range wireless devices a reality.

Find A Lost Pet 

HayTag helps you find your pet using a unique direction finding feature and your smartphone’s map.  No more "lost dog" signs or random desperate searching.  HayTag's range is as much as 1 kilometer in the U.S., and even longer in many markets outside the U.S.  HayTag even finds pets located indoors and other places where GPS can't reach.

Be Alerted When A Pet Leaves The Premises

HayTag's wireless technology makes it possible to generate alerts when your pet leaves a pre-defined area.

Check On The Status Of A Pet At Home

Get peace of mind that your pet is where they should be, even when you’re away from home.  Or get an alert when a pet leaves the premises while you're away.

Create A "Posse" To Find A Pet

Invite other HayTag users to help with the search for your lost pet. Shrink the time to find a lost pet from days to hours or even minutes.

HayTag Rewards

Post a reward or earn reward money finding lost pets, get reward points, or just become a HayTag pet rescuer for the good karma points you’ll receive.

We Need Your Help!

We have dedicated the last 4+ years to developing and refining the wireless technology behind HayTag known as DASH7.  You can help bring HayTag to the world by being the very first to own one!

What People Are Saying

“We see far too many people devastated when they lose loved pets and they have only traditional – and largely ineffective ways – to find them,” said Scott Delucchi, Sr. Vice President, Community Relations, with the Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA in Burlingame, California. “Simply stated, Haytag can save lives and heartache and be a lost pet’s ticket home.”

"We rescue dogs on a monthly basis with no way to trace the owner. Giving your dog a HayTag not only provides him with a way to get back home if he's lost, but it gives an owner greater peace of mind." said Liz Frome of Golden Gate Lab Rescue - www.labrescue.org. "We plan on recommending HayTag to adopters so they can make sure if they get out they can be reunited quickly."

"HayTag Looks For Lost Dogs" - RFID Journal 

What is DASH7?

DASH7, the wireless technology behind HayTag, is a new "instant-on", long range, low power wireless communications standard for applications like short text messages or temperature sensor readings.  DASH7 is open source, inexpensive, and operates on a single global license-free frequency band, 433 MHz.  We believe it's the most important low power wireless standard in the world today.

DASH7 Was Designed for the Internet of Things!

DASH7 is unlike any other wireless technology standard on the planet today. 

• Long range.   DASH7’s range is many times greater than its next competitors, but also works so well indoors it makes meshing obsolete. DASH7’s range in the USA is between 200 meters and 1 kilometer, but in Europe, Australia, China, and many other markets, multi-kilometer ranges are easily achievable.

• Low power.   DASH7 uses less than 1 milliwatt of power on average. No other low power wireless standard can offer full two-way, long range communications using a solar cell like DASH7.

• Instant-on. DASH7 was designed to “lock on” to fast moving things or people in ways that other wireless technologies cannot match. DASH7’s low latency is enabled through a unique query architecture that minimizes the elaborate hand-shaking typical in wireline-based protocols like IEEE 802.15.4, Bluetooth, or WiFi.

• Inexpensive. DASH7 tags can be built very inexpensively using off-the-shelf components. DASH7‘s firmware stack compiles into less than 20KB, enabling the use of lower cost silicon and minimal memory. DASH7 uses a license-free, globally available frequency, 433 MHz, which reduces the need for multiple SKU’s and simplifies interoperability across vendors.

• Open source. There is nothing proprietary about DASH7, which is a complete open standard with open source firmware. No other wireless IoT technology in the world offers this same level of openness. There is even an industry consortium, the DASH7 Alliance, to ensure interoperability across DASH7 vendors. DASH7 was also built with interoperability at the forefront of our minds.

The HayTag App

The free HayTag app for iPhone will be available via the iPhone App Store and, later in 2013, via Google Play (Android).

The setup process is simple. You attach HayTag to your pet, along with the iPhone adapter we provide you. You download and turn on the HayTag application from the AppStore, and the application immediately recognizes the tag on your pet and prompts you to personalize the information on the tag. Then, you’re done. If you have more than one pet, it’s easy to repeat the process.

Our team has been developing and delivering mobile, desktop, and cloud-based software applications for nearly 20 years and we have yet to find a customer who said an app was “too easy to use”. Our goal is to make using HayTag as drop-dead simple as possible.

Also, the HayTag app supports the iPad and the iPod Touch!

Security

When we designed DASH7, we knew that security and privacy had been a weakness for many RFID and internet of things technologies of the past, not to mention for the next wave of location-based services. With HayTag, users just check a box during the tag setup process to enable AES 128-bit encryption, making it next to impossible for a stalker or other miscreant to monitor you or your pets while using HayTag. 

We also designed DASH7 with “listen before talk” capability, meaning your pet’s HayTag is NOT in some non-stop “beacon” mode, blasting its unique ID every 20 milliseconds, as some other technologies like Bluetooth might do. In effect, your pet’s HayTag stays “cloaked” until an authorized user (you and your smartphone) tell it to speak.

What Do I Get?

Each HayTag comes with an iPhone adapter or you can purchase multiple Haytags and multiple adapters if you have multiple pets or multiple owners. Each HayTag is ready to use right out of the box and if you ever need to purchase additional HayTags, they’ll all be interoperable with the same adapter and iPhone app we provide up front. We will offer free online support via the iPhone app as well as on our company’s website, but we are working to make HayTag so easy to install and use, we hope you’ll never need it.

Manufacturing

The HayTag is designed and prototyped in San Francisco and we have a trusted manufacturing partner in Southeast Asia with extensive experience building “battlefield tested” RFID devices. We will use standard, off-the-shelf parts in the HayTag with a pedigree of withstanding the occasional trampling by a tank or Humvee. Our team includes former team members from Savi Technology (now Lockheed Martin) and we know how to build the HayTag better, faster, and more cheaply than anyone else in the business. Our team also has deep experience in building mobile, desktop, and cloud-based software applications for consumer and enterprise markets, so building the HayTag app is among the simpler software projects we have ever executed.

How Our Indiegogo Funds Will Be Used

If we successfully fund this HayTag project, funds will be used for bringing the HayTag hardware to commercial readiness and to complete development of our iPhone app and back-end services. For the hardware, we want to continue to optimize the HayTag’s antenna to maximize its range, complete FCC and ERC certifications, and finalize the design of our tag and adapter motherboards. For the software, we have to complete development and testing of the iOS app and complete and test the back-end services required for some feature.

Developers

Our company is in the business of supporting developers who want to bring DASH7 to new applications and markets we haven’t even thought of yet. Developers are encouraged to back the HayTag project, including via the Developer Kit Pack, but also encouraged to visit our company website at www.haystacktechnologies.com, where we have a range of options to support developers of all shapes and sizes.

What Else Could You Do With HayTag?

We love animals and are thrilled with the response so far to HayTag from the veterinary, pet rescue, and pet owner community. But we know we’re only scratching the surface with this Indiegogo project. In addition to the ideas already being pursued by DASH7 developers in automotive and building automation, we see opportunities to solve everyday problems like tracking snowboards at a ski resort or golf clubs at the 19th hole. Or improving the way farmers manage herds of cattle or sheep. Or managing tools at a construction site. And hundreds of other applications.  So backing HayTag is not only the beginning of the end of the era of lost pets, it’s supporting a critically important wireless technology with world-changing applications that just aren’t being solved today with the wireless technologies that are out there.s

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes contributing money to a project just isn't possible - as entrepreneurs we really know what pinching pennies is all about - but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  1. Call, email, or message friends and family with dogs or cats and recommend HayTag!  Just send them this link:  http://ht.ly/fbJX7
  2. Tell "pet people" about us ... veterinarians, groomers, dog walkers, shelters, dog whisperers ... anyone who loves animals seems to really, really like HayTag once they learn what it means for animals
  3. Every Wednesday and Friday at 1:00pm EST we will tag a Tweet to make it trend. To work, we need your help! Please follow us and re-tweet the message: "Together, we can help save millions of animals www.indiegogo/haytag #haytag

Media

Members of the press:  you can find our media kit here. 

 

FAQ

1.  Is HayTag waterproof?  

Yes!  HayTag is waterproof and saltwater-proof.

2.  Is the signal that is emitted from the pet’s HayTag constant or only when you ping it?

The HayTag stays “invisible” until an authorized user (you, the owner) goes looking for it. There is no beaconing (unlike, say, Bluetooth) and we’ve really worked to build privacy and security deep into the product without sacrificing performance.

3.  Can my company use HayTag for tracking cows?

Yes!  We have received several inquiries on this.  The HayTag can be attached to the cow's ear like other cow tags using a "button" similar to existing cow tags.  HayTag also has an ambient temperature sensor to detect temperature in and around a cow's ear.

4.  When will the Android version be ready?

Summer 2013.

5.  I am having trouble using PayPal/some other funding mechanism on the HayTag Indiegogo page.  What should I do?

Send us a message at pat@haystacktechnologies.com and we'll help you figure it out!

6.  I want to become a HayTag distributor in my country/market.  What should I do?

Send us a note at info@haystacktechnologies.com and we will respond in the next two weeks.  

7.  Can I personalize HayTag?

Yes!  All backers will receive a questionnaire asking for a) how they would like their HayTag(s) personalized (animal name, your phone number, license #, etc.) as well as to select their choice of colors.
story_txt:
Update:  Our Indiegogo Campaign is Over, But We Are Still Taking Pre-orders For HayTag!

The interest in HayTag from distributors, resellers, and other partners has been overwhelming so we are pressing forward as planned with HayTag!  You can place a pre-order here and we will deliver your HayTag by March 30, 2013!
 
What is HayTag?
Think of HayTag as “dogtag 2.0” -- a better way to keep pets safe and secure using smartphones and a new long-range and lightweight wireless technology.  With HayTag, pet owners quickly locate a lost pet and get alerts when a pet leaves (or enters) a designated area. Owners can immediately organize a lost pet search among other HayTag users with their smartphone. And none of this requires invasive microchips or costly GPS collars.
1 in 3 Pets Go Missing, Yet Most Are Never Found
Every year, nearly 10 million pets go missing and according to the SPCA, the average recovery rate for lost dogs is less than 20%, and recovery rates for lost cats are less than 5%. Today, recovering a lost pet relies on outdated techniques like posting "lost" flyers in your neighborhood, calling local shelters and vets, and searching frantically by foot or car -- usually in vain. Some pets are "microchipped", but four competing microchip "standards" and only a 12" read range means the odds of your lost pet being recovered via microchipping are so slim many veterinarians do not even recommend spending the money. GPS-based collars are bulky, have a short battery life, and can cost more than $400 each, not including monthly subscription fees. There is a better way.
HayTag:  Easy To Set Up, Easy To Use
 

HayTag consists of a tiny, lightweight tag that you attach to your pet’s collar and activate with your smartphone using a small HayTag adapter. Upon losing a pet, HayTag users can quickly scan the neighborhood to locate their pet using the free HayTag application available on the iPhone AppStore. Don’t have an iPhone? HayTag also supports iPad and iPod Touch. HayTag does not require a fixed “base station” and there are no monthly or annual subscription fees.
Solar Powered = No Recharging or Replacing Batteries

With HayTag, you’ll never have to worry about recharging a battery or replacing a dead one. HayTag’s wireless technology, called DASH7, achieves long range with amazingly low power draw, making the use of solar power on long range wireless devices a reality.
Find A Lost Pet 

HayTag helps you find your pet using a unique direction finding feature and your smartphone’s map.  No more "lost dog" signs or random desperate searching.  HayTag's range is as much as 1 kilometer in the U.S., and even longer in many markets outside the U.S.  HayTag even finds pets located indoors and other places where GPS can't reach.
Be Alerted When A Pet Leaves The Premises


HayTag's wireless technology makes it possible to generate alerts when your pet leaves a pre-defined area.

Check On The Status Of A Pet At Home

Get peace of mind that your pet is where they should be, even when you’re away from home.  Or get an alert when a pet leaves the premises while you're away.
Create A "Posse" To Find A Pet

Invite other HayTag users to help with the search for your lost pet. Shrink the time to find a lost pet from days to hours or even minutes.
HayTag Rewards

Post a reward or earn reward money finding lost pets, get reward points, or just become a HayTag pet rescuer for the good karma points you’ll receive.
We Need Your Help!
We have dedicated the last 4+ years to developing and refining the wireless technology behind HayTag known as DASH7.  You can help bring HayTag to the world by being the very first to own one!
What People Are Saying
“We see far too many people devastated when they lose loved pets and they have only traditional – and largely ineffective ways – to find them,” said Scott Delucchi, Sr. Vice President, Community Relations, with the Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA in Burlingame, California. “Simply stated, Haytag can save lives and heartache and be a lost pet’s ticket home.”
"We rescue dogs on a monthly basis with no way to trace the owner. Giving your dog a HayTag not only provides him with a way to get back home if he's lost, but it gives an owner greater peace of mind." said Liz Frome of Golden Gate Lab Rescue - www.labrescue.org. "We plan on recommending HayTag to adopters so they can make sure if they get out they can be reunited quickly."
"HayTag Looks For Lost Dogs" - RFID Journal

story:
The Basics

My name is Jordan Flagel.

I am a graduate student at the University of Malta studying sustainable resource management. My focus is on protected area management in developing countries.

This is my focus because it is my passion.

My campaign is aimed at funding research for improving sustainable tourism in tropical forested protected areas, followed by the creation of a film to address and promote possible improvements in protected areas.

This is important to me because the protected area site where I will conduct this project, the Iwokrama reserve in Guyana, is a beautiful place with one of the most intact rainforests in the entire world and is home to some of the most amazing people I have ever met. 

I hope this will be important to you because areas like this aim to keep the multitude of trees and plants and other organisms protected. As many people already know, the tropical rainforesets of South America contribute a sizable amount of oxygen to the global atmosphere, but they are also important for regulating temperature, regulating rainfall, providing a home for the most biodiversity out of any region of the world, and they sequester more carbon dioxide than any other area in the world, effectively making them carbon sinks that take CO2 out of the air and store it.

The goal of conducting research on improving sustainable tourism in this area is to hopefully increase the amount of revenue protected areas can receive from these activities. This way, there would be less reliance on outside donor funding which is sometimes sporadic and often not enough. If protected areas do not have the funds to operate, the areas can become fair game for mining and logging, both of which are welcome financial opportunities in developing countries where a large percentage of these rainforests exist. 

With your help I hope to conduct this research and provide valuable information for sustainable tourism in protected areas.

The final goal is to see the Iwokrama International Center for Rainforest Conservation and Development self-sufficient and free of reliance on donor funding for operation.

Every little bit helps. 

It can be done!


What We Need & What You Get

  • $8500 is the funding goal
  • $1500 - $2500 will be used for the research portion of the project, including: hiring bush transportation in the Guyanese interior, lodging in the researcher bunks at the Iwokrama center in the reserve, bush food supplies, hiring rangers as guides, hiring boats to evaluate area, bush camping gear for overnighting in reserve, and forest user fee.
  • $3000 - $6000 will be used for creating the film documenting research and promoting sustainable tourism improvements. Funding will be used for similar expenses as the research portion, on top of more extensive travel within the interior by boat and off-road vehicle, extended hiring of rangers as guides, extended lodging on the grounds, equipment for filming (video, sound, storage), special equipment to keep video equipment dry in the rain, and transportation in Georgetown (where interviews will be conducted with head office staff and other Guyanese stakeholders). 
  • This project needs a minimum of $1500 to complete the research portion. The film portion could be completed with as little as $4500 (total); the amount available for filiming past this amount will determine the quality of the film. Since I plan on using this film for promotional purposes in an attempt to improve the Iwokrama center and eventually sustainable tourism in other similar areas, I would like to make a better quality film and that is why the goal is $8500
  • A small portion of funding will be used to acquire and distribute the perks that will come from Guyana
  • Any funds beyond this goal with either be invested into making the film even better or put directly into the Iwokrama center itself as a community development investment
  • ALSO the perks for contributing to this project are pretty unique, at leas the ones that will come from Guyana. Having your name as a producer in the video , and receiving a hard copy of the video would be pretty cool too!

The Impact

Protecting the Iwokrama reserve not only impacts the faraway land of Guyana.

It impacts the people of a developing country who should financially benefit from their rainforest - for its natural beauty rather than its mining potential.

It impacts the tropical rainforest region - if a sustainabel tourism program can be put in place that leads towards less dependance on donor funding, other protected areas can follow suit and create a positive chain reaction

It impacts people in the developed world, who use more energy and emit more carbon dioxide - with more intact rainforest, more carbon is sequestered in the trees

It impacts the planet - every protected tree on this planet has a positive impact

 WE ALL NEED TREES #WANT

Risks & Challenges

There are naturally a few (OK, maybe more than just a few) risks involved with conducting research and filming in a subburb of the Amazon rainforest. Fortunately, I have been there before and have learned from other's (and my own) mistakes:

  • I have helped conduct FIM (forest impact monitoring) on the effects of sustainable timber harvesting in the SUA area (3% of the total reserve)
  • I have conducted water quality sampling in the Essequibo river that runs through the Iwokrama reserve
  • I have spent several nights in a row in the bush, smack dab in the middle of the reserve with nothing more than a hammock, a mosquito net, and some grains
  • I have consulted with other groups that have come through the Iwokrama reserve to make films, most notably documentaries on the vast biodiversity of the area
  • I know the people that reside in the villages on the outskirts of the reserve very well, and they will help me along the way with this project, just as they have in the past

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps! Even $10 can be of great value to the project.

If you cannot afford anything monetary, simply spreading the word to people who can, or people who are passionate about rainforests, or passionate about Guyana, or both, would help a great deal too!

I am a believer that word of mouth is still effective, so please in addition to sharing online, just mention or speak about this project or even the broader issue at hand. Awareness is knowledge and knowledge is power!

The Impact Protecting the Iwokrama reserve not only impacts the faraway land of Guyana.It impacts the people of a developing country who should financially benefit from their rainforest - for its natural beauty rather than its mining potential.It impacts the tropical rainforest region - if a sustainabel tourism program can be put in place that leads towards less dependance on donor funding, other protected areas can follow suit and create a positive chain reactionIt impacts people in the developed world, who use more energy and emit more carbon dioxide - with more intact rainforest, more carbon is sequestered in the treesIt impacts the planet - every protected tree on this planet has a positive impact WE ALL NEED TREES #WANT   Risks & Challenges There are naturally a few (OK, maybe more than just a few) risks involved with conducting research and filming in a subburb of the Amazon rainforest. Fortunately, I have been there before and have learned from other's (and my own) mistakes: 
I have helped conduct FIM (forest impact monitoring) on the effects of sustainable timber harvesting in the SUA area (3% of the total reserve)
I have conducted water quality sampling in the Essequibo river that runs through the Iwokrama reserve
I have spent several nights in a row in the bush, smack dab in the middle of the reserve with nothing more than a hammock, a mosquito net, and some grains
I have consulted with other groups that have come through the Iwokrama reserve to make films, most notably documentaries on the vast biodiversity of the area
I know the people that reside in the villages on the outskirts of the reserve very well, and they will help me along the way with this project, just as they have in the past   Other Ways You Can Help Every little bit helps! Even $10 can be of great value to the project.If you cannot afford anything monetary, simply spreading the word to people who can, or people who are passionate about rainforests, or passionate about Guyana, or both, would help a great deal too!I am a believer that word of mouth is still effective, so please in addition to sharing online, just mention or speak about this project or even the broader issue at hand. Awareness is knowledge and knowledge is power!

story:
June 18 update: A huge thanks to everyone for helping us to surpass our fundraising goal! We are now busy working on fulfilling the perks and look forward to sending them to donors! The campaign is now closed, but if you would still like to help, please consider donating through Canada Helps: https://www.canadahelps.org/services/wa/dnm/en/#/page/2824

--

The Experimental Lakes Area (ELA) is a freshwater research facility in Northwestern Ontario, Canada that has operated as a government research program for over 45 years. After the Canadian Government announced that it would no longer fund the ELA program, operations were transferred to the International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) in April 2014. IISD now needs additional funding to expand ELA’s vital legacy of research so that it can continue to find effective solutions to environmental problems affecting fresh water.

We can thank the ELA for many of the improvements we have seen in recent years to the quality of the water we use daily. ELA’s whole-lake research findings have been instrumental in the phase-out of harmful phosphorus additives in cleaning products, tightening air pollution standards in response to acid rain threats, and proposed installation of scrubbers inside industrial smokestacks to reduce mercury levels found in the fish we eat.

The ELA features a collection of 58 small lakes, as well as a facility with accommodations and laboratories. Since its establishment in 1968, ELA has become one of the world’s most influential freshwater research facilities. In part, this is because of the globally unique ability at ELA to undertake whole-ecosystem experiments.

There is nowhere else in the world that has the same potential to conduct this type of research and make such a positive impact on our world’s freshwater supplies.

What We Need

Now we need your support.

As IISD takes over the Experimental Lakes Area, initial funding has been secured to manage the facilities and conduct a minimum amount of research, and for this we are grateful.  It is our goal, however, to rebuild the program to its former status and to help it expand and thrive. We are also striving to reduce the ELA’s reliance on government support so that it may never again be shuttered because of changes in policy. This will help us understand and address global freshwater challenges and communicate what we have learned to improve understanding, education and decision making.

Your generous donations will help us create and benefit from numerous educational and training opportunities for university students at the ELA. 

The ELA offers great potential for the scientists and researchers of tomorrow to garner hands-on research experience and gain practice in driving and conducting research projects. In turn, the facility benefits immensely from the hard work and research generated by summer students.

As part of the new era for ELA that IISD is ushering in, we plan to expand its role to include training, workshops and field courses that will educate and benefit local communities, as well as the greater scientific community.

Charitable tax receipts can be issued for donations over $25 (minus the fair market value of the perk).

If you wish to donate without receiving a perk, please consider donating through Canada Helps: https://www.canadahelps.org/services/wa/dnm/en/#/page/2824

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways for you to help ensure the ELA reaches its maximum potential to research and educate. If you are unable to make a financial contribution, you can still help us out by:

  • Sharing information about our Indiegogo campaign and the work that ELA does with your networks and your social media followers.  You can also use Indiegogo Share Tools.
  • Volunteering some time to help us with our Indiegogo campaign at our Winnipeg office.

To learn more about how you can help the campaign, please contact Karla at kzubrycki@iisd.ca.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there potential contributor, my name is Steffan Rusche, and I am looking to re-establish a small eco lodge in Mozambique, on a stretch of coast line called Tofo. An engineer by profession, I have always wanted to do something that would have less impact on the environment, as well as give people a place to come and rejuvenate from all the stress we pick up during our annual work routines.

Mango Beach, the Eco Lodge, is now going through a renovation, including the need for alternative energy solutions to provide power to the lodge, namely Solar power and natural borehole water, to ensure no further pollution creeps into this unspoilt part of the country.

Most of everything we are using at Mango Beach, from construction to service, either comes from natural products, has been produced by local communities or is a service provided by the local community. By doing this we aim to improve the overall living conditions and enrich their lives.

With your contributions to our project, you would be providing the local community and us with the means to make a difference, and perhaps for you to be able to take a trip and enjoy your contribution efforts too.

White tropical beaches, coconut palm groves, pure paradise, around the corner from relaxed Tofo Beach, you'll find peaceful Mango Beach.  Forget about finding us on your road map, but for those techno junkies out there GPS does work here.  This is the setting for Mango Beach - a utterly peaceful resort in popular Tofo, Mozambique - one of the worlds best dive destinations, offering you an abundance of sea life, including Giant Manta rays, whale sharks, and sperm as well as hump-back whales. You are guaranteed the holiday of a lifetime - whether you want adventure and action, a relaxed sun-drenched chill, or even a total "pig-out" on local seafood.

Tofo is part of the Inhambane province, and the town of Inhambane is rich in culture as well as history, dating back to when Vasco Da Gama landed on theses shores many centuries ago.


What We Need & What You Get

Here it is in a nut-shell, or is that Coconut shell?:

  • The land has been purchased now, so we need $55,000 to be able to refurbish the existing structures in the following Areas:

     - Provision of Solar Power - $25,000

         - Refurbishment material $10,000

         - Local Labor $10,000

         - Sinking of Borehole and accessories (Pump) $10,000

    • Regardless of whether we reach our target goal for funding or not, the collected funds will still go towards the project as outlined. It would however mean that progress is slow and that we would have to try alternative measures to get investors on board to fund the community growth.


    What will you get - For every $500 donated, we will give you a 7 day stay at the lodge, to be used from March 2015 onwards. You will have full use of a 4 sleeper Casita, in one of the most unspoilt areas on the coast line.

      The Impact

      High impact on reducing carbon footprint, and assist with the local community in provision of work, and related services:

        Risks & Challenges

         Naturally with a project such as this, there are risks, so what are ours:

        Not enough funding to see the project to completion, impact will mean that the loacl community needs to migrate to other regions to find work.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you are not able to help financially, but perhaps know others that would be able to contribute, please:

        • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
        • Please make use of the Indiegogo share tools to share this opportunity!

        And that's all there is to it, see you in Tofo!

story:
One Goody filter lasts for enough water to fill 1000 single use plastic bottles!!

Buy now and get our "Early Bird" Special!

 

The Goody story began more than a year ago.  The owners had a desire to help provide a clean safe drinking water solution to Hong Kongese. They heard no one can drink water from their taps in Hong Kong, so they went to see it for themselves.

Upon their return they learned more about the incredible situation that is facing many people in Canada, especially in the First Nations communities. Over 60% of First Nations communities are under a boil water alert.
 
A decision was made to concentrate all of Goody's efforts into helping to create awareness and solutions for Canada's drinking water crisis.
  • Goody Water filters can remove up to 99% of contaminants found in drinking water including lead and mercury
  • Goody Water filters retain traces of beneficial minerals such as calcium, magnesium and potassium
  • Goody Water filters deliver up to 150 gallons of safe, pure water, replacing more than a thousand plastic bottles
  • Goody’s products are all made with Ionic Adsorption Micron Filtration technology – the most tested water filtering technology on the market
  • All of Goody’s products are tested to NSF/ANSI standards using 42 & 53 EPA protocols
  • All Goody plastics are BPA free and FDA approved

See it work for yourself.

Our Mission

Producing Goody Water Filtration system was the first step in our mission to provide Goody quality water to the planet. Through science and innovation, we are focused on providing the highest quality - safe and clean drinking water to all of our customers. Goody’s commitment to the First Nations people of Canada will supply provide filtration systems to communities who don’t currently have access to clean drinking water. We allow people to live healthier, better lives.

Each Goody Water Filtration product enables the user to filter water from any source – clean or not. With the Goody Water patented filtration system, the user can easily, quickly, and conveniently remove 99% of all contaminants. Our filter removes more pollutants and is more effective than any other filter on the market.

In Canada, contamination and inadequate water and sanitation services in First Nations communities is a real and present threat to both human health and the environment. Many of these communities have been forced to evacuate their homes because of poisoned water.

Goody’s program of action will deliver filtration products to First Nations communities who are in need of clean drinking water. For each Goody Water bottle sold, a portion of the proceeds will be donated to provide these communities with Goody Water solutions. In doing so Goody Water hopes to build awareness about Canada’s drinking water crisis!

How will we do this?

Goody+Right to Play 

​

 

We have teamed up with Right to Play and their PLAY program. Right To Play is  a global organization that uses the transformative power of sport and play to engage  some of the world's  most at-rísk  youth, with a focus  on improving outcomes linked to health, education and peaceful  communities.

Right To Play's  Promoting Life-skills in  Aboriginal Youth (PLAY)  works with over 85 lndigenous  communities and urban organisations to co-desígn youth  programming that meets the specific needs of the  community around issues  related to  health, mental wellness,  education and  employability. Many  of the communities we work with  continue to struggle with clean water and Goody  Water's filtration system has the potential to address  this issue  moving forward. To that end, Right To Play and Goody Water have shared values and goals around supporting Canada's indigenous communities.

"On behalf of Right To Play Canada, I would like to express our support for Goody Water and their vision for  providing clean water to First  Nations in Canada that are struggling with unclean drinking water and long-term boil-water advisories. Goody Water's values are aligned with Right To Play's goals for  supporting the healthy development of children and  youth and  we look forward to  developing a  mutually beneficial partnership moving forward."

 Todd Hogan

 Deputy National Director, Right To Play Canada

 

 

Our Launch In Canada!

Goody Water bottles are environmentally safe, reusable and recycable. They will not leach and are BPA free.

Goody Water filtration products are designed specifically to ensure the water you drink is great-tasting, fresh and clean – regardless of the source.

Each year it takes millions of barrels of oil to produce and transport bottled water. If you were to fill one quarter of a plastic water bottle with oil, you would be looking at roughly the amount of oil used to produce that single bottle. The Earth Policy Institute estimates that the energy used to pump, process, transport and refrigerate bottled water is over 50 million barrels of oil annually.

 

Reasons to be happy about GoodyGoody's Goal

Currently the Goody products are manufactured in the United States.  When we reach our campaign goal we want to produce the bottles in Canada.

The Goody Products:

 Aska 

The Aska bottle is ideal for children or those who prefer a smaller bottle. You can easily place it in your backpack, lunch bag and take it with you on your bike.

Highlights of the Aska Bottle:

  • Holds up to 591 ml of water
  • 100% BPA free, non-leaching plastic
  • Lasts up to 150 Gallons (or over a thousand 500 ml bottles of water)
  • Great for everyday use – removes up to 99% of all contaminants including chlorine & heavy metals
  • Great for saving money – save hundreds of dollars on bottled water
  • Great for the planet – eliminates the waste of single-use plastic bottles

 

 

Kanatan 

The Kanatan bottle is ideal for any activity: indoor/outdoor sports, leisure, camping or hiking.

Highlights of the Kanatan Bottle:

  • Holds up to 828 ml of water
  • 100% BPA free, non-leaching plastic
  • Lasts up to 150 Gallons (or over a thousand 500 ml bottles of water)
  • Great for everyday use – removes 99% of all contaminants including chlorine & heavy metals
  • Great for saving money – save hundreds of dollars on bottled water
  • Great for the planet – eliminates the waste of single-use plastic bottles

 

TIPI

The Goody pitcher fits into your refrigerator at home, the cottage, RV or boat. It is ideal for drinking and cooking.

Highlights of the Tipi bottle:

  • Holds up to 3 L of water
  • 100% BPA free, non-leaching plastic
  • Lasts up to 150 Gallons (an average of 6 months with municipal water)
  • Flip-top lid for easy filling
  • Cook and drink without worrying about water quality

 

Behind the scenes with Cody.

story:
Who we are.

Oyate Wahacanka Woecun was created to address the threats posed by the KXL pipeline. We are here standing up to protect the Land,  Water, Resources and People of the Rosebud Sioux Tribe. 

We need help continuing the fight against KXL! 

Can a Tipi Stop a Pipeline?

Keystone Tar Sands / XL Pipeline. Nearly everyone is familiar with these words and most have an opinion about what they represent. For those who are willing to sacrifice the very things which make life possible on this planet, it’s personal wealth and power. For a vast majority of people it simply means saving a few cents at the gas pump. But for those who have studied the short and long term effects of what these words represent, their conclusions are much more grim.

Reputable scientists from all over the world have made their findings on these projects known to the governments of the United States, Canada and the United Nations. Findings, which incidentally, are in agreement with the beliefs and ancient knowledge of the First Nations people of the American continents. Simply stated, the findings indicate that we are putting the ability for living organisms to survive on this planet at grave risk. The indigenous peoples have long understood the relationship of man and nature. Ironically, it is these very people who now bear the brunt and negative effects of these projects.

The original rights and lands under treaty with federal governments have been discarded and relegated to so called “Sacrifice Zones.” As a result, the health and safety of the men, women, and children living in these areas have been ignored and abused.

Now, the people of the First Nations are organizing to protect and shield the people, natural resources and cultural heritage from the devastation, knowing that it is not only their small corner of the world they are protecting, but the very survival of the entire living organism that is Mother Earth.

Resistance to this threat is underway.

The Lakota and their allies are rising to the challenge with several carefully calculated actions, one of which is to organize and erect spiritual tipi camps to stop progress along the pipeline right-of-way. We intend to prevent the historical devastation of the “man camps” with their victimization of women and children on the reservations. We will use the legal and moral authority of the First Nations peoples to protect significant spiritual and burial sites which are at immediate risk. These cultural and historical landmarks, some of which record ancient scientific observations not yet discovered by modern researchers, are of great importance to the overall understanding of our human experience. These are surely as important as those in other parts of the world, of which the recent destruction has caused alarm and outrage all over the globe. Our government spends millions of dollars to protect cultural sites in other countries we occupy while it issues permits for the destruction of similar sites in the heartland of American for corporate profit.

The XL pipeline is the current leading threat to the survival of the planet and these spiritual tipi camps are our best opportunity to stop it. Lakota men and women are putting their lives on the line for all of us, and they need your help.

Imagine the challenges facing those willing to risk everything to do what is so necessary. Food, medical attention, fuel, communications, transportation, security and support for the families are all desperately needed and these sacrifices are occurring in some of the most economically deprived areas of the United States.

We need your financial assistance.

We need you to spread the word to your friends, social networks, media contacts, political representatives and anyone else who can help. With every dollar you spend, you can choose how to spend it. We ask that you consider the the greater good of your planet and it’s inhabitants.

Please, we need your help now.
