For a vast majority of people it simply means saving a few cents at the gas pump. But for those who have studied the short and long term effects of what these words represent, their conclusions are much more grim.Reputable scientists from all over the world have made their findings on these projects known to the governments of the United States, Canada and the United Nations. Findings, which incidentally, are in agreement with the beliefs and ancient knowledge of the First Nations people of the American continents. Simply stated, the findings indicate that we are putting the ability for living organisms to survive on this planet at grave risk. The indigenous peoples have long understood the relationship of man and nature. Ironically, it is these very people who now bear the brunt and negative effects of these projects.The original rights and lands under treaty with federal governments have been discarded and relegated to so called “Sacrifice Zones.” As a result, the health and safety of the men, women, and children living in these areas have been ignored and abused.Now, the people of the First Nations are organizing to protect and shield the people, natural resources and cultural heritage from the devastation, knowing that it is not only their small corner of the world they are protecting, but the very survival of the entire living organism that is Mother Earth.Resistance to this threat is underway.The Lakota and their allies are rising to the challenge with several carefully calculated actions, one of which is to organize and erect spiritual tipi camps to stop progress along the pipeline right-of-way. We intend to prevent the historical devastation of the “man camps” with their victimization of women and children on the reservations. We will use the legal and moral authority of the First Nations peoples to protect significant spiritual and burial sites which are at immediate risk. These cultural and historical landmarks, some of which record ancient scientific observations not yet discovered by modern researchers, are of great importance to the overall understanding of our human experience. These are surely as important as those in other parts of the world, of which the recent destruction has caused alarm and outrage all over the globe. Our government spends millions of dollars to protect cultural sites in other countries we occupy while it issues permits for the destruction of similar sites in the heartland of American for corporate profit.The XL pipeline is the current leading threat to the survival of the planet and these spiritual tipi camps are our best opportunity to stop it. Lakota men and women are putting their lives on the line for all of us, and they need your help.Imagine the challenges facing those willing to risk everything to do what is so necessary. Food, medical attention, fuel, communications, transportation, security and support for the families are all desperately needed and these sacrifices are occurring in some of the most economically deprived areas of the United States.We need your financial assistance.We need you to spread the word to your friends, social networks, media contacts, political representatives and anyone else who can help. With every dollar you spend, you can choose how to spend it. We ask that you consider the the greater good of your planet and it’s inhabitants.Please, we need your help now.

story:
Hello,

Oslo Apiary came about when two friends wanted to work more outdoors. We hoped to create value-infused part time jobs for ourselves and envisaged Oslo Apiary as a mash up between inner city environmental protection, urban agriculture and cultural entrepreneurship.


Our apiary produces short travelled, locally produced, pesticide free, organic honey and beeswax that we sell to local breweries and cocktail bars to cover our expenses. We invite friends who work in creative fields, musicians, film makers, artists, antiquarians and even the odd male choir, to partake in our plight and pay them in produce.



The small patch of land we've been using so far - a round about of sorts - is to become a building site. But we've been lucky enough to be offered a spot on the roof of the Artists House (Kunstnernes Hus), downtown, near the royal castle and its surrounding park. Please help us invest in two new hives for this site, by funding our project.


Here is the plan:
By helping us reach our goal of 1600$ (9900NKr / 1180Euro), we will be able to expand our beekeeping on the roof of the Artist House and permanently finance Oslo Apiary through cooperation with the house own basement brewery.


This would let us reach all of our goals in one go:

- The two new hives will help keep the downtown area of Oslo, green. 

- The honey they produce will be Oslo´s shortest travelled food product, with a travel distance of 30 feet, vertically. 

- The collaboration with the Artists House will let us grow conceptually, and give us a much needed arena for arranging events and networking.

With our goal reached, we will also be able to have our film crew film us for another season, as we make the transition, and keep you updated on our progress. A third of the sum goes to them.



Bees help keep our city green. They supply bird song through being eaten. Plants filter our air of dust and pollutions. Local honey alleviates allergies. Through pollination our apiary keeps wild bees, bumble bees, plants an insects from going extinct. Join us in our work. Urban beekeeping might be costly and hard to make money off, but letting the small critters go extinct could be costlier. 

During our first year we spent 550$ on the brand design and marketing of Oslo Apiary, 1050$ on making this video for Indigogo and other promotional uses, and 1600$ on the bees, their hives, paint, suits, transport and equipment, such as a smoker, cube irons, honey jars and plastic barrels. If we pass this years Indiegogo goal of 1600$, the surplus will be used to commission eco-art for future Oslo Apiary events at the Artist House.

Thanks for your support. And wish us luck ❂╮

Photo credits: 
1&6: Michael Behrens
2,3&4: Oslo Byrøkt
5: Anna Leijonhielm
Location: Herligheten ByBigård

PS - Perk correction:
Not only the second contributor, but all contributors who fund us with 160$, will receive a seasonal membership at Kunstnernes Hus!

story:
Hi, I am Dean Cutler the Quarter Master for the VFW Post 6017 located in Pentwater, Michigan.

The post is becoming as energy efficient as possible.

This involve changing the lights to LED type, the refrigerators to Energy Star type, adding solar hot water system and much more.

This will make our bottom line better, in turn we can give out more.

Also this will help the world be a better place.

We are designated  as an Red Cross Emergency shelter.

We are available free for funerals.


THANK YOU for your help!


UPDATE:

We have installed overhead LED lighting in our meeting & main room.  Also we have installed power savers on the service panel.

So far our power usage is down 30% from last year.

story:
CONSULTA LA SEZIONE UPDATES PER RIMANERE AGGIORNATO SUL PROGETTO ORTHOCULTURA.

Questa è la seconda campagna di crowdfunding che effettuiamo su Indiegogo. La prima, consultabile al link www.indiegogo.com/projects/ortho-cultura , aveva come obiettivo 1700 $ e, nonostante il supporto di decine di persone, si è chiusa a 275 $. Il vostro contributo ci ha permesso di acquistare una parte dei materiali e iniziare la fase di montaggio dell'installazione. Questa seconda campagna ORTHO CULTURA -construction-  ha lo scopo di ottenere i restanti 1425 $ in modo da permetterci di acquistare i materiali rimasti e completare il nostro progetto.

This is the second crowdfunding campaign we carry on Indiegogo. The first, available at the link www.indiegogo.com/projects/ortho-cultura , had as its goal $ 1,700 and, despite the support of dozens of people, ended at $ 275. Your contribution has allowed us to buy some of the materials and to begin the assembly phase of the installation. This second campaign ORTHO CULTURA -construction- aims to get the remaining $ 1,425 in order to buy the remained materials and complete our project.

Se hai già contribuito al progetto ORTHO CULTURA e sei curioso di sapere come procede il nostro lavoro, guarda il video qui sotto. Se invece è la prima volta che senti parlare di orto urbano e agricoltura sociale, continua a leggere e scopri perchè abbiamo bisogno del tuo contributo! 

If you have already contributed to the project ORTHO CULTURA and you're curious to know how our work goes, watch the video below. If it is the first time you have heard of urban farm and social agriculture, read on and see why we need your support!


Siamo Edoardo e Carlo, due ingegneri laureati in ingegneria edile-architettura, innamorati dell'architettura e di tutto quello che attorno vi gravita.

Hi everyone, we are Edoardo and Carlo, two Civil engineer and architect  with a strong passion for architecture in a broad sense and for everything that gravitates around it.

Siamo risultati vincitori di un bando di concorso per la realizzazione di un'installazione di architettura da esporre in occasione della fiera  dell'agricoltura “Festival degli Orti” 2015, che si terrà a Monza dal 14 al 24 maggio, e vorremmo poter realizzare davvero il nostro progetto.

We won a competition for the construction of an architecture installation to be exhibited at the agriculture fair "Festival degli Orti 2015" that will be held in Monza from May 14th to May 24th, and we would love to truly realize our project.

TERRALAB 3.0 - www.terralabtrepuntozero.org
FESTIVAL DEGLI ORTI - www.festivaldegliorti.it

Il bando che ci ha visto vincitori non prevede lo stanziamento di fondi per la realizzazione e obbliga i progettisti a farsi carico degli oneri di esecuzione. Essendo due giovani professionisti e non avendo alle spalle aziende o privati che ci sostengano, siamo alla ricerca di fondi, partnership e sponsor che ci aiutino nella realizzazione dell’installazione.

The competition we won unfortunately does not include funds allocation for the project realization. For this reason we are forced to fund the execution with our own forces. As young professionals with no support from companies, we are looking for funds, partnerships or sponsors willing to help us in the realization of the installation.

è un progetto "sociale" nato con l'ambiziosa volontà di suggerire e sensibilizzare di fronte la necessità di rileggere l’agricoltura. Pensarla ed immaginarla in modi nuovi rispetto al passato, perdendo pregiudizi e preconcetti storici e storicizzati, tendendo ad un’idea di agricoltura nuova, accompagnata per questo da nuove forme e stimoli. Saper vedere l’agricoltura con occhi nuovi rivalutandone il carattere strategico a livello economico e sociale.

is a social project born with the ambitious desire to suggest and raise awareness of the need to re-read the concept of agriculture. Think and imagine it in an innovative way by losing historical prejudices and preconceptions, tending to a brand new idea of agriculture, accompanied by new forms and stimuli. Being able to see agriculture with new eyes revalues its strategic role from an economic and social point of view.

ORTHO CULTURA interpreta la necessità di guardare all’agricoltura non solo come un mezzo per “vivere in economia” ma anche come opportunità di “fare economia”, ricominciare a credere che con un’agricoltura nuova, smart, intelligente e all’avanguardia per metodi e gestione, si possano creare allo stesso tempo business e integrazione.

ORTHO CULTURA interprets the need to look at agriculture not only as a means to "live with no great expenses" but also as an opportunity to "economize", by starting to believe that agriculture can be a way to create both business and integration through new, smart and innovative methods and a renowned management style.

Un’agricoltura 3.0 per approccio ed atteggiamento, per questo giovane e alla portata di chiunque.

Our purpose is to boost agriculture 3.0 characterized by a new approach and attitude, attractive for young people and affordable for everyone.


Il progetto è stato pensato come un'installazione di facile e veloce realizzazione in linea con lo spirito e le linee guida del concorso. Materiali sostenibili, ma soprattutto semilavorati, utilizzati secondo principi di UP-CYCLING e RE-CYCLING, di facile reperimento e comoda installazione. Il budget minimo di cui avremo bisogno per poter realizzare ed esporre la nostra opera è stato calcolato considerando il costo e/o il valore di questi materiali.

The project was conceived as an installation of quick and easy implementation in line with the spirit and guidelines of the contest. Sustainable materials, but mostly semi-used ones in accordance with the principles of UP-CYCLING and RE-CYCLING, easy to find and to install. The minimum budget that we need to realize and expose our work has been calculated considering the cost and / or the value of these materials.

Una rilettura in chiave moderna dell'orto urbano, e della possibilità di fare dell'agricoltura un momento sociale, aggregante, nuovo luogo di relazione, incontro, scambio ed apprendimento.
A modern reinterpretation of the urban farm, and of the possibility of making agriculture a social activity, being at the same time aggregating and a place of relationship, meeting, exchange and mutual learning.

Un elemento flessibile caratterizzato da una progettazione aperta che sottende la possibilità di utilizzo a varia scala e su scenari profondamente diversi. Suggerisce un approccio di condivisione e collaborazione proponendo una lettura mai univoca dello spazio. 

A flexible element characterized by an open design that underlies the possibility of using different scales and deeply different scenarios. It suggests sharing and collaboration by offering a multilateral space reading that is never unique.

Tavolati in legno montati ad incastro realizzano una griglia ortogonale statica che regola l’inserimento degli elementi necessari alla coltivazione, vera parte dinamica. Pozzetti in calcestruzzo trovano nuovo utilizzo tra le maglie del basamento dando vita a passerelle distributive.
Wooden planks interlocking constitute an orthogonal static grid that rules the inclusion of the necessary elements for cultivation, that represent the truly dynamic part. Concrete manholes find new use in the base meshes creating walkways distribution.
L’installazione perimetrata da elementi verticali, leggeri e permeabili, idealizza pareti e narra uno spazio architettonico in cui elementi classici del costruire vengono prestati all’orto che diviene, in tal modo, urbano.
The installation bounded by light and permeable vertical elements, idealizes walls and narrates an architectural space where classic elements of the building are “lent” to the garden that becomes, in this way, urban.

La volontà di veicolare il progetto partendo dalle nostre realtà, con la possibilità di estenderlo verso il bacino di utenza di molte associazioni no-profit che già operano con successo permettendo a famiglie intere di fare economia attraverso piccoli ma preziosissimi sforzi.
Our goal is to convey the project starting from our reality, with the possibility of extending it to the user base of many non-profit organizations that already operate successfully in this sector, allowing entire families to make savings through small but valuable efforts.
Una vocazione totalmente sociale che speriamo possa prendere il largo grazie a tutti voi!
Thus, Ortho Cultura is 100% inspired by a social vocation and we truly hope that it will take off thanks to your contribution and support!!


Come contribuire con una donazione:

- inserisci il contributo
- clicca su 


- procedi al pagamento tramite carta di credito o paypal


How to make a donation:

- insert your contribute
- click on 


- proceed to pay by credit card or paypal


Vogliamo ringraziare tutti coloro che hanno contribuito al progetto e quelli che lo faranno in questa sua nuova fase.

We want say thanks to all who contributed to the project and to those will contribute in this new construction-step.

story:
Who We Are

We are a group of Boston based professors, students, scientists, volunteers, and friends who are actively involved in improving our coastal ecosystems through research, education and outreach projects such as  Green Harbors Project (GHP) at UMass Boston, Biomimicry LivingLabs, and Born To Be Wild: Oysters Today for a Better Tomorrow

What We are Doing

We are using oysters to restore our coves and harbors back into their clean, natural, and healthy state! In just one year, we have restored 2 acres of Wellfleet Harbor's muck into a thriving oyster reef habitat with 4 million oysters filtering 200 million gallons of ocean water per day!

Why Now

While Americans are poised to spend $60billion on Black Friday and another $450billion on Christmas, our coastal harbors are acidifying, our salt marshes degrading, and our marine life is suffocating.  Does Dad really need another necktie?
Probably not. Let's gift better--'Adopt an Oyster!' 

What We Need

Your most generous financial contribution. Our goal is to raise $100K between Thanksgiving and Christmas. Thanks to our partnership with Foundation for a Green Future, 100% of your deduction is tax deductible!

What It Will Fund

•The seeding of 4,000,000 wild oysters.

•Labor and materials necessary for establishing oyster reef habitats and build floating islands in urban areas where natural salt marshes are unable to take root.  Wild oysters will grow in clusters underneath these floating salt marshes.

The Impact

Restoring oyster population and their habitats will minimize eutrophication, invasive species, buffer ocean acidification, and increase biodiversity! In addition, oyster reefs will fortify our shorelines and help protect our homes from storms and erosion. It is a win-win-win for all, and the time is now.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our campaign to your friends and family! Use our 'share tools' to post our campaign on Twitter and Facebook! Thank you in advance for your generous support! --Dr. Anamarija Frankic, UMass Boston and The Foundation for a Green Future.

friends who are actively involved in improving our coastal ecosystems through
research, education and outreach projects such as  Green
Harbors Project (GHP) at UMass Boston, Biomimicry LivingLabs, and Born
To Be Wild: Oysters Today for a Better TomorrowWhat We are DoingWe are using oysters to restore our coves and harbors back into their clean, natural, and healthy state! In just one year, we have restored 2 acres of Wellfleet Harbor's muck into a thriving oyster reef habitat with 4 million oysters filtering 200 million gallons of ocean water per day! Why NowWhile Americans are poised to spend $60billion on Black Friday and another $450billion on Christmas, our coastal harbors are acidifying, our salt marshes degrading, and our marine life is suffocating.  Does Dad really need another necktie?Probably not. Let's gift better--'Adopt an Oyster!'  What We NeedYour most generous financial contribution. Our goal is to raise $100K between Thanksgiving and Christmas. Thanks to our partnership with Foundation for a Green Future, 100% of your deduction is tax deductible! What It Will Fund•The seeding of 4,000,000 wild oysters.•Labor and materials necessary for establishing oyster reef habitats and build floating islands in urban areas where natural salt marshes are unable to take root.  Wild oysters will grow in clusters underneath these floating salt marshes.The ImpactRestoring oyster population and their habitats will minimize eutrophication, invasive species, buffer ocean acidification, and increase biodiversity! In addition, oyster reefs will fortify our shorelines and help protect our homes from storms and erosion. It is a win-win-win for all, and the time is now.Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about our
campaign to your friends and family! Use our 'share tools' to post our campaign
on Twitter and Facebook! Thank you in advance for your generous support! --Dr. Anamarija
Frankic, UMass Boston and The Foundation for a Green Future.

story:
Sponsor my harbour clean-up

This June I will row from California to Hawaii to raise awareness of plastic pollution and to fundraise for our partner SEA CLEANERS (www.seacleaners.com).

To fund the row, in which I will spend six weeks rowing 12 hours a day in an eight-metre boat, I’m collecting rubbish from Auckland’s waterways on behalf of companies, groups and individuals. To see what lurks in our seas and its effects, watch the accompanying video.

For a $NZ100 donation I’ll remove one 50-litre bag’s worth of litter from locations such as Rangitoto Island, Henderson Creek, Tamaki River, the Shore, or anywhere you want to see cleaned. For $20 you can sponsor a 20 per cent share of a bag.
10% of all donations will be given to SEA CLEANERS.


For your $NZ100 you will also receive:

  • A certificate of authentication with a photo of your bag of rubbish;
  • Your name etched on our transpacific rowing boat, the Britannia 4;
  • Your name or company name on our Team Pacific Rowers website with public thanks on social media;
  • A warm, smug feeling that you’ve helped clean up a little part of our beautiful harbour.

Pay for 10 bags of rubbish and in addition receive:

  • Branding on our transpacific boat, the Britannia 4;
  • Photographs from the middle of the Pacific;
  • A warmer, even smugger feeling you have cleaned up lots of the harbour!

*-*-*FOR EACH PERSON WHO CONTRIBUTE WITH MY PROJECT I WILL PLANT A TREE ! *-*-*

I know my goal with this project is not about planting trees. But our family cares a lot about trees, and I do too! We live in a Tropical Rainforest and we have a lots of trees, but never is enough, and they could be planted in diferent areas in Puerto Rico as well. Agriculture and tree conservation should be one part of the other. Because I am very concern about the tree situation in this planet I am committed to do my part on planting a tree in honor of those who are helping me to develop part of my farm into veggie production. I will document the process and stay connected with all of you to let you know where your tree got planted. 

-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-

Growing vegetables: Walk-behind tractor

-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*

Farming and growing vegetables it could be little challenging and specially if everything needs to get done by hand. I want to be more efficient than that so I could have an income from it. My land shape and the soil clay will not support a small traditional tractor, which are more common than the walk-behind tractor. The walk-behind tractor in the other side is an expensive tool for me to by in the preliminary stage. I also will need to purchase two implements to work the soil with, plus Puerto Rico does not have a dealer for this machines so there is an extra cost for the shipping. And that will allow me to start preparing the soil for the cover crops to be planted this year on preparation for next years growing season.

-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*

-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*

My vision/story:

Thank you for your interest on my project. For those who know me will probably have a better idea where I come from or my work background experience. I have been working for two years at a small scale organic farm in the Northwest of Connecticut. I was raised in the mountains of the tropical rainforest of Puerto Rico. My dad and mom where full time farmers and gardeners which was not a common career at the time in our country. After a hurricane in 1998 the recovery process of the land, infrastructure and personal assets was indeterminately long. Then my dad became a certified arborist and I became his helper with my brothers and sister.

All the experience that I have gather at Fort Hill Farm on sustainable organic growing technique have give me the confidence to start growing vegetable in the place I grew up doing the same. In Puerto Rico the conscious about organic local food have become more popular then it was before. Mostly around the touristic areas like restaurants and cafes have increase its organic, natural and local food consumption by a lot. We are on a island which depends on more than 85% of food that is imported. It is a lot to food need it to feed almost 4 millions of people in this island. In my point of view and having already some land available to work on I am in the need to start growing vegetables in a more efficient, productive and sustainable way. Right now I am trying to visualize my farm project for the next three to five years from now. The first step of that process it has already began. (I am already back in Puerto Rico for the winter time. I start to work on the area, putting tools together, making a list of stuffs I need and getting ready to buy the tractor and some implements.) The walk-behind tractor is an indispensable tool to work in this first step and it will be my most important tool on the farm job from now on. We have a small green house which needs some repairs but is fine for now. It is a perfect place to start seeds and do other projects. But this I will not need it until next year, once I get back and stay for longer.

Once I have the walk-behind tractor I could plough the soil and spade it. Then plant a tropical cover crop, important for the nitrogen fixation process. So then once I come back next year the soil will be ready to start planting the vegetables.

-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-

Where your funding will go to ?

This past year I was able to “save” some money from the work at the farm. But it still not enough to support myself for the period I will be working at the farm without getting paid. For now I am focus on getting the walk-behind tractor, the implements, few materials and the seeds for the cover crops. The money I am expecting to collect it will not cover for all this, only for the tractor and the implements it's

more of what I am raising with this crowd funding. Shipping the machine with the implements to Puerto Rico it will be a little bit expensive and also taxes.

-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-

What will be my sales avenue ?

Sincerely right now I do not have the correct answer. It could be mainly restaurants, and farmers markets, but I will also will look for a CSA program. But CSA is not to known in this area, but that will take a time until I settle back in Puerto Rico so I can have a better idea of what it could be the best for me and the business. But for now I will start growing food thinking in self consumption and at least sell to few restaurants and go to one farmers markets.

Watch the video for more details and to see more pictures. And stay in tune for pictures and videos updates before the campaigne ends.

Thanks

-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-
-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-
-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-

story:
Help Us Close the Loop!

Long Lane Farm, a student- and community-run organic farm in Middletown CT, needs your help to build a chicken coop that will house 20 happy, healthy, free-range chickens who will produce eggs, till the soil, and create manure for the farm.

We want to welcome them as fellow workers and fellow participants in the farm ecosystem, but first we need the coop!

 

But This Isn't Any Old Coop...

It's been designed specifically for our site and our project by the Architecture II Class at Wesleyan University. Elijah Huge, Architecture Professor, and his advanced Architecture students have collaborated with the Long Lane Farmers over the last several months to design a beautiful, ingenious coop for the farm.

This is an amazing opportunity for our farm. We need your help to make it a reality!

 

About Our Farm

Located on 2 acres of land in Middletown, CT, Long Lane Farm grows a wide variety of organic vegetables for Wesleyan University and the greater Middletown community. We provide a place for people from all sectors of the community to work, eat, tal, and enjoy the beautiful farm environment together at Community Work-Days every Saturday, regular pot-lucks at the farm, and our educational programs for local elementary school students during the summer.

The addition of this coop will broaden the variety of produce we can offer the community, and it will also enhance farm education and experience that we can offer the many communities that converge at Long Lane.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations fund the purchase of materials for the building of the "Spinal Coop," as it has been affectionately termed by the Archetecture students and the farmers. The picture above is a scale model of the coop, which will house about twenty chickens. The coop has been designed to use as little energy as possible and will be made out of corrugated plastic, wood, and metal. Each chicken will have adequate roosting and outdoor space. The chickens' water will be collected from their own roof, which will drain into a feeder in the coop. They will receive food and will have their eggs taken through a single, specially designed door that the farmers can open and close without entering the coop and disturbing the birds.

The coop will serve both as an important learning experience for the Architecture II students and as a valuable asset on the farm in the years to come. After the coop is constructed, we will buy young chickens from nearby Clark Farm.

We are seeking to provide a more ethical source of eggs to the Wesleyan and Middletown communities. Eggs will be distributed weekly through a local co-op based at the farm. 

Breakdown of Costs: 

  • Polycarbonate Wall Panels - $625.50
  • Misc. Hardware - $101.3
  • Hardware and Steel Bands for Wall - $270.63
  • Lumber - $91.90
  • Lumber & Concrete - $178.43
  • Miscellaneous hardware - $38.37
  • Lumber & cinderblocks - $80.59
  • Lumber & hardware - $119.94
  • Structural Poles - $738.00
  • Vehicle rental for transporting poles - $42.72
  • Gas associated with vehicle rental - $16.04
  • Corrugated steel roof - donated!
  • Equipment rental - $147.53
  • Total = $2,451.25

Why?

All humans need food. In an increasingly complex world where the politics of consumption rule over people all over the world, it is hard to hold on to any connection to what we put in our bodies. We at Long Lane believe that small-scale organic farming improves the health of the land, of individuals, and of communities everywhere. We farm because it makes sense: seeds go in the ground, food grows, we eat the food. It's simple, but at the same time unfathomably beautiful and intricate. The systems of the Connecticut landscape interact in surprising and magnificent ways when we cultivate the land. It is mysterious and yet scientific, spiritual yet academic. 

Chickens are a part of this collaboration. Chickens scratch and peck at the dirt, loosening soils, and their manure enriches the soil and makes it better for growing plants. This is just one of nature's boons to us, and we intend to take advantage of it. 

If you're asking why THIS coop, why the Spinal coop, know that the architectects have put a lot of thought into the design. The new chicken coop replaces a 30-foot portion of the existing fence at Long Lane Farm with a curved wall that delineates the coop on one side and the range on the other. The chickens can pass between the two while humans engage with the coop and the chickens on the coop side exclusively. The egg-collection, water, and feed are all dealt with through the facade of the coop with drawers that maximize ease and efficiency for the students on the farm. We believe this design will be comfortable and intuitive for the farmers and chickens alike. 

We arrived at this design after many weeks of discussion and revision, and are looking forward to seeing it implemented on the farm. 

Who farms?

So who are we, anyway? Though all are welcome to join us at Long Lane, some of our summer workers are:  

Josh Krugman, farmer, poet, composer, philosopher
Hailey Sowden, tenter, traveller, farmer
Rebecca Sokol, professional
Cat Walsh, a most intriguing paradox
Coady Johnson, chicken whisperer
Kate Enright, lover of all things peanut buttery
Maggie Masselli, Middletown native, scholar of Southeast Asia
Anna Redgrave, singer-songwriter-guitaress extraordinaire
Ben Guilmette, farmer, thinker, barefoot walker
Laura Cohen, tahini queen, midwife-to-be

Our Mission Statement: “Long Lane is a cooperatively-run organic farm that employs ecological practices to provide the Middletown and Wesleyan community with good, clean food. We strive to collapse the boundary between work and play, between productivity and creativity, through applied practice and experiential agricultural learning. Long Lane Farm is a site of collaboration within our local community that demonstrates the vital importance of small farms in a just and sustainable food system.”

Current goals of the Long Lane Farm operation are:

  1. To foster ecological practices in farming
  2. To promote a just and sustainable food system
  3. To develop a cooperatively run (nonhierarchical) farming community
  4. To provide opportunities for experiential agricultural education/learning
  5. To provide opportunities for applied practice and creative exploration
  6. To create a site of collaboration between Middletown and Wesleyan
  7. To grow good, clean, and affordable food for the local community

What Else Can You Do? 

If you can't afford to donate funds, don't worry! We welcome your labor, your ideas, your inspiration, your passion and suggestions and humor and wit. We hold open workdays every Saturday from 10-2, and hold an organizational meeting for all folks interested in the management of the farm on Sundays at 4. Come on by, or send us an email, and let us know what you're interested in!

Some past projects started by new members to the group include:

  • a beekeeping operation
  • a medicinal herb garden
  • a rainwater catchment structure

story:
POWR MAG (Protectors of Wetlands and River Magnetawan) Inc.is
a not-for profit organization whose members are permanent or seasonal
residents who live on or near the Magnetawan River, their adult
children/grandchildren, or any citizen of Kearney or Perry who value the
“Mag” and support POWR MAG’s objectives. 
Anyone anywhere can be a ‘Friend of the Magnetawan ‘.

In
2008, a non-local aggregate producer purchased property south of Hwy.
518 along the Magnetawan River (above the Ayres Dam between Emsdale &
Kearney). This property included a small pit, licenced as a ‘B’
pit (20,000 tonnes/yr). Shortly
thereafter, applications began to rezone and expand the aggregate
licence to an ‘A’ pit and to ADD A QUARRY!
An entire hillside, along with its flora and fauna, to be blasted away…

A parade of heavy truck traffic on a dangerous stretch of road…

Daylight hours filled with the sounds of heavy equipment, blasting, crushing,
screening….

Once aware, residents mobilized to oppose this threat.
WE SAID ‘NO’! to the proposed pit expansion and quarry.

Perry Township unanimously denied the application to rezone.
COUNCIL SAID ‘NO!’ to the rezoning that would make the QUARRY possible.

The aggregate producer is determined to proceed and has appealed
Council’s decision to the Ontario Municipal Board.

THE AGGEGATE PRODUCER SAYS “I WILL”.

This means an OMB hearing.  The OMB has the power to overturn Council’s
decision and allow a quarry to proceed. This hearing will begin
SEPTEMBER 30, 2013.      TIME IS SHORT.

However, unfairly, the onus is on US to prove THAT THIS PIT EXPANSION AND
QUARRY IS NOT GOOD PLANNING.
IF WE DO NOT FIGHT NOW, WE WILL LOSE THE BATTLE. 
We need to prove our case through experts.  This proof is COSTLY.  We
need a lawyer, a planner, experts on the natural environment, noise,
blasting, vibration, ground water, traffic hazards and visual
impacts.We NEED EXPERTISE.

We NEED MONEY.

We need YOUR help if we are to succeed in PROTECTING – please DONATE.

The views and wildlife need our help.

There are 35 species AT RISK found in ParrySound and Muskoka.                               

    Wildlife and views

need our help.POWR MAG was created to help us consider our actions...to respect nature's creatures... and to the right thing for them.

Countless volunteer hours of research, gathering and presentations have kept us in the fight. The hearing is near experts will argue and ONE person will decide the fate of this magnificant area.

If every one gives a little we can achieve a lot.

Conservation ahead of big business.

We can conserve the Magnetawan river for future generations.

The site has already had clear cutting and hills are disappearing. NO QUARRY

Please get the word out about this destruction. If you can not donate make a lot of noise about this pit being the wrong location. Use the Indiegoo share tools.

 If you can DONATE any amount . You will help save this river and wildlife.What a great gift to future generations. Thank you:
story_txt:
POWR MAG (Protectors of Wetlands and River Magnetawan) Inc.isa not-for profit organization whose members are permanent or seasonalresidents who live on or near the Magnetawan River, their adultchildren/grandchildren, or any citizen of Kearney or Perry who value the“Mag” and support POWR MAG’s objectives.  Anyone anywhere can be a ‘Friend of the Magnetawan ‘.
In2008, a non-local aggregate producer purchased property south of Hwy.518 along the Magnetawan River (above the Ayres Dam between Emsdale &Kearney). This property included a small pit, licenced as a ‘B’pit (20,000 tonnes/yr). Shortlythereafter, applications began to rezone and expand the aggregatelicence to an ‘A’ pit and to ADD A QUARRY! An entire hillside, along with its flora and fauna, to be blasted away…
A parade of heavy truck traffic on a dangerous stretch of road…
Daylight hours filled with the sounds of heavy equipment, blasting, crushing,screening….
Once aware, residents mobilized to oppose this threat. WE SAID ‘NO’! to the proposed pit expansion and quarry.
Perry Township unanimously denied the application to rezone. COUNCIL SAID ‘NO!’ to the rezoning that would make the QUARRY possible.
The aggregate producer is determined to proceed and has appealedCouncil’s decision to the Ontario Municipal Board.
THE AGGEGATE PRODUCER SAYS “I WILL”.
This means an OMB hearing.  The OMB has the power to overturn Council’sdecision and allow a quarry to proceed. This hearing will beginSEPTEMBER 30, 2013.      TIME IS SHORT.
However, unfairly, the onus is on US to prove THAT THIS PIT EXPANSION ANDQUARRY IS NOT GOOD PLANNING. IF WE DO NOT FIGHT NOW, WE WILL LOSE THE BATTLE.  We need to prove our case through experts.  This proof is COSTLY.  Weneed a lawyer, a planner, experts on the natural environment, noise,blasting, vibration, ground water, traffic hazards and visualimpacts.We NEED EXPERTISE.
We NEED MONEY.
We need YOUR help if we are to succeed in PROTECTING – please DONATE.
The views and wildlife need our help.
There are 35 species AT RISK found in ParrySound and Muskoka.                                

    Wildlife and views
need our help.POWR MAG was created to help us consider our actions...to respect nature's creatures... and to the right thing for them.
Countless volunteer hours of research, gathering and presentations have kept us in the fight. The hearing is near experts will argue and ONE person will decide the fate of this magnificant area.
If every one gives a little we can achieve a lot.
Conservation ahead of big business.
We can conserve the Magnetawan river for future generations.

The site has already had clear cutting and hills are disappearing. NO QUARRY
Please get the word out about this destruction. If you can not donate make a lot of noise about this pit being the wrong location. Use the Indiegoo share tools.
 If you can DONATE any amount . You will help save this river and wildlife.What a great gift to future generations. Thank you:

story:
Garden Station is a whimsical community garden and art park created entirely by volunteers. We feature demonstration market/garden beds and sustainable buildings on pounded tire foundations with straw bale, bottle wall and green roof. Local artists have created murals to cover about 300' of wall as well as sculptures and mosaics. Last year we added wheelchair accessible garden plots and an outdoor kitchen for our many events and workshops. We also have helped form an urban farmer's group and ran a 23 week urban farmer's market and sustainable living workshop series, some of which was taught at UD for their sustainability week. Garden Station has been created by over 1000 volunteers and donations from over 80 local businesses and organizations with no paid staff or budget.

We have had events for Earth Day before but this year we would like to do a BIG event by drawing upon our workshop base and our network of partners to create a much bigger Earth Day event, the likes of which have never been seen in the Dayton area!

For EarthFest 2013 so far we have over 20 free workshops and 25 local organizations participating with more pending. We will have workshops on gardening, composting, seed starting, homebrewing, homemade kombucha, backyard chickens, beekeeping, solar panels, making your home more energy efficient, recycling, homemade paper, kid’s crafts from recycled items, juicing, building with cob, fermented foods, yoga AND MORE!

Other activities for the day include tree planting, Garden Station tours, “The Lorax” story hour, sale of local organic produce, organic non-GMO seed and plant sale, local reused craft sale and art show, info tables for local food co-ops and CSA sign ups and MORE PENDING!


Local FOOD TRUCKS including Fressa, Harvest Mobile and ReU Juice and Smoothie Bar will be there to feed your bellies with healthy, local food!

 ALSO The Great Cloth Diaper Change and the Really Really Free Market will be taking place during the event!

For more info https://www.facebook.com/#!/events/118455538325...

The whole purpose of the event is to provide basic, easy to use, hands on information to help our residents “go a shade greener” and make us all more self sufficient and consequently our region more resilient and reduce our carbon footprint. ALSO it can help our neighbors connect with local organizations to help them on their ongoing quest to become more sustainable and connect our organizations to each other for future collaborations and sharing of resources

We are looking for green-focused individuals and organizations to help sponsor the event! Your contribution will go to advertise EarthFest 2013 to the entire Miami Valley area through WYSO, DMM and more! Our Sponsors are interested in educating our residents to live in a more sustainable manner and we feel that this free community educational event is a great value that will produce great results in our community!

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

 

Your gift of $300 will sponsor a classroom for 5 hours of free sustainable living workshops for EarthFest 2013 to help residents from our community “go a shade greener”!  Our workshops will be geared to give hands-on, easy to use info that can be used right away to help people become more self sufficient. The classroom will be named after you or your organization i.e. The Roy Berlin Classroom; and will appear in the program with the schedule for the day. Your Logo and or name will also appear on the event posters and website. This money will go towards advertising the event to attract more people and for printing and event expenses, not for staffing.

Your gift of $500 will sponsor the music stage featuring local musicians for EarthFest 2013. The stage will be named after you or your organization i.e. The Roy Berlin Music Stage; and will appear in the program with the schedule for the day. Your Logo and or name will also appear on the event posters and website. This money will go directly to the participating musicians as a small stipend for their expenses.

Your gift of $100 will be listed on the program and website as a sponsor and you will be able to pick 6 plants of your choice at our non-GMO, non-Monsanto varieties Plant Sale during EarthFest 2013

Your gift of $50 will be listed on the website as a friend and you will receive one plant of your choice at our non-GMO, non-Monsanto varieties Plant Sale during EarthFest 2013.

All donors will be publicly appreciated on our facebook page and at any level you can feel great about doing your part to help make our community more sustainable!

LOVE IT but can’t give money? We need volunteers! Contact us at daytongardenstation@gmail.com

Want to DONATE AN ITEM instead? We are accepting items for a raffle at EarthFest to raise money for continuing events and construction at Garden Station. Contact us at daytongardenstation@gmail.com

SPREAD THE WORD! share our event and fundraiser on facebook and other social media!

THANKS! For you help in making our community a little greener! :)

story:
What is Music in the Woods?

Only the greatest end of the summer party and fundraiser. Close your eyes and imagine this.... you, crickets, a belly full of local food and drinks, exciting local goods, services and experiences in a one-of-a-kind silent auction, starlight, 200 friends and amazing bluegrass music. Not possible, you say? Not only possible, its happening, for the 13th time. September 14th from 2:00 - 11:00 pm.

The best part is that it benefits Imago, an urban environmental education and nature preserve. Imago has a number of great programs for families, children and adults on living green in the city and appreciating the natural world. Imago also protects 36 acres of urban greenspace for hiking and exploration.

Be a Patron of the Bands

MITW's lineup this year is amazing. Jake Speed and the Freddies, Ma Crow and the Lady Slippers, Red Cedars and Wild Carrot & the Roots Band. Getting such a great lineup is not easy. We are asking our friends (you) to be our patrons and to support this fantastic lineup and the sound system and stage that the musicians will use. Your donation will help us pay for the costs of presenting such a great show!

So Very Grateful!

By supporting MITW with your patronage of the bands you will not only help bring a great event to life, you will help support Imago and its amazing programs. You support urban conservation and a vision for a Green Greater Cincinnati. As a token of our appreciation patrons can receive event admission, Imago goodies, and music from the bands!

Hope to See you There!

For more information on MITW visit the MITW website. Here you can purchase tix, see what's in line for the silent auction, learn about the family friendly stuff going on before the music, honor our sponsors, and more! Music in the Woods will be 9/14 from 2:00-11:00 pm. Don't miss it!

story:
Logistics for Power Shift 2013

Location: Pittsburgh, PA

David H. Lawrence Convention Center

1000 Fort Duquesne Blvd, Pittsburgh, PA 15222

Dates: October 18-21

Website: www.wearepowershift.org

Conference Organizer: Energy Action Coalition

Power Shift 2013 is organized by the Energy Action Coalition and its partners and allies. Energy Action Coalition is a coalition of 30 youth-led social and environmental justice organizations united to build a movement to take on one of the greatest issues of our generation, the global climate crisis.

Primary Objectives

1.  Engage and elevate the diversity of stakeholders in the climate movement through the recruitment process, keynote selection, partners and allies engagement, trainings, and workshops, and arts and cultural events and spaces.  PS13 will highlight the solidarity of the Millennial Generation to stand with those most impacted by climate change and the fossil fuel economy.

2.  Recognize and understand the broken cultural, economic and political systems that are at the root of climate change and other injustices by ensuring that a rights-based social justice and climate justice analysis is at the forefront of the Power Shift 2013.

3.  Prepare participants with the concrete skills and tools necessary to be effective at creating change at the local, regional, and national level through trainings/workshops, regional/topical caucuses, online infrastructure, and follow-up, and provide straightforward opportunities to connect to campaigns and projects that affect concrete change.

4.  Grow our movement and escalate the pressure on the Obama Administration, other levels of government, corporate targets, as well as higher education, global institutions, and other institutions, as part of a long-term strategy that grows our power.  Power Shift will set the stage and be a launching point for change at the national level through national calls to action, issue breakouts, and state breakouts.

Campus Coordinator @ Florida Atlantic University:

Sebastian Church, sebastian@ideasforus.org, 786-247-2850

Thank you for considering contributing to the development of grassroots community organizers for the South Florida community! We deeply appreciate your generosity and support!

story:
I made a post on reddit.com/r/marijuanaenthusiasts where I promised to plant 1 tree for each upvote I received. Amazingly (and honestly shockingly), I received over 5,000 upvotes from the Reddit community. Like most posts, they wanted me to deliver.

After researching for a while, I decided that 5,000 trees would be impossible for me to plant by myself. Fortunately, I discovered Arbor Day Foundation! They plant 1 tree for each $1 USD donated. (The video posted above is from their youtube page)

So here it is. All money will be directly donated to the Arbor Day Foundation to plant trees. Lets do it Reddit!

story:
We are CLIC! 

A youth organization that works to position climate change on local, national, and regional agendas by encouraging the participation of civil society. 

Currently, we have a presence in 11 Latin American countries.

We share skills, knowledge and initiatives in a dynamic way in order to
create a space for young people from Latin America and the
Caribbean.

We work together to channel our energy towards creative and innovative solutions to address climate change, looking to influence decision-making through the creation of public policy.


Climate change is deeply intertwined with the development of cities. The important relationship between climate change and cities motivated us to create the YoutHab Project.

The YoutHab Project is a multi-disciplinary youth movement that works in a collaborative, participatory, and collective way to address themes such as habitat and the right of the city, based on the six axes of the New Urban Agenda of Habitat III:

- Social cohesion and equity - livable cities.
- Urban frameworks.
- Spatial development.
- Urban economy.
- Urban ecology and environment.
- Urban housing and basic services.

The project has three stages:


The main event is the First World Youth Conference "YoutHab Conference" regarding (related to) habitat and the right of the city, that will take place in Quito, Ecuador from October 13 until October 15, 2016, a few days before UN Habitat III 2016.

This conference intends to present for the first time a worldwide Youth Declaratory about the New Urban Agenda, which includes commitments, demands, and the recognition of the civil society as relevant actors in the planning of sustainable cities.

The conference will also provide tools for participants to enable them to engage with their local authorities and implement local projects to bring sustainability to their cities.

We want the conference to bring about global change, which is only possible with the participation of civil society and youth. Without civil society participation in our own cities we will not be able to create a sustainable world. Help us to make that change!


We expect to have 200 youth from all corners of the world in the conference, but we know not all the people who are eager to participate have the financial means to travel to Quito. With your help we will be able to bring them to the conference and help them start their own local projects.
These are the ways we need your help so that we can reach our goal and implement a project with a higher impact:

1) You can donate to this campaign.
2) You can share this campaign with two of your friends.
3) You can share our project and make it known to your networks.

How much do we need and what will we do with your investment?
We need to raise $18,000 dollars. Your investment will allow us to cover a percentage (%) of the courier fee and food for 15 youth leaders worldwide (18-30 years old).

These young leaders have created initiatives with high social impacts related to the New Urban Agenda, whose results will be embodied in the Youth Declaratory surrounding habitat and the right of the city.

How will you be able to follow up on your investment?
We will let you know about:

1. The final result of the YoutHab Conference and scholarship holders, centered around the Youth Declaratory, data obtained during three days of the event will be visualized in a map on our web site. This information will allow us to have a tool in the short-term to create commitments with local municipal authorities using a mobile application.

2. The youth scholarship holders will be selected according to the activities that they carry out in their countries, around this theme and their vision of the future, as well as the applicability of the New Urban Agenda and the contribution to their cities.

3. The youth will obtain tangible commitments during one year, and the results will be reported on our social networks, website and blog.

4. Quarterly bulletins will be created to publish announce the activities that the youth scholars are creating in these themes and how have they incorporated their results into Habitat III.

story:
• L'organisme Québecois Alternatives envoi un groupe de 9 jeunes (+ une accompagnatrice) formés en agriculture urbaine. On décolle le 4 Avril 2014 pour le quartier populaire de Biyem-Assi de la capitale Camerounaise, Yaoundé. (Pour en savoir plus sur Alternatives visitez le site officiel: http://www.alternatives.ca)
L'objectif du stage est de réduire l’insécurité alimentaire des habitants, notamment des femmes et des enfants, du district de Biyem-Assi.
L’initiative comprend :
    • L’introduction de nouvelles cultures hors-sol pour le jardin démonstratif installé au secrétariat de Protège QV.
    • Le développement d’un jardin scolaire auprès de l’école primaire et secondaire "Les pigeons", en collaboration avec les enseignants, les élèves et leurs familles.
    • Le développement d’un programme de formation en agriculture urbaine à l’intention des habitants de Biyem-Assi (formations communautaires, kiosque d’information, développement d’un guide pédagogique basé sur les fiches créées par les stagiaires).
    • L’appui à un programme de sensibilisation à l’environnement et à l’importance d’une alimentation équilibrée (formations parascolaires, programme radio, etc.)
  •  La rapatriation de l'agriculture en ville est une solution véritable au problème de malnutrition engendrée par l’extrême pauvreté. Cultiver ses légumes soi même et a la maison est une habitude a prendre afin d'offrir a sa famille une nourriture fraîche et équilibrée.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

En tout, le voyage nous coûtera 13500$ (soit 1500$ chacun), la somme de 3000$ qu'on cherche a récolter a travers ce site n'est qu'une petite partie du financement totale du projet. Le reste de la récolte de fonds se fait par l'organisation de soirées a thèmes ici a Montreal, ainsi qu'a travers la vente de produits dérivées. Nous faisons également des demandes de fonds aux différents élus de la Ville de Montréal.

Malheureusement, puisqu'il s'agit d'un voyage humanitaire nous n'avons aucune contrepartie a offrir pour vos dons a part toute la gratitude du monde de la part des enfants et des familles de Biyem-Assi.

L'impact

N'hésitez pas à expliquer votre projet plus en détail et indiquez aux personnes comment leur contribution va faire la différence :

  • Ce projet est vraiment précieux car il représente un acte de solidarité internationale bénéficiant autant a l'Afrique qu'au Canada qu'a la Nature. Comme expliqué plus haut, du a la vitesse a laquelle progresse l'urbanisation du Monde il est essentiel d'intégrer le concept d'agriculture urbaine pendant que les villes Africaines sont encore entrain de se développer. L'Occident a fait la grosse erreur de se développer au détriment de sa Nature et si l'Afrique pouvait intégrer la Nature a son développement urbain cela pourrait assurer un réel développement "durable". La situation a Biyem-Assi, comme dans beaucoup de quartiers populaires Africains est telle que les populations n'ont pas accès a des légumes frais et variées tellement importants a la santé des enfants ainsi que des adultes. Lors de son vivant, Thomas Sankara avait d'ailleurs comme projet de réformer l'agriculture du Burkina Faso selon le modèle de l'Agro-Ecologie tel que présenté par Pierre Rabhi (http://www.terre-humanisme.org) lorsqu'il a réalisé que cela permettrait a son pays de sortir du modèle des mono-cultures destinées a l'exportation. Effectivement, afin de recevoir des aides financières de la part de la communauté internationale, les agriculteurs africains sont encouragés a dédier leur exploitations à la culture de produits tropicaux destinées aux marchés des pays Développés. A la place, ils devraient être incités a faire de la culture vivrière destinée a la consommation locale afin de réduire l'insécurité alimentaire et contribuer aux économies de leurs pays.
  • Pour les jeunes Canadiens ce voyage représente une réelle expérience humaine de solidarité internationale. De plus, après le voyage le groupe organisera des soirées de sensibilisation afin de partager leur aventure aux habitants de Montréal.
  • Finalement, le volet écologique du projet est d'importance cruciale car la Nature a vraiment besoin d’être sauvegardée et un développement de l'Afrique en harmonie avec la Nature serait vraiment un bon objectif a viser.

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas vous permettre de contribuer financièrement au projet vous pouvez nous aider en partageant cette page sur vos réseaux sociaux et a vos contacts email. On vous invite également a vous renseigner sur l'agriculture urbaine et l'application de l'agro-ecologie en Afrique et ailleurs dans le monde.(http://www.terre-humanisme.org/rubrique82.html) 

Et le tour est joué.
story_txt:
L'organisme Québecois Alternatives envoi un groupe de 9 jeunes (+ une accompagnatrice) formés en agriculture urbaine. On décolle le 4 Avril 2014 pour le quartier populaire de Biyem-Assi de la capitale Camerounaise, Yaoundé. (Pour en savoir plus sur Alternatives visitez le site officiel: http://www.alternatives.ca)L'objectif du stage est de réduire l’insécurité alimentaire des habitants, notamment des femmes et des enfants, du district de Biyem-Assi.L’initiative comprend :

L’introduction de nouvelles cultures hors-sol pour le jardin démonstratif installé au secrétariat de Protège QV.
Le développement d’un jardin scolaire auprès de l’école primaire et secondaire "Les pigeons", en collaboration avec les enseignants, les élèves et leurs familles.
Le développement d’un programme de formation en agriculture urbaine à l’intention des habitants de Biyem-Assi (formations communautaires, kiosque d’information, développement d’un guide pédagogique basé sur les fiches créées par les stagiaires).
L’appui à un programme de sensibilisation à l’environnement et à l’importance d’une alimentation équilibrée (formations parascolaires, programme radio, etc.)

 La rapatriation de l'agriculture en ville est une solution véritable au problème de malnutrition engendrée par l’extrême pauvreté. Cultiver ses légumes soi même et a la maison est une habitude a prendre afin d'offrir a sa famille une nourriture fraîche et équilibrée.
Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenezEn tout, le voyage nous coûtera 13500$ (soit 1500$ chacun), la somme de 3000$ qu'on cherche a récolter a travers ce site n'est qu'une petite partie du financement totale du projet. Le reste de la récolte de fonds se fait par l'organisation de soirées a thèmes ici a Montreal, ainsi qu'a travers la vente de produits dérivées. Nous faisons également des demandes de fonds aux différents élus de la Ville de Montréal.Malheureusement, puisqu'il s'agit d'un voyage humanitaire nous n'avons aucune contrepartie a offrir pour vos dons a part toute la gratitude du monde de la part des enfants et des familles de Biyem-Assi.L'impactN'hésitez pas à expliquer votre projet plus en détail et indiquez aux personnes comment leur contribution va faire la différence :
Ce projet est vraiment précieux car il représente un acte de solidarité internationale bénéficiant autant a l'Afrique qu'au Canada qu'a la Nature. Comme expliqué plus haut, du a la vitesse a laquelle progresse l'urbanisation du Monde il est essentiel d'intégrer le concept d'agriculture urbaine pendant que les villes Africaines sont encore entrain de se développer. L'Occident a fait la grosse erreur de se développer au détriment de sa Nature et si l'Afrique pouvait intégrer la Nature a son développement urbain cela pourrait assurer un réel développement "durable". La situation a Biyem-Assi, comme dans beaucoup de quartiers populaires Africains est telle que les populations n'ont pas accès a des légumes frais et variées tellement importants a la santé des enfants ainsi que des adultes. Lors de son vivant, Thomas Sankara avait d'ailleurs comme projet de réformer l'agriculture du Burkina Faso selon le modèle de l'Agro-Ecologie tel que présenté par Pierre Rabhi (http://www.terre-humanisme.org) lorsqu'il a réalisé que cela permettrait a son pays de sortir du modèle des mono-cultures destinées a l'exportation. Effectivement, afin de recevoir des aides financières de la part de la communauté internationale, les agriculteurs africains sont encouragés a dédier leur exploitations à la culture de produits tropicaux destinées aux marchés des pays Développés. A la place, ils devraient être incités a faire de la culture vivrière destinée a la consommation locale afin de réduire l'insécurité alimentaire et contribuer aux économies de leurs pays.

Pour les jeunes Canadiens ce voyage représente une réelle expérience humaine de solidarité internationale. De plus, après le voyage le groupe organisera des soirées de sensibilisation afin de partager leur aventure aux habitants de Montréal.
Finalement, le volet écologique du projet est d'importance cruciale car la Nature a vraiment besoin d’être sauvegardée et un développement de l'Afrique en harmonie avec la Nature serait vraiment un bon objectif a viser.

On vous invite également a vous renseigner sur l'agriculture urbaine et l'application de l'agro-ecologie en Afrique et ailleurs dans le monde.(http://www.terre-humanisme.org/rubrique82.html) Et le tour est joué.

story:
General Idea

Hi everybody! My name is Evgeniy, I'm from Ukraine!

I am a breeder of dogs with 12 years of experience and also judge dog shows.
I decided to share all my knowledge and reliable information from colleagues, mentors and friends with dog owners worldwide.

I know just how important it is to have complete info about your dog: right type of nutrition, pet care, amount of walking and exercise, breeding best practices, breed standards, obedience training, etc. It is imperative that this information is empirical. My idea is to provide end users with access to all this information on the spot, from convenience of your mobile device, cost free. Here is the catch - despite all my dog knowledge, I know next to nothing about app development and programming.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need USD 5'000 for programmers and designers of this future app. This price driven by the fact that I will be populating content in its entirety.
  • Each contributor will be provided with a copy of the app before it is available for general public and if wanted - will get credits on the credits page

The Impact

I would like to repeat myself:

I know how is important to to have complete info about your dog: right type of nutrition, pet care, amount of walking and exercise, breeding best practices, breed standards, obedience training, etc. It is imperative that this information is empirical. My idea is to provide end users with access to all this information on the spot, from convenience of your mobile device, cost free.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks. I already have the needed data, developers. The only barrier — get the funds to pay IT-guys.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you have no opportunity to donate. But definitely you can share information about this project at your social, real friends etc. Maximum sharing gets maximum results!

Thanks in advance for your attention and help!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • My name is Tony Hoffman and I am doing an Eagle scout project for Blandford Nature Center
  • This project is important to me because I went to school at Blandford for 6th grade and I wanted to give back to them.
  • What contributors would be doing for not only me, but also for Blandford would be the act of contributing to a great environmentally friendly safe place for all types of people to enjoy while exploring nature.
  • What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I will need roughly $430 to have as much money as I will need for supplies and tools and food for my workers.
  • excess funds will be donated to Blandford Nature Center.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are unable to donate, please share this website with your friends.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you again



Sincerely,

Tony Hoffman
