story:
13 October 2014 Update

The effort to make a proper 501(c)(3) of the Brechin Heritage Foundation continues, albeit at a snail's pace. We are, to be sure, continuing to move forward. We are incorporated in Florida, have our Board of Director's set up, bank accounts in place and paperwork in place for the IRS. It's just time.

For those who missed the campaign, but still interesting supporting our cause, you can do so by cheque if you would like. Please make your check payable to:

The Brechin Heritage Foundation
P.O. Box 700725
St. Cloud, FL 34770

If you are a member of the nUIaddon.com web site, please be sure to let us know what your user name is on the site so that we can give you free access to the supporter's pages and features.

Our Story

eco-geeks.org is an effort organized by gamers, geeks and everyday folks who care about the environment and is dedicated to fundraising for the purpose of purchasing approximately 445 to 2000 acres (180 - 810 hectares) of Costa Rican primary rain forest on the Golfo Dulce the bulk of which, a half a square mile to two square miles, will be transferred to the Piedras Blanca National Park in order to preserve and protect its biodiversity and wilderness for generations to come.

Please choose one of our perks on the right or just make a cash contribution... do it now. Even just $5 can make a huge and lasting difference. There's no such thing as giving too little, or too much! We have a long way to go and a short time to get there. This first leg of the campaign ends November 21st. Please give now.

Approximately 90 acres on the extreme western end (previously used as a cocoa and banana farm), accessible only by boat, will be set aside to create an environmentally sensitive, sustainable, off-grid eco-lodge offering unique protected access to the western extent of the Piedras Blanca National Park and the primary rain forest within it for research, education, personal exploration and those who truly appreciate nature in its wildest and most unspoiled form. Visitors to the lodge will be able to explore, study or just revel in a wide diversity of ecosystems in one place... the primary rain forest and all of the wildlife of the Piedras Blanca National Park, the open waters of the Golfo Dulce, miles of untouched volcanic shoreline, black sand beaches, and kayaking throughout the nearby mangroves and river estuaries.

Be sure to check out our Facebook page at http://fb.eco-geeks.org -- we have videos of the area we're trying to acquire as well as photos and updates. You can also follow us on Twitter at http:://twitter.eco-geeks.org or Tumblr at http://tumblr.eco-geeks.org

This project has been organized by K. Scott Piel, a loving father of four, an Army veteran of the 82nd Airborne Division, an avid gamer, author of the well known nUI addon for Blizzard's 'World of Warcraft', and a Senior Software Engineer at Presidio Networked Solutions with over 30 years experience in developing, managing and completing large technically challenging projects. Mr. Piel has contributed thousands of dollars out of pocket to this cause, has pledged 100% of the proceeds from donations for his nUI addon to the campaign costs and expenses, as well as volunteering his time, energy and expertise toward its completion.

The well respected New York City architectural firm, SPG Architects, has been retained to provide site planning, sustainable architectural design schematics and ultimately to oversee the execution of the eco-lodge construction. SPG Architects brings a history and expertise in environmentally sensitive, intelligent and sustainable design to the project with practical experience developing and managing projects in Costa Rica, and the Osa in particular, as well as a demonstrable worldwide understanding of the value and balance of the ecosystems in which they build.

This campaign is being executed as a purely volunteer effort with no administrative overhead outside of the overhead attributable to IndieGoGo itself and the cost of purchasing the reward items (perks) being offered to contributors. 100% of the net proceeds collected will be applied directly to the cost of professional services required to complete the effort, the purchase of the land, management and construction of the improvements and ultimately transfer of the bulk of the land to the Piedras Blanca National Park.

Note that this is not a 501(c)3 non-profit and while your contributions go to a very worthy cause, they are not tax deductible.

Schedule

  • Q4 2013: Kickoff, Planning, Fundraising, Contract Land for Purchase
  • Q1 2014: Fundraising, Close Purchase, Complete Design/Engineering
  • Q2-Q3 2014: Permitting, Contracting, Legal Work for Land Transfer
  • Q4 2014-Q3 2015: Construction, Interior Design, Complete Land Transfer
  • Q4 2015: Project Completion, Open to Visitors

Initial Goal

The first goal of this campaign is to raise the funds required to contract for the purchase of the land, complete the site planning, initiate the design, retain the environmental engineering expertise, perform the land surveys required to delineate exactly what land will be transferred to the Piedras Blanca National Park and otherwise set the ball in motion. Time is of the essence in this endeavor, the land is on the market and could be purchased by a developer at any time. To that end, we're seeking to raise $30,000 for the initial goal by November 21st, 2013.

Perks/Rewards

We contracted the gifted artist, and avid gamer, Arianna Edwards to produce artwork for a series of rewards (perks) for those who contribute to this campaign. This includes our eco-geeks.org logo, our heroic Pandarian Monk with his companion baby sloth (in pajamas) and a stunning fantasy art piece. These are limited edition pieces and will only be available via this campaign and its associated stretch goal campaigns.

For a small contribution to the cause, we'll offer you limited edition bumper stickers, magnets, posters, hats, t-shirts and hoodies featuring Ari's art. And, just for fun, we'll pit the Horde against the Alliance... you can choose to make your contribution "For the Horde!" or "For the Alliance!" and we'll send you a perk with the appropriate slogan and add your contribution to the tally for your faction. Or, if you prefer, you can remain neutral and we'll send you your perk with the slogan "Because we care!" and add your contribution to the tally for Pandaria.

For a preview of our branded perks, have a look at these links...
  • Bumper Sticker
  • Arianna Edwards Limited Edition Wall Poster
  • Panda and Baby Sloth Silkscreen T-Shirt
  • Embroidered Safari Hat
  • Embroidered Organic Fantasy Art T-Shirt
  • Embroidered Drawstring Hoodie

Remember, Christmas is just around the corner and these perks will make an epic gift for your favorite gamers and geeks! You can give a truly unique gift and support an awesome cause at the same time. That's called a win-win, right?!

So... who's going to come out on top in the struggle to save the realm?

The Horde?
The Alliance?
Pandaria?

In addition to our immediate perks, we'll also offer longer term perks for larger contributions toward the stretch goals... you can choose to prepay for a one, three, five or seven night visit to the lodge at 25% to 50% off of the planned rate, or choose to be a benefactor and get the right to help name the lodge and guest houses, participate in the theming of guest houses and buyout the entire lodge for weeks at a time. Any contributions toward the stretch goal perks will be carried into the second campaign and delivered upon its completion according the schedule outlined above.

We desperately need the support of people who would love to come visit this paradise... so, if you've ever thought about visiting Costa Rica and experiencing the rain forest for yourself, we sincerely hope you'll commit to visiting the lodge. We'll also happily pre-sell the lodge for weekends or weeks for travel groups of any kind, study groups, research groups, etc.

All pre-sale lodge packages include round trip boat transfer from either Puerto Jimenez, Costa Rica or Golfito, Costa Rica to the lodge and back, three meals a day at the lodge, accommodations, access to the common area, pool, yoga room, fitness room, meeting room and grounds, unguided use of our kayaks on the Golfo Dulce, the mangroves and river estuaries, as well as appropriate access (on foot) to the entire western extent of the Piedras Blanca National Park. Taxes and gratuities are not included.

Note, while there is a minimum contribution amount for each perk, you are not limited in the amount you may choose to contribute to this cause. You are free to choose any perk you would like, choose more than one perk, any number of the same perk, or choose just to be recognized for your support, and enter any dollar amount you would like to contribute to the cause. Every dollar makes a difference so please give generously!

Stretch Goals

While we would hope to be incredibly successful in our pursuit of the Initial Goal, we do not expect to achieve or complete any of the stretch goals identified, below, in the first round (which is not to say we wouldn't love to!). However, we want to set out the long term goals and ensure everyone understands we're setting the bar very high. That said, at the completion of the first round of fundraising on November 21st, 100% of the contributions made over and above the primary goal will be carried forward into a new campaign and all of the associated perks will be honored.

Stretch Goal #1

Upon completion of the Initial Goal, the second goal is to complete the purchase of the land. It's an exceptionally ambitious goal. We seek to raise $1.5 million to cover the purchase price of the land and the attending legal costs, taxes and expenses to close the sale.

While we would hope to be wildly successful in our pursuit of the Initial Goal, we do not expect to achieve any of these stretch goals in the first round. At the completion of the first round of fundraising on November 21st, all contributions received over and above the primary goal amount of $30,000 will be carried forward into a new longer term campaign beginning with Stretch Goal #1 for the purchase of the land and all perks earned in the first round will be honored or carried forward into the second campaign as appropriate.

Stretch Goal #2

The second stretch goal is to improve the access to the land by creating a small, self-sustaining, off-grid, eco-lodge on 31 acres near the coastline. We have a budget of $500,000 to build six comfortable eco-friendly guest accommodations and a central common space for on-site staff, meals, recreation, research, meetings and classroom.

The lodge will be located in the maritime zone (between 50 meters and 200 meters from mean high tide) along the coast of the Golfo Dulce without cutting trees or damaging the rain forest. This is an area without road access and all materials and labor will have to be packed in by boat and raw muscle power. With that in mind, a budget of $50,000 per unit for six guest quarters and $200,000 for the central lodge has be established to include the production and storage of renewable energy, passive cooling and sustainable construction.

This development will provide a comfortable and functional space from which access to the western extent of the Piedras Blanca National Park can be attained along with the open waters of the Golfo Dulce, its mangroves and surrounding estuaries. Using local materials and goods, local labor, local craftsmen and renewable energy sources, the lodge will serve as an environmentally responsible vantage from which people can study, observe, explore and experience the beauty, diversity and remarkable value of the unspoiled wilderness and its boundless wildlife throughout the Golfo Dulce and the Piedras Blanca National Forest. This space is intended as a bridge between the wild untouched environment around it and the basic comforts necessary to make it accessible to those who need to see it but might otherwise never do so.

Stretch Goal #3

In the event that we are wildly successful in the long term, we have set aside a third and even more aggressive stretch goal: there is a second parcel of land consisting of approximately 1000 nearly inaccessible acres of astonishingly beautiful and scenic cloud forest owned by a talented frontiersman/carpenter and currently on the market.

This incomparable piece of land is located within an Indian reservation, however, it is scheduled to be surveyed by the government of Costa Rica and will likely be removed from the reservation and titled with an access road constructed which, in turn, would open it up to commercial development. The third stretch goal seeks to raise an additional $1.5 million to purchase this parcel of land and convert it to a conservancy in order to preserve its beauty, its biodiversity and its wilderness.

Having already had masterpieces in wood lovingly hand built on the land, there's little else needed to make this a haven for exploring and studying the true wilderness of Costa Rica or just getting away from the push and shove of modern life and reconnecting with what is really important in your life.

If we hit the second stretch goal during the campaign, we'll extend the perks offered to include guest stays at this remarkable location.

In our wildest dreams, there are several other large parcels of primary rain forest totaling over a square mile bordering the Piedras Blanca National Park that we could seek to add to the land we'll be transferring to the park. We'll talk more about that at a later time if our success on these first goals justifies it.

The Impact

At the minimum, we'll transfer a half a square mile of precious primary rain forest from private hands to a national park where the wilderness and all of the life it holds will be protected perpetually from development, logging, deforestation, hunting, trapping and abuse.

In doing so, we will have created a remarkable sanctuary where people can come to experience the wonder of it all, study its life, understand its value and come to appreciate its intrinsic beauty and how truly precious a commodity it is.

If we can achieve our most ambitious goals, then a ragtag collection of gamers, geeks, WoW enthusiasts and nUI users, their friends, family, co-workers and associates, will have come together to save two to three square miles of wilderness and preserve it for our children's children's children.

Whether it's $5 or $50,000 or more... stop right now, pick a perk and make a contribution today. Make another one next payday if you can. You can make a positive difference in the world right this second. We can do this. Do it now.

Let's roll.

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that not everyone can, or will, contribute financially to this effort. However, it's a worthy campaign and a worthy goal that will do remarkable good for generations to come. So, whether you can contribute to the campaign financially or not, you can still help in a huge way by spreading the word!

Share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, fellow gamers. Talk about it in your dungeons and raids, in your guilds, around the college campus, at the water cooler.

Share our links on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and other social media. Help us get the word out. Use the social media sharing tools on this page and spread the word! Reaching out to people you know and who care is every bit as important as a financial contribution.

Talk to the folks you know who blog about gaming, blog about the environment, run gaming related, environmental and cause based publications and services.

Bring this project to the attention of people who care about sustainable development and provide tools and products for renewable energy and environmentally sound living.

  • Do you know environmentalists and nature lovers? Tell them!
  • Do you know people who enjoy travel or adventure? Tell them!
  • Do you know a travel agency who would like to book a group? Tell them! 
  • Do you know a biology professor, field biologists or group? Tell them!
  • Do you know outdoorsmen, hikers, backpackers? Tell them!
  • Do you know someone who loves awesome fantasy art? Tell them!
  • Do you know any birders? Tell them!
Please "Like" us at our FaceBook page at http://fb.eco-geeks.org and share our links, photos, videos and stories with friends, family, gamers, co-workers, bloggers, publications, teachers, professors, study groups and organizations. Please share this IndieGoGo page, http://igg.eco-geeks.org, with them, too! You can follow us on Twitter, as well, at @ecogeeksorg or on Tumblr at http://tumblr.eco-geeks.org

That’s all there is to it. Make a contribution. Spread the word. Let's make this happen!

For the Horde!
For the Alliance!
Because we care!

Visitors to the lodge will be able to explore, study or just revel in a wide diversity of ecosystems in one place... the primary rain forest and all of the wildlife of the Piedras Blanca National Park, the open waters of the Golfo Dulce, miles of untouched volcanic shoreline, black sand beaches, and kayaking throughout the nearby mangroves and river estuaries.Be sure to check out our Facebook page at http://fb.eco-geeks.org -- we have videos of the area we're trying to acquire as well as photos and updates. You can also follow us on Twitter at http:://twitter.eco-geeks.org or Tumblr at http://tumblr.eco-geeks.orgThis project has been organized by K. Scott Piel, a loving father of four, an Army veteran of the 82nd Airborne Division, an avid gamer, author of the well known nUI addon for Blizzard's 'World of Warcraft', and a Senior Software Engineer at Presidio Networked Solutions with over 30 years experience in developing, managing and completing large technically challenging projects. Mr. Piel has contributed thousands of dollars out of pocket to this cause, has pledged 100% of the proceeds from donations for his nUI addon to the campaign costs and expenses, as well as volunteering his time, energy and expertise toward its completion. The well respected New York City architectural firm, SPG Architects, has been retained to provide site planning, sustainable architectural design schematics and ultimately to oversee the execution of the eco-lodge construction. SPG Architects brings a history and expertise in environmentally sensitive, intelligent and sustainable design to the project with practical experience developing and managing projects in Costa Rica, and the Osa in particular, as well as a demonstrable worldwide understanding of the value and balance of the ecosystems in which they build.This campaign is being executed as a purely volunteer effort with no administrative overhead outside of the overhead attributable to IndieGoGo itself and the cost of purchasing the reward items (perks) being offered to contributors. 100% of the net proceeds collected will be applied directly to the cost of professional services required to complete the effort, the purchase of the land, management and construction of the improvements and ultimately transfer of the bulk of the land to the Piedras Blanca National Park.Note that this is not a 501(c)3 non-profit and while your contributions go to a very worthy cause, they are not tax deductible.Schedule


    Q4 2013: Kickoff, Planning, Fundraising, Contract Land for Purchase 
Q1 2014: Fundraising, Close Purchase, Complete Design/Engineering 
Q2-Q3 2014: Permitting, Contracting, Legal Work for Land Transfer 
Q4 2014-Q3 2015: Construction, Interior Design, Complete Land Transfer 
Q4 2015: Project Completion, Open to Visitors

Initial Goal

The first goal of this campaign is to raise the funds required to contract for the purchase of the land, complete the site planning, initiate the design, retain the environmental engineering expertise, perform the land surveys required to delineate exactly what land will be transferred to the Piedras Blanca National Park and otherwise set the ball in motion. Time is of the essence in this endeavor, the land is on the market and could be purchased by a developer at any time. To that end, we're seeking to raise $30,000 for the initial goal by November 21st, 2013.
Perks/Rewards
We contracted the gifted artist, and avid gamer, Arianna Edwards to produce artwork for a series of rewards (perks) for those who contribute to this campaign. This includes our eco-geeks.org logo, our heroic Pandarian Monk with his companion baby sloth (in pajamas) and a stunning fantasy art piece. These are limited edition pieces and will only be available via this campaign and its associated stretch goal campaigns.For a small contribution to the cause, we'll offer you limited edition bumper stickers, magnets, posters, hats, t-shirts and hoodies featuring Ari's art. And, just for fun, we'll pit the Horde against the Alliance... you can choose to make your contribution "For the Horde!" or "For the Alliance!" and we'll send you a perk with the appropriate slogan and add your contribution to the tally for your faction. Or, if you prefer, you can remain neutral and we'll send you your perk with the slogan "Because we care!" and add your contribution to the tally for Pandaria.For a preview of our branded perks, have a look at these links...
Bumper Sticker

Arianna Edwards Limited Edition Wall Poster

Panda and Baby Sloth Silkscreen T-Shirt
Embroidered Safari Hat
Embroidered Organic Fantasy Art T-Shirt

Embroidered Drawstring Hoodie


Remember, Christmas is just around the corner and these perks will make an epic gift for your favorite gamers and geeks! You can give a truly unique gift and support an awesome cause at the same time. That's called a win-win, right?! 



So... who's going to come out on top in the struggle to save the realm?

The Horde? 

The Alliance? 

Pandaria?


In addition to our immediate perks, we'll also offer longer term perks for larger contributions toward the stretch goals... you can choose to prepay for a one, three, five or seven night visit to the lodge at 25% to 50% off of the planned rate, or choose to be a benefactor and get the right to help name the lodge and guest houses, participate in the theming of guest houses and buyout the entire lodge for weeks at a time. Any contributions toward the stretch goal perks will be carried into the second campaign and delivered upon its completion according the schedule outlined above. We desperately need the support of people who would love to come visit this paradise... so, if you've ever thought about visiting Costa Rica and experiencing the rain forest for yourself, we sincerely hope you'll commit to visiting the lodge. We'll also happily pre-sell the lodge for weekends or weeks for travel groups of any kind, study groups, research groups, etc. All pre-sale lodge packages include round trip boat transfer from either Puerto Jimenez, Costa Rica or Golfito, Costa Rica to the lodge and back, three meals a day at the lodge, accommodations, access to the common area, pool, yoga room, fitness room, meeting room and grounds, unguided use of our kayaks on the Golfo Dulce, the mangroves and river estuaries, as well as appropriate access (on foot) to the entire western extent of the Piedras Blanca National Park. Taxes and gratuities are not included.Note, while there is a minimum contribution amount for each perk, you are not limited in the amount you may choose to contribute to this cause. You are free to choose any perk you would like, choose more than one perk, any number of the same perk, or choose just to be recognized for your support, and enter any dollar amount you would like to contribute to the cause. Every dollar makes a difference so please give generously!

Stretch Goals
While we would hope to be incredibly successful in our pursuit of the Initial Goal, we do not expect to achieve or complete any of the stretch goals identified, below, in 
the first round (which is not to say we wouldn't love to!). However, we want to set out the long term goals and ensure everyone understands we're setting the bar very high. That said, at the completion of the first round of fundraising on 
November 21st, 100% of the contributions made over and above the primary goal will be 
carried forward into a new campaign and all of the associated perks will be honored.Stretch Goal #1
Upon completion of the Initial Goal, the second goal is to complete the purchase of the land. It's an exceptionally ambitious goal. We seek to raise $1.5 million to cover the purchase price of the land and the attending legal costs, taxes and expenses to close the sale.While we would hope to be wildly successful in our pursuit of the Initial Goal, we do not expect to achieve any of these stretch goals in 
the first round. At the completion of the first round of fundraising on 
November 21st, all contributions received over and above the primary goal amount of $30,000 will be 
carried forward into a new longer term campaign beginning with Stretch Goal #1 for the purchase of the land and all perks earned in the first round will be honored or carried forward into the second campaign as appropriate.Stretch Goal #2

The second stretch goal is to improve the access to the land by creating a small, self-sustaining, off-grid, eco-lodge on 31 acres near the coastline. We have a budget of $500,000 to build six comfortable eco-friendly guest accommodations and a central common space for on-site staff, meals, recreation, research, meetings and classroom. The lodge will be located in the maritime zone (between 50 meters and 200 meters from mean high tide) along the coast of the Golfo Dulce without cutting trees or damaging the rain forest. This is an area without road access and all materials and labor will have to be packed in by boat and raw muscle power. With that in mind, a budget of $50,000 per unit for six guest quarters and $200,000 for the central lodge has be established to include the production and storage of renewable energy, passive cooling and sustainable construction.This development will provide a comfortable and functional space from which access to the western extent of the Piedras Blanca National Park can be attained along with the open waters of the Golfo Dulce, its mangroves and surrounding estuaries. Using local materials and goods, local labor, local craftsmen and renewable energy sources, the lodge will serve as an environmentally responsible vantage from which people can study, observe, explore and experience the beauty, diversity and remarkable value of the unspoiled wilderness and its boundless wildlife throughout the Golfo Dulce and the Piedras Blanca National Forest. This space is intended as a bridge between the wild untouched environment around it and the basic comforts necessary to make it accessible to those who need to see it but might otherwise never do so.
Stretch Goal #3

In the event that we are wildly successful in the long term, we have set aside a third and even more aggressive stretch goal: there is a second parcel of land consisting of approximately 1000 nearly inaccessible acres of astonishingly beautiful and scenic cloud forest owned by a talented frontiersman/carpenter and currently on the market.This incomparable piece of land is located within an Indian reservation, however, it is scheduled to be surveyed by the government of Costa Rica and will likely be removed from the reservation and titled with an access road constructed which, in turn, would open it up to commercial development. The third stretch goal seeks to raise an additional $1.5 million to purchase this parcel of land and convert it to a conservancy in order to preserve its beauty, its biodiversity and its wilderness. Having already had masterpieces in wood lovingly hand built on the land, there's little else needed to make this a haven for exploring and studying the true wilderness of Costa Rica or just getting away from the push and shove of modern life and reconnecting with what is really important in your life.If we hit the second stretch goal during the campaign, we'll extend the perks offered to include guest stays at this remarkable location.In our wildest dreams, there are several other large parcels of primary rain forest totaling over a square mile bordering the Piedras Blanca National Park that we could seek to add to the land we'll be transferring to the park. We'll talk more about that at a later time if our success on these first goals justifies it.The Impact
At the minimum, we'll transfer a half a square mile of precious primary rain forest from private hands to a national park where the wilderness and all of the life it holds will be protected perpetually from development, logging, deforestation, hunting, trapping and abuse.
In doing so, we will have created a remarkable sanctuary where people can come to experience the wonder of it all, study its life, understand its value and come to appreciate its intrinsic beauty and how truly precious a commodity it is. 
If we can achieve our most ambitious goals, then a ragtag collection of gamers, geeks, WoW enthusiasts and nUI users, their friends, family, co-workers and associates, will have come together to save two to three square miles of wilderness and preserve it for our children's children's children.
Whether it's $5 or $50,000 or more... stop right now, pick a perk and make a contribution today. Make another one next payday if you can. You can make a positive difference in the world right this second. We can do this. Do it now.
Let's roll.Other Ways You Can Help
We fully understand that not everyone can, or will, contribute financially to this effort. However, it's a worthy campaign and a worthy goal that will do remarkable good for generations to come. So, whether you can contribute to the campaign financially or not, you can still help in a huge way by spreading the word!Share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers, fellow gamers. Talk about it in your dungeons and raids, in your guilds, around the college campus, at the water cooler. Share our links on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and other social media. Help us get the word out. Use the social media sharing tools on this page and spread the word! Reaching out to people you know and who care is every bit as important as a financial contribution. Talk to the folks you know who blog about gaming, blog about the environment, run gaming related, environmental and cause based publications and services. Bring this project to the attention of people who care about sustainable development and provide tools and products for renewable energy and environmentally sound living.
Do you know environmentalists and nature lovers? Tell them!
Do you know people who enjoy travel or adventure? Tell them!

Do you know a travel agency who would like to book a group? Tell them! 
Do you know a biology professor, field biologists or group? Tell them!
Do you know outdoorsmen, hikers, backpackers? Tell them!
Do you know someone who loves awesome fantasy art? Tell them!

Do you know any birders? Tell them!


Please "Like" us at our FaceBook page at http://fb.eco-geeks.org and share our links, photos, videos and stories with friends, family, gamers, co-workers, bloggers, publications, teachers, professors, study groups and organizations. Please share this IndieGoGo page, http://igg.eco-geeks.org, with them, too! You can follow us on Twitter, as well, at @ecogeeksorg or on Tumblr at http://tumblr.eco-geeks.orgThat’s all there is to it. Make a contribution. Spread the word. Let's make this happen!For the Horde!For the Alliance!Because we care!

story:
OUR PLAN

We're Two Kids Providing 1,000 Bio-Sand Water Filters to Families in India

I'm Zach.  I'm 12 years old.  For the last four months, my brother Aidan (age 9) and I have been living in India.  We got fed up with the fact that tons of people here have to drink unclean water that is giving them diseases. So we've decided to do something about it.  With paperwork-filing support from our parents, we started an official 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called Aztech Labs and are now helping villages get water filters.  

We're on a quest to provide 1,000 bio-sand water filters to 1,000 families this year (500 filters in the first half of the year and 500 filters in the second half).  We've gotten off to a great start during the first 3 months of 2013.  Even before posting this request on indiegogo, for example, we already reached our fundraising target for the first quarter of the year.  We surpassed 25% of the way to funding our annual goal.  With your help, we want to take this thing to the next level.  We're hoping indiegogo members will provide another 238 water filters to poor Indian families.  These 238 filters will be delivered to 238 families in poor villages near Kolar, India.  Why 238?  We need to distribute 238 filters more filters to hit our target of 500 water filters for the first half of 2013.  

  

That's where you come in.  We're launching this project on indiegogo to try to get help from awesome people like you.

 

WHY BIO-SAND WATER FILTERS?

Bio-sand water filters are cheap, effective, long-lasting, and require very little maintenance. 

  • Cheap: $32 purchases not only a water filter (like one shown below that we helped install in March) but also provides education to the families who receive them,  the assembly and installation of those water filters, and helps to hire a community activist for the year who provides education and monitoritoring services for a village.

  • Effective:The biosand filter has been studied in the field and in labs. Accoring to the Center for Affordable Water and Sanitation Health Technologies, they have been shown to remove the following from contaminated water:
    • Up to 100% of helminths (worms)
    • Up to 100% of protozoa
    • Up to 98.5% of bacteria
    • 70-99% of viruses

  • Long-Lasting and Low-Maintenance: These filters are designed to last 25-30 years.  As you can see from the explanation above (used with permission from the Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation Technology), the parts of bio-sand filters are really simple and cheap.  Theyre basically just concrete containers filled with different sizes of sand and gravel.

 

WHY ARE WE ASKING FOR YOUR HELP? 

 

Unhealthy water is a big problem in India.  And little bit of money goes a long way towards helping.  For the price of two pizzas you can help keep a whole family healthy for 25-30 years. 

 

  • In India in general and South Asia, more than half the people regularly drink unsafe water.
  • The Kolar District in Karnataka state, where we're providing water filters, is one of the poorest areas in India. Safe, drinkable water is simply not available for thousands of people.  Pathogens – microorganisms that carry disease – have contaminated much of the water.
  • Because of poor water quality, lots of poor people are geting sick in and around Kolar, India. At the last village we visited when we distributed water filters, for example, we met children with a particular kind of small white dots on their skin - a sign that they have worms inside their bodies that they got from drinking unhealthy water. When kids get worms in them, the pain in their stomachs can sometimes get so bad that they need to stay home from school until their parents can buy medicine to kill the worms. 

We've raised enough to provide 262 water filters to poor Indian families.  We'd asking for your help to get to provide filters to a total of 500 families.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

 

 

The simplest way is to donate, either right here on indiegogo, or if you have a problem using indiegogo, you can always donate on our website: aztechlabs.org/donate/.  We even have a "Donate Your Birthday" option on our site if you're interested. 

Not everyone can donate. There are lots of other ways you could help us out if you want to support what we're doing. You could tell your friends about us, share this IndiGoGo page on Twitter, or share it on Facebook. If you have any other ideas, we're all ears.  You can reach us by email at aztechzach at gmail.

  

A LITTLE MORE ABOUT US

The clean water charity my brother Aidan and I started is called Aztech Labs.  It is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, incorporated in North Carolina in 2012. Its purpose is to provide clean drinking water to communities in need.

Aztech Labs is working with South Asia Pure Water Initiative Inc.'s ("SAPWII’s") unique Adopt-A-Village Partnership allows donors to change people's lives in an entire village. Communities in need are identified, vetted and waiting for a sponsor to donate Bio-Sand Filters to the neediest villagers and provide subsidized filters to those who can afford to purchase them. To ensure success every, Adopt-A-Village Partnership also funds a village-level Community Steward position for one year to maintain village filters and promote sound hygiene practices.

See some articles about us by clicking on the links below:

  • Siblings Harness Duke-UNC Rivalry to Raise Funds for Clean Water - Duke Chronicle - February 13, 2013
  • Water Boys - Durham Herald Sun - February 12, 2013
  • Help Us Bring Clean Water to India - Chapel Hill News - February 25, 2013
  • On Sabbatical from DA, Brothers Look to Clean Up India's Water - Durham Academy - March 4, 2013

Without the support from people who find out about us on the internet (like this request of ours on indiegogo) there's no way we'd be able to achieve our ambitious goal of distributing 1,000 filters to 1,000 families, so we hope you'll consider contributing to help us out.  Thank you!

Zach and Aidan of Aztech Labs

See some articles about us by clicking on the links below:


Siblings Harness Duke-UNC Rivalry to Raise Funds for Clean Water - Duke Chronicle - February 13, 2013

Water Boys - Durham Herald Sun - February 12, 2013

Help Us Bring Clean Water to India - Chapel Hill News - February 25, 2013

On Sabbatical from DA, Brothers Look to Clean Up India's Water - Durham Academy - March 4, 2013
Without the support from people who find out about us on the internet (like this request of ours on indiegogo) there's no way we'd be able to achieve our ambitious goal of distributing 1,000 filters to 1,000 families, so we hope you'll consider contributing to help us out.  Thank you!
Zach and Aidan of Aztech Labs

story:
http://www.mygreenspace.ca/

@mygreenspacevan


THE PROBLEM 

Living in cities we are moving further away from our connection to nature and the environment.  As urban spaces become denser, our lifestyles get faster and more competitive with space coming at a premium.  The knowledge of where our food comes from and how to grow is being lost as we increasingly do our hunting and gathering from a supermarket.  

But what if you could enjoy an abundance of fragrant herbs or the crisp sweetness of a carrot straight from home?  This is a distant dream for many of us.  Where would you even begin?  There are countless books, blogs, articles, types of plants, planting charts, how to know if you are doing the right thing, and worse - a wake of dead plants in your trail.

This is daunting for most and enough to scare any novice away.


OUR SOLUTION

But it doesn’t have to be.  I’m Michael Moll and I believe YOU can grow food anywhere and I want to show you how. We’re building My Green Space where you can create your own garden in any space – no experience required.  It’s easy; go to mygreenspace.ca and answer one question - how much space do you have?

It can be as small as a window-sill, a simple patio, or a spacious backyard.  My Green Space creates a 2D map of your garden where you can drag and drop the food you want to grow based on ideal plant placement, your climate, and the current season. We help you fill your garden and let you know what plants grow best together.

Once you have designed your own personal garden, we ship your selections straight to your door, whether it be seeds or a complete kit.

But it doesn’t end there.

My Green Space is with you every step of the way.  Our companion app is like having a master gardener in your back-pocket that tell you where to plant, when to water, best practices, and when to harvest.

Still feeling stuck?  Get your questions answered by experienced gardeners in the My Green Space forum.

Our mission is to cover 100,000 acres of urban space one garden box at a time.

But we need your help.  Support our indiegogo campaign and help us raise $20,000 to make My Green Space a reality. We will use the funds to develop the online platform, create the companion app, and help with marketing this concept.

Interested? Join our beta group and we will keep you in the loop.  http://www.mygreenspace.ca/

story:
A Fracturing Planet    


*** Quick Note: This Earth Home or Earth Ship WILL be built. We chose Flex-funding because we need ANY amount. Our goal amount would definitely be the BEST option, but we are going to do what needs to be done either way. You WILL receive your perk.  The more money we raise here, the less we will have to from other potential avenues such as loans and investors.  The more we can make it community based, the more we can all enjoy it without having to turn this into a money-making machine. Let's do this!

Within 48 hours of purchasing your PERK you will receive a legally binding contract which will state that if you do not receive access to your PERK within 2 years, you will receive a full refund.  


The the health of our Earth and it's people's is deteriorating. Deforestation, mountains of trash, the burning of fossil fuels, and deadly water shortages have driven the world into environmental and social instability.  We wholeheartedly aim to change this reality.  If you help us...we will.    


Three Problems, Three Solutions

  1. Problem: Americans generate 250 million pounds of trash EVERY year that collect in our oceans and landfills.  Solution: An earth ship utilizes trashed materials for its structure.                             

   2.  Problem: The U.S. gets 84% of its energy from non-renewable fossil fuels.      Solution:  An earth ship relies on renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and thermal mass.                



3. Problem:  By 2025  1.8 Billion people will experience absolute water scarcity. Currently the average American family uses 400 gal. of water per day! 

Solution:  The Earth Ship uses every drop of its passively collected rainwater 3-4 times before returning it to the earth.       

         

    

Knowing how to solve a problem is only half the battle. Active and Continual change is imperative. Take action with us to encourage intelligent and sustainable practices so to achieve a smarter, healthier, and happier world! 

             "What the world needs now is a billion of these, immediately."                                                                                         Engineer when meeting with Michael Reynolds


The Earth Home Solution

The  Earth Home or Earth Ship was invented by licensed architect Mike Reynolds about 40 years ago and he and his team have been perfecting it ever since. Learn more about it here or read below. http://earthship.com 

The solution is simple; to make our homes into living, breathing, high-functioning parts of our planet. A home that takes the best human-made technologies and integrates them with the natural phenomenon of our planet. 

The primary structure of the Earth ship is built with used tires, cans, and bottles. Huge mountains of tires hazardously take up large portions of land. As they heat up, they also give off poisonous gases. With the Earth ship, we begin to  these mountains AND prevent the emission of unhealthy gases.  


The tires are a passive thermal mass heating and cooling system for the home, regulating the temperature of the home to a comfortable 71 degrees, year round.


How does it work? The sun and surrounding Earth...that's it.  Science rules. 





Instant Gratification for Joining our Mission

We have the idea, passion, work-ethic, and the time to create this amazing place. We don't have the money. This is where your monetary donations will enable us to make it happen. 

Ultimately, we need donations for the actualization of the Earth Home. But before we can build anything, we need to purchased the land.  Over the past few months we have been searching for the perfect piece of land on which to build this sustainable home.  We have found a beautiful parcel of land in the mountains of Colorado, 8 miles south of the Breckenridge slopes!   



To "Own" the Land

Fantastically enough, this piece of land is remarkably well priced (currently priced at $49,000 for .55 acre) compared to most land in the area. Our Earth Home design fits perfectly into this land where most bigger, conventional homes would not. This has driven the price of the land down, enabling the Earth Ship project to exist in prime real estate at a fraction of the cost!  


Your PERK!

Of course you will be funding a cause you believe in, but our perk system is great motivation in itself. Donate a bit, your name is forever etched in the walls of the home, donate a lot and you get a great deal on a stay in Colorado's tourism hot spot! 



Fostering Education

The Earthship can be an example of hyper-sustainable living for our community.  Those who stay in the home might simply be interested in enjoying outdoor activities in Colorado, but they will also receive education (passively or actively) about what sustainable living looks and feels like.  We believe this type of education is very powerful.  Sustainable living principles remain abstract to many in our culture and this will bring a practical reality to the mix. People will be taught whys and the hows of Earth Home living , so the knowledge of sustainable practices can grow within and through them. 


Enjoying Colorado's abundance of nature is a big part of our mission.  We believe everyone should experience it's inspiring views and play in it's topography.  The Earthship's location in the mountains will facilitate the ability to play, relax, connect with nature and be revitalized.  When a connection is formed with nature, and you are able to appreciate it's beauty, you will be inspired to protect and care for it. The more our community helps with the development of this project, the more we can focus on building this community and the less we need to focus on paying back . 

Our community will be active in providing guided retreats focused on Yoga, meditation, adventure, sports, Permaculture, (as well as other gardening practices) nature and sustainability. We have a team of people who are passionate about these disciplines and bringing them to others. 


Being Change, Sustaining Change

Without impacting the Earth, this project will impact friends and family of our community in a way that encourages lifestyles/practices that consider the people and Earth around them.  Many people already do practice such lifestyles, this will make it easier, more enjoyable, and more accessible to those who want to take a more active role towards such goals.   

Along with the Home, comes adventure. As a family passionate about creating fun,education, and happiness; Karli, Daniel, and Ryan are all excited to offer such things to anyone who visits this lovely spot in Colorado.
Yoga, climbing, exploration, permaculture education , and sustainable living are but a fraction of the things available to anyone interested in this projects community. 
It doesn't stop there. We will continually add Earth Homes to the geography of our world, constantly expanding the range of intelligent holistic influence.  So many of us are willing to change the world....simply looking for opportunities to be that change.  So lets do it. 

About Us 

Anyone who knows us, knows us as a passionate group of people deeply in love with each other and the world around us.  Sporting by macshop"> identical "We Are Together " tattoos (yes, even our old-fashioned parents :p), we tend to dedicate our obnoxious amounts of energy towards by macshop"> positivity, happiness, and tolerance. 

Children of the World

Growing up all over the United States,  developed in us the need to quickly adapt to a large variety of different peoples, cultures, and places. It was quickly evident that positivity, open-mindedness, and empathy were the most effective ways to do so...and so became our method! The more we understood people and places, the more important they both became. To encourage sustainability, intelligence, and acceptance has taken a paramount role in what drives us as individuals within a social and beautiful world.  

We get our passion for sustainability from our mother. She has been passionate about organic gardening and earth preservation practices as long as we can remember. Anywhere we've ever lived, she has had an extensive organic garden.  We were never allowed to throw any organic matter away, it was always for the compost!  Try to throw away a recyclable material and you would be in BIG trouble! We've long experienced the delightful taste of food from an organic garden and therefore support this practice whole-heartedly.

Damian started getting official carpentry training in college.  He was accepted into an architectural masters program post college but elected not to earn his masters degree.  He has done traditional home remodeling projects, was the wood shop foreman in college, and has worked with contractors on several projects around Chicago. 

He is continually commissioned  to do both interior design and furniture design/building projects.  He became passionate about sustainable building projects when he moved to Chicago.  While participating in an architectural internship he was able to rub elbows with some of the world's leading architects and attend conferences such as the International Green Building Expo in 2010. 

Damian is currently studying the 2012 IRC code book in pursuit of his "Homeowner Builder" status in Colorado.


MORE INFORMATION (Our Website)

Learn about Earthship Biotecture and
The Community Surrounding the Earthship


Evidence


Water Usage
http://www.epa.gov/WaterSense/pubs/indoor.html
Electicity Usage

http://www.electricitylocal.com/states/colorado/breckenridge/

http://www.eia.gov/consumption/
story_txt:
A Fracturing Planet    

*** Quick Note: This Earth Home or Earth Ship WILL be built. We chose Flex-funding because we need ANY amount. Our goal amount would definitely be the BEST option, but we are going to do what needs to be done either way. You WILL receive your perk.  The more money we raise here, the less we will have to from other potential avenues such as loans and investors.  The more we can make it community based, the more we can all enjoy it without having to turn this into a money-making machine. Let's do this!
Within 48 hours of purchasing your PERK you will receive a legally binding contract which will state that if you do not receive access to your PERK within 2 years, you will receive a full refund.  

The the health of our Earth and it's people's is deteriorating. Deforestation, mountains of trash, the burning of fossil fuels, and deadly water shortages have driven the world into environmental and social instability.  We wholeheartedly aim to change this reality.  If you help us...we will.    


Three Problems, Three Solutions



Problem: Americans generate 250 million pounds of trash EVERY year that collect in our oceans and landfills.  Solution: An earth ship utilizes trashed materials for its structure.                             




   2.  Problem: The U.S. gets 84% of its energy from non-renewable fossil fuels.      Solution:  An earth ship relies on renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and thermal mass.                



3. Problem:  By 2025  1.8 Billion people will experience absolute water scarcity. Currently the average American family uses 400 gal. of water per day! 
Solution:  The Earth Ship uses every drop of its passively collected rainwater 3-4 times before returning it to the earth.       
         
     Knowing how to solve a problem is only half the battle. Active and Continual change is imperative. Take action with us to encourage intelligent and sustainable practices so to achieve a smarter, healthier, and happier world! 


             "What the world needs now is a billion of these, immediately."                                                                                         Engineer when meeting with Michael Reynolds

story:
For the past 7 years I have been involved in wildlife conservation in Cambodia's Virachey National Park, a project generously supported by Habitat ID as well as concerned individuals such as Dr. Andreas Neunert, Mr. Kurt Johnson, and others. I now have a  new project that I want to launch: Sumatra's Hadabuan Hills, a virtually unknown mountainous area south of Lake Toba. I have a local contact there, Mr. Haray Sam Munthe, who also volunteers for a Sumatra Tiger protection program. Someone kindly donated one single camera trap to Haray, and within 2 weeks he recorded a tiger! The area is 200,000 hectares and we do not know how many tigers are in there, but there is almost certainly more than just that one, and none of them count on the national consensus: they are an unknown wild population in Sumatra. Just as exciting, locals have reported finding orangutan nests high up in the trees near the mountain ridges. If we can prove their existence it would be major boost for the critically endangered Sumatran Orangutan species. Rumors also go around that Sumatran rhinoceros are found there. Clouded leopards, Sun bears, Siamang gibbons, Binturong, Malayan tapirs, and many other rare animals call this ecosystem home. The Hadabuan Hills isn't a national park, a wildlife sanctuary, or anything else...it has virtually no formal protection at all and is simply an ignored block of forest in Sumatra.

(Hadabuan Hills above)

So we want to do a wildlife survey using camera traps and direct observation of orangutan nests. In addition, we want to help develop an ecotourism program where tourists can trek through the mountains and end their journey with a swim in Lake Toba, the world's largest volcanic lake, which last erupted about 75,000 years ago and nearly wiped out humanity.

(our fence going up to save Malayan tapirs from being poisoned!)

In fact, myself, Andreas Neunert, and Kurt Johnson have already begun to support conservation efforts in the Hadabuan Hills by paying for a fence to be built around a nearby rubber plantation. Local farmers complained that Malayan tapirs were coming down from the hills and digging up their seeds and eating them. The angry farmers were threatening to poison these magnificent creatures (see video up above of a Malayan tapir taking interest in a camera trap that I set up (with the help of Kurt and L. Bruce Kekule in Thailand's Khlong Saeng Wildlife Sanctuary). So we sent money for this fence (above) to go up and so far it is helping to keep the Tapirs out of trouble. But more conservation work is needed, such as "snare-sweeps" where locals find, remove, and destroy (all documented on video) wire snare traps that indiscriminately catch any luckless animal that happens to step in them, including tigers, clouded leopards, sun bears...or even orangutans.

What We Need

  • 10-15 motion-triggered camera traps, protective cases, python locks, pad locks, Lithium batteries, 50 16g memory cards
  • Cash to pay for patrols in which locals are employed to find and remove wire snare traps, which are currently the biggest threat to wildlife.
  • Funds for ecotourism development: trail maintenance, promotional materials, basic equipment for ecotourists to rent, and capacity building.

Mr. Haray Sam Munth looking over the Hadabuan Hills from a tree platform where tigers can sometimes be heard roaring in the night...! Help us get this forest upgraded into a fully-fledged "protected area" with a wildlife survey, ecotourism development, and community involvement (they will work as the guides, homestay hosts, and forest rangers).

story:
Հայերենն այստեղ
Версия на русском

Hello World, Have You Met Syunik?

Syunik is the southernmost province of Armenia, which borders Iran and is home to some of Armenia’s most diverse natural species, the largest forest in the entire country, one of Armenia’s most iconic attractions (Tatev Monastery) and an incredibly unique role in Armenian history. Yet, despite all this, the statistics say it loud and clear: Syunik is, for the most part, neglected by the modern tourist. Of the million travelers that visited Armenia in 2015, less than 1% actually made the journey that far south. Thousands each year are missing out on a big part of Armenia's nature and culture, but most importantly, the rural communities and villages in Syunik are not taking part in the economic benefits that accompany tourism. Our latest initiative, called ARK Bridge Project, will be developing a hiking network in Syunik to stimulate ecotourism in the region. Read on to learn more about the project.

ARK Bridge Project? What's That?

ARK Bridge Project is our grassroots effort to bridge the divide between Syunik and the modern tourist by means of hiking trails and eco-camps. We’re raising funds ($3,709, to be exact) to mark and map a network of hiking trails that will invite the adventurous, modern tourist to explore more of Syunik and meaningfully engage with Armenia's people and its landscapes. There are three major components to this project.

  1. The Trail: The entire trail from Tatev Monastery to Shikahogh National State Reserve and Mount Khustup is 85km. Our project is raising funds to mark mainly the portion from Tatev to Kapan. This portion of the trail can be completed in 3 days time, and will also be accessible to cyclists. Travelers will stay in Tandzaver village the first night, in ARK's Arajadzor eco-camp the second day and reach the ARK Kapan eco-camp by their the third day. Hand-made signs will be placed along 5km intervals to point travelers in the right direction and indicate points of interest along the trail (e.g. nearby water sources). Ultimately, the Tatev-Kapan trail will connect with ARK’s existing hiking trail network in the region to offer travelers an exciting variety of sights, activities and experiences. Any extra funds we raise will go towards marking the rest of the trail from Kapan to Shikahogh.
  2. The Eco-camps: Along this trail, we plan to build the second in a network of strategically located eco-camps made of recycled materials where travelers can find respite. The eco-camp will include a bathroom and shower (with real plumbing! woohoo!), a kitchen including gas stove, electrical outlets, cooking utensils, two story bungalows that can each accommodate 2 people, large open area where campers can pitch tents (tents also available), and more.
  3. Information Support System Information signs will also be installed at every village along the trail. Not only will it provide basic information and history of each place, but it will directly connect travellers with local residents directing them towards those offering their products and services. ARK contact details will also be present on the signs for language support, in cases where assistance is needed. A billboard adjacent to Tatev Monastery will also be installed, informing tourists of the hiking trail and camping sites while providing ARK contact information to answer any inquiries.
We invite you to download and inspect our budget sheet detailing all the costs for this project!

Why We're the Right Ones for the Job

ARK Armenia is an NGO based in Syunik’s capital, Kapan, and we are committed to assisting the region’s transition into the modern tourism industry--responsibly, with an emphasis on preserving the bountiful nature around us. In just a year, and operating on a nearly non-existent budget with the help of volunteers and donors, we’ve already covered a lot of ground (literally).

  • We've marked and mapped over 30 km of hiking trails in the region
  • We've already built an eco-camp made of recycled materials that offers all the necessary facilities for hosting travelers 
  • We've hosted more international volunteers in Kapan, than in the previous two decades combined.
  • Our founding team is actually located in Syunik, Armenia. No, Yerevan is not our home base. We actually live in the region we are working towards developing. We live here, we love our countrysides, and you can be sure that every dollar you contribute to this campaign will go towards developing them.

Sound Good to You?

Great. We’re not asking for a lot. Whether it’s $5 or $500 (or even a share on social media to show your support), whatever you can contribute makes a difference. It’s inspiring what we’ve been able to accomplish already, despite very limited funds, thanks to the help of volunteers from all over the world. That’s the beauty of grassroots movements like this one, every little bit counts. Now, we are inviting you to be a part of it, in whatever way you can. Make your mARK today by donating or joining our team of volunteers.

Stay In Touch!

Share our story on social media to make Syunik the next great ecotourist destination!
Facebook: ARK Armenia
Instagram: @ark_armenia
YouTube: ARK Armenia
E-mail: arkarmenia@gmail.com
Website: www.arkarmenia.com

    Stay In Touch!
Share our story on social media to make Syunik the next great ecotourist destination!Facebook: ARK ArmeniaInstagram: @ark_armeniaYouTube: ARK ArmeniaE-mail: arkarmenia@gmail.comWebsite: www.arkarmenia.com

story:
Help us change the world into a better place with our  children's book "Where is the sea urchin family?" A tale about the importance of respecting and protecting our ocean wildlife with the "liberangels"!

 

 

About the ngo ECO-MER :

  ECO-MER association is a French Riviera marine humanitarian and environmental NGO, based in the city of Cannes, world famous for its Film Festival. 

We have organized charity aid collections with boaters, seafarers and marine professionnals since 2010 via numerous Yachts du Coeur events that have seen us bring tons of aid to people in need in the world. After having organized 7 marine forums during 3 years in partnership with the city of Cannes, we have recently publicized the "Ten commandments of the boater in the bay of Cannes" which tells boaters to be "caring for the others as well as for the environment, and vigilant for the security of everyone", when they navigate in our seas.
Our aim is to raise the marine level of consciousness, so that people become responsible themselves for the environment, and caring for the others...

To change the world, you have to begin by changing yourself first so we've now come up with a great new project. A children's book. Because any sensible parent teaching their children about environment and wildlife will want to do the same thing as they are telling them to do ! The author Ali Pocene and the Illustrator May Glen are both active members of ECO-MER. The heros of  the book are the Liberangels who take every opportunity to spread the good word of protecting our marine environment !

About the Scientific Council of the Cannes Lerins Islands

The Scientific Council of the Cannes Lerins Islands (CSIL) aims to promote scientific knowledge in the field of protection and preservation of the Cannes Lérins Islands, Méditerranean sea and oceans, particularly through research and promotion activities.

In the marine environment as well as in fresh coastal waters, its action aims to evaluate the effects of humans and the pollution it generates on these environments.

The association is also involved in advisory and animation activities for all public on environmental issues.

  • Members :

Dr Patrice Francour, Marine biology full professor at the University of Nice Sophia Antipolis

Dr Françoise Loques, Doctor in Marine Biology from the University of Nice Sophia Antipolis, CSIL Director.

Dr François Galgani, IFREMER,  (French Research Institute for the Exploitation of the Sea) In charge of the environment laboratory of IFREMER, Toulon, PACA Méditerranean sea and 8 other members, all passionate about protecting the sea and the oceans.

Overfishing and unspoken pollutions !

  • In Cannes, the sea is blue, the sky is blue, the chairs are blue, and the sea quality flag is blue. But the reality is very different! Where are the sea urchins?
    Where are the mussels that used to be found on all the rocks in our youth?
    And furthermore. Where have all the fish gone to? 
    Well I'm sure you can guess that alright. Despite all the positive environmental efforts made by the city in recent years, decades of unconscious overfishing and unspoken pollution have taken their toll on what sea life abundance used to be like 50 years ago. Unfortunately, this is also true for all the oceans of the world that are suffering from the same effects of overfishing and pollution. BUT!  Our magical Liberangels , the heros of our first children’s book vow to put an end to that !

Our project :

  • ECOMER of Cannes, the author Ali Pocene, the illustrator May Glen, and the oceanography scientists from the  Scientific Council of the Cannes Lerina Islands (CSIL) have teamed up to create a great children's  story printed with  vegetable-ink on 100% recycled paper. A tale about the importance of respecting and protecting our ocean wildlife with the “liberangels”.

 Our needs and your benefits

  •  We need every "liberangel" that you too could become, to help us raise funds, communicate, translate, print, and distribute this book throughout the world so that adults educate children about oceans and wildlife, as well as educate themselves at the same time. 
  •  As a "liberangel", for every 15€ you donate, you will get one  "Where is the sea urchin family?" children's book signed by the author and the president of Eco-Mer association, dedicated to you in person. A generous discount on quantity purchase is also offered to you to thank you for being a "liberangel".
  •  Our ambition is immense, and if we do not reach our target, we should at least be able to translate our children's book into one other language.

 Other ways to help us

  • Spread the word and advertise around our project.
  •  Use Indiegogo sharing tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Nabeel and i have a farming background. My home town is situated in a desert in province Punjab of Pakistan where we have to rely on rain or dig deep wells and spend much of energy that is electricity or fuel along with wastage of previous water. I have taken an initiative to convert my village into a drip irrigation farm with multiple solar panels  and windmills to supply water whereas the drip irrigation helps in no wastage of water.

Although it is one of the best options in the world for water scarce countries, unfortunately it is expensive as well.

Thus i need you guys' support. Invest today in the farming for mechanized organic food tomorrow. I have started this campaign with a lot hope of changing my home village into a prosperous model village in the world pls donot hesitate.

The funding is going to be completely transparent and we will try to keep u all upto date with the developments.

story:
Baby turtles, tiny fish, and volunteers achieved what expensive and dangerous pesticides could not: freeing a community from mosquitoes.

Now help them do the same for others. 

Unlike other communities in their region of Honduras, the small, impoverished community of Monte Verde hasn't seen a case of dengue fever, chikungunya, or Zika for three years. In fact, since November of 2018, in a part of the world where mosquitoes have ruled for generations, and where nearly everyone suffered from mosquito-borne diseases for much of their lives, there has been no mosquito production at all.   

Even more astonishing, the citizen-scientists of Monte Verde achieved this remarkable, lifesaving goal through a groundbreaking program of biological control, using natural predators of the mosquito. Unlike pesticides, biological control is inexpensive, sustainable, effective, and safe.

But there's a catch. 

Anybody can spray a chemical. It's expensive and dangerous. It only kills the mosquitoes it touches. Once it's gone, you have to do it again. But if you have the money and don't mind the secondary damage to the soil, water, people, and wildlife, there's no question that it's easy. 

By comparison, biological control has only one drawback: it's not as easy as spraying some poison and walking away. People in a community need to be taught to use it. They need baby turtles and other mosquito predators that will eat the mosquito larvae. They need help monitoring their water supplies to keep the mosquitoes from coming back, and support create sustainable long-term success. It takes time, patience, people, and effort. 


Luckily, the citizen-scientists of Monte Verde are ready, willing, and excited to bring this lifesaving program to other communities. 


All they need is your help for to pay for a few necessities. 

The Monte Verde Project happened because a nonprofit organization provided seed money. Scientific advisors worked with the community and helped develop the protocols that worked. But now that funding has ended, and the Project needs a new source of support to carry on its lifesaving work -- for the people of Monte Verde and for neighboring communities. 

A $10 donation will pay for ten baby turtles. A $30 donation will support a Project worker for several days, providing transportation to reach  other communities, supplies (e.g., flashlights, mosquito traps, and training materials), and additional support needed to do the job. A $250 donation will support the entire project for a day.

Any amount you can give will mean a great deal to the lives and health of many families. You’ll know that you’re making a lifesaving difference for hundreds or thousands of families — not just someday, but right now.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word among friends, family, and colleagues. Share this story of eco-success, and keep it growing.
  • Share this link on social media

And THANK YOU!

story:
We won the $50,000 from Affinity Credit Union! 

Thank you to everyone who made this possible for us. 

Let us introduce ourselves:

Before Environment Canada, there existed the Saskatchewan Environmental Society! SES is a non-profit organization that has been working towards a sustainable future since 1970. SES has established a reputation for sound science, good management, civility, and an ability to work collaboratively. The people who work and volunteer for SES are passionate and well-educated individuals who care deeply about the environment and know that a sustainable future is only possible with support for and support from their broader community. Our work is varied and diverse, and for years, we have pondered ways to make solar power a viable option in Saskatchewan. This is where the idea to develop Saskatchewan’s FIRST solar power cooperative was born. Saskatchewan is fortunate to have an outstanding sunlight resource - the best among all of Canada’s provinces. 

Our plan is to establish a cooperative that will install and operate a 100 kilowatt solar farm, that will house 400 solar photovoltaic panels, in the Saskatoon region. This solar power farm will successfully meets the electricity needs of its members in a way that is:

If that doesn't sound exciting enough, members of the cooperative will cut their greenhouse gas emissions by 121 tonnes per year. That is the equivalent of 1326 trees, which is huge! 

A solar power cooperative is also an incredibly unique concept, as it provides people who would not normally have the ability to install solar panels on their home, the opportunity to invest in a renewable tomorrow. Do you live in a condo? Do you rent? Do you plan on moving to a different home in a couple of years? Have you always wanted to have renewable energy, but don't know where to start because the paperwork and installation seem overwhelming? 

These are all reasons to invest. 

The co-op will also take care of all maintenance, which means you won't be the one sweeping the snow off your panel(s) every time it snows. The convenience factor of this cooperative is tremendous! 

Primary outcomes of the solar power co-op:

The outcomes of this co-op are multi-pronged. 

  1. A significant net reduction in greenhouse gas emissions for all members of the co-op. 
  2. A financially viable solar power co-operative in the Saskatoon area with a committed membership base and a solid legal structure.

  3. A solar power co-op that serves as a working model for the development of many more across the province. Our hope is to see 40 solar power co-ops established in Saskatchewan over the next 10 to 15 years. 

Why your donation matters:

We are one of three finalists in the Affinity Credit Union Business for Good Social Venture Challenge. This means that by donating your hard earned money to SES, you'll give us your vote. Donate a little, or a lot, the choice is up to you! Every donation gives us the chance to win $50,000 in addition to the crowdfunding contributions we receive. The winner of the $50,000 will be determined by the amount of funds raised by each finalist and the number of unique contributions. By contributing even a dollar, you are showing your support for Saskatchewan's FIRST solar power cooperative! 

The first solar power co-op will face the highest start-up costs. This is why SES is seeking support from Affinity Credit Union to help offset these costs and successfully launch the project. We don't want co-op members to be burdened by these additional start-up costs. 

Your contribution, no matter what size, also helps us along our way in actually developing the cooperative. Our next steps include:

  • developing a proper legal structure for the co-op
  • finalizing a suitable site for the cooperatively owned solar power installation
  • signing up members who want to participate in the co-op
  • arranging for and overseeing the installation of the solar photovoltaic system and the necessary grid hookups 

  • ensuring replicability of this solar co-op, by writing a strong business plan 

So, what's in it for you? 
Besides that warm feeling that you'll get in your heart when you gift your hard-earned dollars to the solar power cooperative, you'll also receive some great perks! Check the right-hand side for what we will give you in return for your contribution. Karma? Awesome. Virtual high-fives? Even better. SES memberships, notebooks, and t-shirts? You don't want to miss out on these! You can even purchase a solar panel now! 
The t-shirt is available at the $100 perk level-- it's designed and printed by Hardpressed in YXE, on organic cotton. 

If we don't reach our entire crowdfunding goal, the funds will still go towards developing the solar power cooperative. It just might take us a bit longer to get the ball rolling.

Other ways you can help:

Share, share, share! By forwarding this onto your friends and family and asking them to contribute, you are helping start something great in Saskatchewan. Thank you! 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Technical FAQs:

1. How big will the solar farm be?
It will have 100 kilowatts of electrical capacity.  The co-op will install 400 solar panels each of which will produce 250 watts of electricity.  The solar power plant will be hooked up to the SaskPower grid.
2. How will the cooperative be run?
Everyone who purchases a solar panel will belong to the solar power cooperative and will have a say in decision making.  This will be the first solar power cooperative in Saskatchewan.
3. How much does one solar panel unit cost? 
When you include the cost of the solar panel, and the solar panel’s share of other installed costs such as the inverters and hookup to the power grid, buying a panel unit will cost $900. The additional cost in the perk section (to the right) is to provide additional funding to the solar power cooperative project. 
4. Will investors recover their panel costs over time?
No.  At the current price SaskPower pays under the Small Power Producers Program, we estimate investors will get between $650 and $700 of their investment back over 25 years.   
5. How many panels will I need to purchase to supply to my entire home?
This will depend on the size of your home. We can help!
6. What solar panels will be purchased?
SES will be careful to select solar panels that are high performing and have a low greenhouse gas footprint in the course of their manufacture, so that greenhouse gas emission reduction for co-op members is maximized.
7. What if I only buy one panel now, can I buy more in the future?
Absolutely! But remember that only 400 are available. 
8. What if I can't afford a panel now? 
We plan to pre-sell all 400 available panels before we build the solar farm. If you are interested in purchasing a panel and would like to discuss your options, please contact us! 
9. Why invest in solar? 

Approximately half of our electricity in Saskatchewan currently comes from coal, a very dirty source of power. Solar power emits only a small fraction of the greenhouse gas pollution associated with electricity produced from coal and natural gas. Solar power fits nicely into an urban landscape. It works in cold temperatures, as long as the collectors are kept free of snow. It also compliments our existing wind power resources. For example, while solar production takes place during daylight hours, wind power production often peaks at night. What's more, the cost of solar electric technology is rapidly dropping. If we want to build a renewable power future for Saskatchewan, the building blocks need to be put into place now. 

Project experts:

Ronn Lepage is a chartered accountant, certified management consultant and LEED Green Associate. His company, VerEco Homes Inc. focuses on designing, building and maintaining eco-friendly homes. Ronn holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree and a Master of Science degree. He worked for many years as a partner with Deloitte, Canada’s largest professional services firm.  Ronn serves as the Treasurer of the Saskatchewan Environmental Society.  

Joe Schmutz, PhD has just retired after many years of serving as a faculty member in the School of Environment and Sustainability at the University of Saskatchewan. His primary expertise is in the area of ecology and biodiversity. He owns a small consulting business, Prairie Ecodesign Ltd. Joe also serves on the Saskatchewan Environmental Society board of directors. 

Bill Wardell is a partner in the Saskatoon law firm of Wardell Gillis and farms near Floral, Saskatchewan, just south of Saskatoon. He helped to establish the legal aid system in Saskatchewan and taught law at the College of Law for many years. He has served on the boards of SaskTel and the Saskatoon Co-op. Bill also serves on the Saskatchewan Environmental Society board of directors. 

In addition to their widespread experience, Ronn, Joe and Bill all have solar installations on their own properties. Ronn meets the entire electrical needs of his home using solar energy, and Bill meets the entire electrical needs of his home and farm with solar power. Joe meets his domestic hot water needs with solar energy. All three have significant experience with the challenges that comes with solar installations, and with the maintenance of solar systems, as well as with the tremendous benefits of solar energy.

Thank you for supporting solar in Saskatchewan!
