story:
My name is Mo'tasem Abu Alqumboz, I am an environmetal engineer, during my study i have alot of cources related to the environment, sources such as Integrated solid waste managment which i am going to have the master degree in this field in germany.

My campaign concerned mainly with the first element of integrated solid waste management program , the generation of solid waste. In my campaign i hope providing three colored containers for recycled waste to at least 20 school in Gaza City to be able to recycle paper plastic and glass without any need to separation at the MRF.

As environmental engineer i have the required Knowledge to do such thing but i have not the money needed for purchase the containers and money needed for awerness campaigns. 

In Gaza Strip the solid waste goes to not sanitary landfills that may contaminate the unique and the only source of tap water for the citizens, so if we start to implement separation program at the souce huge amount will recycled and not landfilled, this project will be the first block in the wall.

Firstly i am going to need $ 5000 to implement a small scale separation program " 20 school" this fund will goes to containers purchase and other tools, awareness campaign, and trasportaion the separated solids to the facilities to be recycled and recevered.

If the fund had not come i will reduce the number of containes to two and may reduce the number of targeted group.

Here in Gaza Strip as a developing state the system have not any enough money to care of such thing in spite of potential groundwater contamination resulting from landfilling the solidwaste, so this action will also save the lifes of the citizen in the first place. Also we separate the solid waste we reduce the potential of sick students so the parents will send their children to schools without any fear or worry.

It is impotrant to inform you that nowadays i run an environmental culb related to our environmental issues.  

I thank you for your contributions and support.
story_txt:
My name is Mo'tasem Abu Alqumboz, I am an environmetal engineer, during my study i have alot of cources related to the environment, sources such as Integrated solid waste managment which i am going to have the master degree in this field in germany.
My campaign concerned mainly with the first element of integrated solid waste management program , the generation of solid waste. In my campaign i hope providing three colored containers for recycled waste to at least 20 school in Gaza City to be able to recycle paper plastic and glass without any need to separation at the MRF.
As environmental engineer i have the required Knowledge to do such thing but i have not the money needed for purchase the containers and money needed for awerness campaigns. 
In Gaza Strip the solid waste goes to not sanitary landfills that may contaminate the unique and the only source of tap water for the citizens, so if we start to implement separation program at the souce huge amount will recycled and not landfilled, this project will be the first block in the wall.
Firstly i am going to need $ 5000 to implement a small scale separation program " 20 school" this fund will goes to containers purchase and other tools, awareness campaign, and trasportaion the separated solids to the facilities to be recycled and recevered.
If the fund had not come i will reduce the number of containes to two and may reduce the number of targeted group.
Here in Gaza Strip as a developing state the system have not any enough money to care of such thing in spite of potential groundwater contamination resulting from landfilling the solidwaste, so this action will also save the lifes of the citizen in the first place. Also we separate the solid waste we reduce the potential of sick students so the parents will send their children to schools without any fear or worry.
It is impotrant to inform you that nowadays i run an environmental culb related to our environmental issues.  

I thank you for your contributions and support.

story:
The elephant with no trunk.

They say that a picture paints a thousand words, but no words can describe the pain, the anguish and the fear this young elephant went through when its trunk got caught in a poachers wire snare. The pain, the fear and the anguish that still haunts  it today. The wire tightening around its trunk every time it pulled, cutting deeper and deeper into the flesh, until finally severing the trunk in two.

The very trunk which is the lifeline of the elephant, its only tool which it uses for feeding and drinking, and the fact that the elephant survived is in itself a miracle of nature, showing how African wildlife are able to adapt to the most hostile circumstances. What caused this tragedy? Poachers- illegal hunters and fishermen, using inhumane ways to capture animals and fish, often causing untold suffering and pain to their prey and victims.

As with any natural environment, everything hangs in nature’s balance, from the smallest insect, to the largest mammal and the persecution of any one species throws the whole ecosystem into disarray. We have hundreds of similar cases involving numerous species of animals, birds and fish.  

Who are we?

Gache Gache Environmental Protection Services (GGEPS) is a voluntary antipoaching unit that bases itself in the Gache Gache conservation area on the shores of Lake Kariba between Zimbabwe and Zambia. GGEPS is funded through donations and from the management of Gache Gache Lodge. However there is an ever increasing cost to keeping this unit going and resources are now stretched to the limit. Costs of around $3500 a month are being incurred, on fuel and maintenance of boats and vehicles, food and allowances for the antipoaching unit, and food for the rescued and rehabilitated animals and orphans of the dead animals.

Since the inception of the EPS in 2010, over 300 hundred poachers have been arrested, thousands of wire snares and traps have been collected and hundreds of meters of nylon fishing nets confiscated. The anti poaching unit often return to base with tonnes of fish, and dead and decaying or near dead animals caught in the traps. 

Funding requirements

Although we have set a target of $24,000, it will only last 6 months.

Monthly expenses incurred are $1,000 for fuel and maintenance of vehicles boats and equipment, $1,500 for food for the anti-poaching unit and animals, and $1,000 for allowances for the volunteer antipoaching unit. This gives the total of $3500 a month for 6 months to $21,000, of the remaining, $1,000 is to be used to reequip the unit with new uniforms, new communications and surveillance equipment, $1,000 to cover any ancillary costs and $1,000 for the ongoing education programme in the surrounding communiites.

For your donations,

 For each donation we will personally thank you and mention your name in our newsletters and on our website, you will also receive the regular updates. For Donations of $25 and over you will recieve a certificate of appreciation from GGEPS. For donations over $50 you will recieve a certificate, and an antipoaching team baseball cap.For donations over $100 we will send you an Antipoaching team T-shirt aswell as a cap and certificate. For donations over $250 you will recieve all the other perks already mentioned aswell as an embroidered golf/polo shirt from team GGEPS, and for each $1000 you donate, you will get a free night at Gache Gache lodge.

As it is an ongoing project, every little helps. Even if we don’t reach our goal, the money raised will be put to good use. Up until recently there has been a slight decrease in the number of incidents recorded, but this was due to the rainy season in Zimbabwe, and the wildlife having plenty of food and cover in the thick bush, but now winter is upon us, it is very dry, the bush has thinned, and the animals have to come to the shorefront in order to drink, leaving them vulnerable out in the open.

 

More about us

GGEPS is an Antipoaching unit that runs alongside a commercial operation Chapungu Safaris, trading as Gache Gache lodge. 

Gache Gache Lodge is situated on the shores of Lake Kariba, one of the world’s largest manmade lakes on the Zambezi River between Zimbabwe and Zambia in Africa. Gache Gache Lodge is a rustic safari lodge on the Lake. It offers visitors some of the best game viewing and fresh water game fishing in the world. It has its own exclusive 25square kilometre of natural bush, under lease form the local council and community.  It is here that buffalo and elephant roam alongside each other, and hippos wallow and crocodiles bask along the shoreline.

Whilst the lodge runs as a commercial entity, a hotspot for both local and foreign tourists, the management and staff, along with the local communities have realized the need to preserve this unique setting. Through education, the communities have been taught the value of both the wildlife and fish, and are working together with the management and staff to bring the poaching and wanton destruction of the natural ecosystems under control. 

TAPSON CHIBAYAMAGORA, is a Tonga born local (EPS TEAM LEADER) his comments are as follows:-

"The area around the Gache Gache Lodge i.e. the south bank of the eastern basin of Lake Kariba has been teeming with illegal poachers and fishermen, who net large amounts of fish and destroy the natural breeding sanctuary for fish in the river system. Illegal catches of 10 tonnes and more a day are no exaggeration. Local fishermen with legal licences in the area were concerned about the fish poaching as it was also impacting their own livelihoods and a group of four community members approached Gache Gache Lodge for assistance to put a stop to this. The Lodge responded positively to the community fishermen and to date have supported them with uniforms, boats and motors, fuel and vehicles to transport them around the area and take poachers to the Kariba police station. Local National Parks, Nyaminyami Rural District Council, police and the surrounding community are all working together, despite their limited resources, to conserve, protect and rehabilitate this beautiful area."

Tapson described a typical day of anti-poaching activities. Their day starts at sunrise when they go out into the bush looking for snares and captured animals. He said they can find anything up to 60 snares a day which they dismantle and destroy. Then as the sun sets, they begin to get ready for the night watch on the water. A patrol can be anything from four to seven days out in the bush and on the water.  Tapson says: ‘’Within the first four months, we managed to start to control illegal activities in this area, we are fighting for and protecting our heritage and we will continue to do so. We don’t want our future generations to read about and see a picture of a Tiger Fish in a book… We want them to see a beautiful, live fish in the lake.’’

 

Since the inception of the EPS in 2010, over 300 hundred poachers have been arrested, thousands of wire snares and traps have been collected and hundreds of meters of nylon fishing nets confiscated. People may argue that the fishermen are trying to earn a living however they stray out of the designated fishing areas, into the protected breeding areas, thus damaging the fragile balance of fish reserves in the lake. The anti poaching unit often return to base with tonnes of fish, and with dead and decaying or near dead animals caught in the traps. 

Of course this all comes at a cost. A cost that so far the lodge, and a few donations have been carrying. The units need feeding, protective clothing, new communications systems, and fuel and maintenance costs for vehicles and boats for patrolling. Currently all vehicles and boats are owned and maintained by the lodge.

Follow the link to our web page: http://www.gachegachelodge.com/environment-protection

Future developments

Due to its success in the Gache Gache area, GGEPS has been approached by other councils and the National Parks Authority of Zimbabwe, to protect other areas within the region. This comes as a great compliment, in a society where outside interference such as this is often shunned. These areas include the Songo Wilderness area and the Phundundu Wilderness areas, covering some 300 000hectares of prime habitat, along the shores of Lake Kariba and the Zambezi Escarpment. Both areas in recent years have been very badly poached, but fortunately the local authorities have realised what a negative impact this has had, and are actively seeking assistance to bring it under control. Both areas still have a core of wildlife in them, so if protected will breed and repopulate the areas, also once these areas are made safer, wildlife will be attracted in from surrounding high pressure areas. This will come at great cost, as education programs will have to be embarked upon, new anti poaching rangers will have to be employed and trained, deployment logistics considered, vehicles, communications and other equipment will have to be taken care of.

There is also on offer a previous private game reserve, Ruwanzi Ranch, which we want to resuscitate, and create a sanctuary for the orphaned, injured and rehabilitated animals. This ranch is an ideal setting for a sanctuary such as this, it has perfect habitat for most of the game species of Zimbabwe. Unfortunately it has been very run down, and needs a large sum of money to bring it up to standard. Money is required for fencing, re-equipping the antipoaching unit, and for infrastructure maintenance such as roads, and dams to supply water to the wildlife.

If sufficient funds are raised over and above the target, we will then start prioritising funds into these areas.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help with a cash donation, but would like to donate in kind, any contributions are most welcome. Please also share this link in all your social networks, facebook, twitter, linkdin etc. Remember, this project will utilise any thing given to it, so the more people who now about it the better, lets see if we can get this trending. We would like to thankyou in advance for your help

 

About the co-ordinator

Gavin Havercroft

After a trip to the Gache Gache area with my 10 year old nephew, we were under no illusion of the good work that was been carried out by the management, staff and antipoaching unit of the GGEPS. My nephew embarked on his own fundraising project for the Antipoaching campaign, and raised over $200 from garage sales, raffles and car boot sales. Following his enthusiasm I decided that I should try and do something as well. Having set up my own crowdfunding platforms crowd2IPO and icrowdafrica (both equity based platforms, rather than reward based platforms) I decided to look for another crowdfunding platform with which to raise some funding for the project. Indiegogo seemed like the best option with which to do a project such as this.  Growing up in the bush of Zimbabwe left an appreciation of the wildlife and environment that is hard to describe. I believe that it would be socially irresponsible for me not to try and leave the bush the way I was fortunate enough to grow up in, for our children’s and grandchildren’s sake.

story:
Summary

Finisia Medrano and crew are a small tribe of rewilders who are banded together by the ideal of returning to simpler and truly sustainable life way. They do their best to walk a symbiotic life, giving back as they go, collecting and planting back wild foods Spring through Fall. For the most part, the group subsists without the need for financial donation. However, as a harsh winter is approaching, they have come into a situation that is especially difficult and requiring dollars and resources. Financial support is necessary to ensure that their horses get enough to eat and that they have enough firewood to last through the winter.

See more:
https://www.youtube.com/user/Finisiamedrano

What We Need

We are seeking to raise $2500 to support Finisia and camp through the winter.  This money will be spent on hay, primary veterinary expenses, and firewood.

The Impact

In the spring, healthy humans and horses will ride out into the mountains to continue their nomadic journey, returning wild gardens to abundance and tending the sacred hoops.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are in the area and are interested in donating hay, veterinary services, firewood, or other horse supplies it is graciously welcomed and encouraged. 

All donations big and small are greatly appreciated as every dollar is of great help. 

If you would like to personally reach out to the group you can contact me or the group  - 

https://www.facebook.com/fuzzywarmcoyote?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/michael.ridge2?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/stephen.henry.904750?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/kelsey.wilber.14?fref=ts

story:
Hi, I am Sonam Wangchuk from Ladakh, a beautiful trans-Himalayan mountain desert on the Tibetan plateau, in the extreme north of India. I am a mechanical engineer by training, but have mostly worked in education reforms in my region. This included setting up the SECMOL Alternative School (www.secmol.org) well known for its innovative solutions to the region's educational and environmental problems.  Apart from children, I like to play with fire, ice, earth and sun, meaning I have been studying and doing experiments with efficient stoves, artificial glaciers and ultra-modern mud houses that are heated solely by the sun.  I won’t write more about myself, you can Google my name (an unusual name helps). 

Typical landscape of Ladakh near our school and a closer-up view of the school.

Over the years, students and teachers at the SECMOL School Campus have been working on various innovative projects ranging from solar heated mud buildings that need no heating even in -25C, low cost greenhouses that enable large scale farming even in Ladakhi winters, underground mud pipes that are one tenth the cost of the cheapest water pipes, solar rickshaws, solar heated bio-gas plant and rocket stoves that cook and heat with a fraction of the wood needed by other stoves and even bake bread with the exhaust heat... just to name a few.


THE ICE STUPA ARTIFICIAL GLACIER PROJECT

In January 2014 at this school some of our students worked with me on an interesting project that we called the Ice Stupa.  Our aim was to find a solution to the water crisis facing Ladakhi farmers in the critical planting months of April and May before the natural glacial melt waters start flowing.

By the end of February we had successfully built a two-storey prototype of an ice stupa which could store roughly 150,000 liters of winter stream water which nobody wants.  We called it an Ice Stupa because the shape resembled the traditional  stupas of Ladakh and Tibet.

 

A traditional mud stupa.

This large stupa of ice was meant to test an idea that could save many villages in the Himalayas from the water crisis caused by fast melting glaciers.  As the natural glaciers are becoming smaller and smaller in size there is much less water in early spring and then they release lots during the hotter summers and become even smaller. With these ice stupas the fresh snow and ice in the mountains that melt even in winter and goes waste can be frozen and stored until spring when farmers need the most. 

However the idea of making artificial glaciers is not new. I had heard stories of how people in Ladakh and Baltistan would go high up into the mountains above 14,000 feet and do what they called glacier grafting, to 'grow' new glaciers. Their methods were not very scientific, but in recent years a senior Ladakhi civil engineer Mr. Norphel worked on freezing the waste water in winter through diversion canals to make vast fields of ice at high altitudes. His work inspired me a lot, and he asked me to work on overcoming the limitations that he was facing in his technique.  These artificial glaciers needed regular maintenance of the canals. Since they were possible only above the altitude of 13,000 feet (4,000 m), villagers were not inclined to do the hard work of climbing up and down those heights. Secondly even at these heights these glaciers had to be made at special spots shaded from the sun by a north facing steep mountain.  These conditions are not easy to find in most villages.

So I started thinking of ways to solve these problems. I questioned the fundamental belief that these glaciers had to be made so high up, and in the shade. I observed that for the spring sun and winds to melt the ice, they needed large surface areas. So if we reduced this area exposed to the sun and wind, then the ice could be stored in the village itself, thus eliminate the need for villagers to climb the mountains.  That’s when we came up with the idea of forming cones of ice rising vertically towards the sun with much smaller surface area exposed to the sun compared to ice fields formed on flat ground, for a given volume of water. 

For example one Ice Stupa of 40 m height and 20 m radius would store roughly sixteen million litres of water.  If the same amount of water were frozen as a flat ice field 2 m thick, the area exposed to sun would be roughly five times more. Therefore the sun and the warm spring winds would melt it roughly 5 times faster.

The technology used for making the ice cones is very simple. As explained in the video, it is based on the principle that water always maintains its level, whether in a cup, a lake or inside a pipe. So we are able to make the water at one end of a pipe rise many stories high, simply by dipping its other end higher up-stream.  And in Ladakh water falling out (or sprinkled) from such heights freezes immediately due to the cold air temperature. It gradually takes the shape of a natural cone.

PROOF OF THE (ICE) PUDDING IS IN THE HEATING!

It was to prove this hypothesis that we built our 6m (20 feet) high prototype.  And sure enough, while all the ice on the flat ground melted by mid-March, the Stupa lasted till 18th May i.e. early summer, when trees were all green and temperatures had started approaching +30 C.  Our deadline to call this experiment a success was 1st of May but on that date it still stood 3m tall. 

By mid- March all the flat ice on ground had melted, but not our Stupa.

By May it was an unusual sight of ice and greenery at the same time.

The prototype was built in the warmest possible conditions, so that if it succeeds here then it can succeed anywhere.  It was built at the lowest possible altitude in the whole Leh valley, right on the bank of Indus river at 10,400 feet (3,170 m), and exposed to sun (except for the prayer flags, mentioned later).

The Monk (HH the Rinpochey), The Engineer and The Artificial Glacier on 1st of May 2014.

Pleased by this outcome, His Holiness Drikung Kyabgon Chetsang Rinpochey who visited and blessed our School and the Ice Stupa on 1st of May,  wanted SECMOL to build a full scale version of the Ice Stupa artificial glacier at the top of the vast deserts of Phyang village. His Holiness is one of the highest incarnate Lamas in Tibetan Buddhism, and is also known for his green activism in the Himalayas (http://www.drikung.org) .  HH wanted to green the Phyang desert under the Go Green Go Organic movement. 

The famous Phyang Monastery and the vast deserts below:


WHY CROWD FUNDING?
In the olden days Ladakhi people used to build stupas near the monasteries by a system of democratic labour contribution called hala. We thought it would be interesting today in the digital age, to build ice stupas using global contribution in the form of a digital hala.  Besides, it only makes sense to invite global contribution to help solve the problems we are facing here in the mountains, since whether we like it or not, we receive more than our fair share of the impact of your other global (warming) contributions  :P
So this winter people of the world get together to build a field of ice stupas near the Phyang monastery to help the villagers and the monks in greening the desert. 
In September there was a meeting of HH the Rinpochey and villagers of Phyang to discuss the project. This included Buddhists as well as Muslims from the village.

Monks and village leaders of Phyang gathered at the monastery wave and thank the people of the world for their support in greening the deserts.  Once this project is complete there should be enough water to green the entire desert of roughly 1,500 acres. They also discussed the possibilities of turning the Phyang desert into a sustainable eco-city where all the houses would be built of earth and powered and heated solely by the sun.


THE FORMAL LAUNCH OF THE ICE STUPA CAMPAIGN

Then on 13th of October His Excellency Sh. NN Vohra, the Governor of Jammu and Kashmir State, launched the Ice Stupa Artificial Glacier Project at an international conference on climate change and adaptation. He did so by clicking open our short film - The Monk, The Engineer and The Artificial Glacier.

The Monk, The Engineer and the Governor of the state... just after the launch.

SCHEDULE:

Mid-October to mid-November 2014
Work on ground preparation starts,

End of November
Pipe laying will be completed .

End of November
First ice experiments will start.

Early December till end of February 2015
Main work of raising the stupas will happen.

Early March 2015
A festival to celebrate and consecrate the stupas will happen around 5th of March.  People of the village and surrounding areas will come to put prayer flags of different religions on the Stupas. Putting Buddhist prayer flags on Stupas is a traditional practice in Ladakh and Tibet but in this case the prayer flags will have a scientific function too.  To partially shade the stupas from the strong spring sun and to break the speed of the warm spring winds… two main factors that melt any glaciers fast in summer.

So it wouldn’t be a total lie if we say to the villagers that their prayer flags would please the heavens and the ice stupas would last much longer :P .  This is what we did on the prototype stupa and it looked beautiful.


THE TEAM


To execute this project we have an amazing team.

Technical team:
Apart from myself we have Dr. Tsewang Thinlas. Specialist in Hydrology, with a Masters degree from IIT Mumbai and PhD from IIT Delhi.  He will be assisted by Stanzin Shara from SECMOL School and many volunteers from India and abroad.

Execution team: 
Lama Rigzin Dorjai.  Venerable Rigzin is the manager of Pheyang monastery and has 15 years of experience in managing constructions at the monastery.  Apart from this he is a monk who has completed his Lo sum Chos Sum meditative retreat of three years, three months and three days in isolation.  Ven. Rigzin will be assisted by other monks in the monastery.

Film and documentation team:

Stanzin Dorjai Gya:  A former student of SECMOL School. His is an interesting story of a shepherd-turned-film-maker.  His films have won many international awards in India and Europe.  He will be assisted by Tsewang Paldan and Stanzin Detsal and Lars Lidstrom.

Logistics and supplies:

P Tsering:  A self-made technical geek, he lives and works in Delhi and has great knowledge of every lane and back alley of the city’s techno-markets to get any products and materials needed for our project. He will be assisted in Jammu by Stanzin Namgyal, a PhD scholar at Jammu University and former student of SECMOL school.  He and his team will look after the supply of materials from Jammu city.


HOW  YOU CAN JOIN THIS ?

1. You can contribute however small or big.  $ 10 or $ 10,000, it is the spirit that counts.  It may not be easy to see the possible impact of your contribution at present;  but your $ 10 could pave the way for billions of dollars when this experiment is successful and is picked up by the mainstream development machinery i.e. government and other agencies for all the other villages in Ladakh and beyond.

 2. Apart from contributing with your credit card after you read this story you can also spread the news among your friends and relatives and on social media.
If you are not able to make a financial contribution don't worry at all, that's not the only way to help. This is as much an Education-Campaign as it is a Fund-Raising campaign.

3. You can host small events in your neighbourhood to screen the film and discuss and spread awareness about climate issues and people's lifestyles and then help them make their contributions if they like.

This would make you an Ice Stupa Ambassador. If you want to do this you should get in touch with us at icestupa@gmail.com .

4. You can also use this story to educate your children or your students about the consequences of their behaviour and lifestyle on people in the mountains and the seashores.

5. If you have a particular skill related to the project or are the truly adventurous type you can join as a volunteer to work on the ice stupa making starting November. Don't forget: we will be working in -15 C nights!

6. You can support our cause by cutting down on a lifestyle that causes climate change. For example you can pledge to use public transport, bicycle, train or car pool where possible instead a private car or air travel.

I will be happiest if the amount you donate to this project comes from cutting down on a not so healthy activity in your life.  Say from that avoidable air travel you were considering, or by saying 'No' to the 12th pair of shoes or the third car in your family.

Best of all will be if this festive season you decide not to buy conventional industry-made products as Christmas gifts, and instead gift your dear ones  a portion of an Ice Stupa in the Himalayas. We'll send you a beautiful card that says so, and expresses your sentiment.  Similarly for the Hindu festival of Diwali you could save your city the noise and pollution of fire crackers,  and brighten the lives of mountain farmers by supporting the Ice Stupa project.

Whatever you do, it would be great if you could make a one-minute video with your message to the world and if possible, state what unhealthy practice you gave up or forgo this year, to contribute to this project. You can then post it on social media just after making your contribution.

Please share such videos only after you make the contribution and not before (we don’t want you to make a video and forget the contribution, the reverse would be more acceptable !). And at the end of the video you can invite (not challenge) three of your closest friends to make a similar gesture.  We could call this “the Ice Stupa Invitation”.

In short your video could have three components:

1. Your short message to the world,

2. What did you cut down to make your donation?

3. Which three people would you invite to do the same?

For sharing such videos and your opinions in general you could use our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/icestupa
and on Twitter: https://twitter.com/icestupa

Of course if you are not comfortable with video you could just make a written post on the above social media sites saying the same things.


BUDGET


Our actual project budget is $ 100,000.  The rest has been added for covering platform fees, bank/credit card charges, rewards, perks and shipment costs for supporters.

Although the project is a collaboration of our school (SECMOL) and  Phyang monastery, we have requested that the final amount should go into the bank accounts of the monastery under the personal supervision of  His Holiness.  Our school will provide and organise all the expertise, consultation and project management staff/volunteers etc. for fund-raising as well as planning and execution of the project throughout  winter. For this we will be suitably compensated from the project budget. Part of this amount will be used to run a course in solar energy at the Campus.

The above target amount of $ 119,500 is based on standard rates of materials, labour etc. in the market. In reality we may have volunteers donating their labour equipment etc… but we cannot count on such things at this stage… Therefore we pledge that if any money is saved or left over from this project then every penny will go towards a dream project of the Phyang monastery and SECMOL -  setting up an Alternative Mountain University (on the desert near the monastery) that conducts research & development and higher educational courses for Himalayan youth in mountain studies and climate change adaptation strategies, apart from other themes. We assure you every dollar will be accounted for.

Same holds true in case people of the world decide to surprise us pleasantly by contributing 10 times more than the target amount ;) . Not an unfair expectation , if you consider that we receive perhaps 100 times more impact than our contribution to the climate change scenario!  In any case we will remain prudent and use any extra funds for research and action on climate change through the proposed Alternative University.

So don’t please hesitate to surprise us pleasantly and if possible please make and post a one-minute video or post with your message to the world.  I mean the...   ICE STUPA INVITATION!

Many thanks for your time and amazing patience.


Sonam Wangchuk
icestupa@gmail.com

こんにちは、ソナム・ワングチュクです。私はインドの極北、チベット高原にある美しいヒ

マラヤ山脈の砂漠、ラダックの出身です。機械技師としての教育を受けましたが、専ら故郷

の教育改革のために活動しています。このエリアの教育・環境問題に革新的な解決策をもた

らしている有名なSECMOLというオルタナティブ・スクール

(www.secmol.org)の設立もその一環です。子供以外では、火、氷、地球、

太陽と戯れることが好きです。つまり、効率的なストーブ、人工氷河、太陽の熱だけで暖め

られている究極の現代的な家、土の家。それらを研究しているのです。私自身のことはこれ

くらいにしますが、私についてさらに知りたい方は私の名前（珍しい名前であることに感謝

！）で検索いただければと思います。

これが私達の学校のすぐ側、典型的なラダックの風景です。そして学校の近影です。

何年もの間、SECMOLスクールキャンパスの生徒と教師達は様々な革新的プロジェクト

のために研究しています。マイナス25度の温度の中でも暖房の要らない土の建物を太陽熱で

暖める方法や、冬のラダックでも大規模農業を可能にする低価格の温室や、最安の水パイプ

の10分の1の価格の地下の土パイプ、ソーラー人力車、バイオガス工場、少量の木材で料理

・暖房出来ておまけにその熱でパンまでも焼けるロケットストーブなどなど。これらは研究

のほんの一部です。

氷卒塔婆、ラダックの人工氷河プロジェクト

2014年1月、私はこの学校の生徒数人と『氷卒塔婆』という興味深いプロジェクトに着手し

ました。自然の氷河が解けて流れ出す前の四月と五月、ラダックの農家は水不足に直面しま

す。それを解決することこそこのプロジェクトの目的です。

二月末までに、二階建ての試作模型を作ることに成功しました。この卒塔婆は冬の間、誰も

使わない川の流れから大体15万リットルの水を貯めることが出来ます。私達これをは『氷卒

塔婆』と呼ぶことにしました。形がチベットとラダックの伝統的な卒塔婆に良く似ているか

伝統的な『土の卒塔婆』

この巨大な氷の卒塔婆は、温暖化によって、氷河がどんどんなくなっている現象によって起

こる水不足からヒマラヤの村々を救うというアイデアが有効かを試すものです。自然の氷河

は年々小さくなっているので、特に早春に溶ける水は少なく、逆に暑い夏になると、多量の

水が溶け出して、さらに氷河が縮小します。この氷の卒塔婆を作ることによって、冬の間も

解けていて、無駄になっている氷や雪を春まで凍らせておくことによって、農家の人たちが

水が一番必要な時期に使うことが出来るようになるのです。

しかし人工的な氷河を作るというこのアイデアは新しいものではありません。ラダックとバ

ルティスターンの人々が1万4千フィート（約４３００ｍ）の高さの山に上り、新しい氷河を

「育ててきた」（彼らが言うところの『氷河移植』）という話は何度も聞いたことがありま

した。その方法は科学的なものでありません。しかし近年ラダックの土木技師ノーフェル氏

が、高地で広大な氷を作るため、分水路を通して余分な水を冬の間に凍らせる活動をしてき

ました。私は彼の活動に多大な刺激を受けました。そして技術の限界を感じていた彼は私の

参加を求めてきたのです。人工氷河は水路の定期的なメンテナンスが必要です。この方法で

は、水路は標高4000メートル以上のところだけが可能であり、村人が山と水路の間を往来す

るのは大変です。更に、氷河は険しい山の中、太陽の光を遮る場所で作られなければいけま

せん。こういった条件をクリアすることはほとんどの村で難しいのです。

私はこれらの問題の解決策を考えるようになりました。私は「氷河は標高の高い日陰で作ら

れるべき」という根本的な考えに疑問を持ちました。そして春の太陽と雪が氷を溶かすため

には広大な表面積が必要なことに気づきました。つまり太陽・風が当たる面積を減らせば、

氷河は村に貯蔵することが可能で、そうなれば村人が山を登る必要はないのです。その時私

は太陽に向かって垂直に氷を作るというアイデアを思いつきました。そうすれば平らな地面

に作る氷のフィールドに比べ、当たる太陽光がかなり削減されます。

例えば、半径20メートル・高さ40メートルの氷の卒塔婆は、一体で大体1600万リットルの水

を貯蓄できます。もし同じ量の水を厚さ2メートルにして平らに凍らせた場合、太陽熱に晒

される面積は卒塔婆の５倍になります。陽光と春風は５倍の速さで氷を溶かしてしまうわけ

氷の円錐を作る方法は非常にシンプルです。ビデオで説明されているように、それは、カッ

プや湖、パイプの中であろうと変わらない水の性質にのっとっています。つまりパイプの片

方側の水を数階の高さに吹き上げ、もう片方側をただ上流に垂らせばよいのです。そしてラ

ダックでは、空気中の温度が低いため、流れた水（または、まかれた水）はあっという間に

凍ってしまうのです。それが繰り返されることによって徐々に自然の円錐が形作られていく

暑さに負けない氷のプリン！

6メートルの試作模型を作ったことでこの仮説は証明されました。平らな地面の氷が三月半

ばまでに溶けてしまう中、この卒塔婆は5月18日、木々の葉が緑になり温度が30度近くにな

る初夏まで残ったのです。実験成功が決定した5月1日には卒塔婆はまだ3メートル残ってい

3月半ばまでに、地面上の平らな氷は解けてしまいましたが、卒塔婆は残っていました。

五月まで、緑と氷とが並ぶという珍しい光景を見ることが出来ました。

試作模型は最も温暖な条件の中で作成されました。つまりここで成功したということは、他

の場所でも成功するということです。レー峡谷で最も標高の低い場所、標高3170メートルの

インダス川沿いに作られ、お祈りの旗（タルチョー）以外は、太陽光にあたっていたのです

から。（タルチョーについては後述します）

僧侶の高僧。技師で2014年5月1日の人工氷河の製作者です。

ディグン　キャブゴンチェツァン高僧（リンポチェイ）はこの結果に喜び、我がスクールと

卒塔婆を訪れて祝ってくれました。そして、ピャン村の砂漠の頂上に試作でなく、完全な氷

卒塔婆を立てて欲しいとSECMOLに要請したのです。聖下はチベット仏教において最も

位の高い生き仏であり、ヒマラヤでの緑化活動 

(http://www.drikung.org)でも知られています。彼は『Go 

Green Go Organic』活動の下、ピャン砂漠を緑化したいと願ったのです。

有名なピャン寺院と広大な砂漠。

何故クラウドファンディングか？

古代、ラダックの人々は僧院の側に卒塔婆を建てていました。その行為は市民による民主的

な労働貢献で、ハラと呼ばれていました。このデジタル全盛期の時代に、地球の力でもって

氷の卒塔婆を作ることは「デジタルなハラ」と言うことも出来ます。この考えは面白いと思

いませんか？　その上、この山脈で直面している問題を解決するために地球に貢献してもら

うことは意味のあることです。なぜなら好むと好まざるに関係なく、私たちは地球温暖化の

影響を自分たちのシェア以上に受けているからです。

そしてこの冬、世界の人々はピャン寺院の側に氷卒塔婆を建てるために力を合わせます！そ

して砂漠を緑に変え村人と僧侶たちを助けるのです。

9月にはプロジェクトについて、高僧（リンポチェイ）とピャンの村人たちとで話し合う場

が設けられました。村からは仏教徒だけでなくイスラム教徒の人々も参加しました。

僧侶と村のリーダーたちは僧院に集合し、砂漠緑化計画を支持する世界の人々に感謝しまし

た。プロジェクトが完了すれば、6百万ｍ2もの砂漠を緑に変えるのに充分な水が生まれるこ

とになります。彼らはまたピャン砂漠を、自然資源で建てた住宅と太陽光のみでエネルギー

と熱をまかなう持続可能なエコシティへと変える可能性についても意見を交わしました。

氷卒塔婆キャンペーン、本格始動。

10月13日、ジャム・カシミール州の知事でもある、 エヌ・エヌ・ ヴォホラ閣下は気候変動

適応のための国際会議にて、『氷卒塔婆・人工氷河プロジェクト』を立ち上げました。そこ

で私たちのフィルム『僧侶、技師と人工氷河』を使用したのです。

ラダックの僧侶、技師と人工氷河。プロジェクト立ち上げの後。

2014年、10月半ば～11月半ば。

パイプ取り付け完了。

12月はじめ～2015年2月末

卒塔婆の形成が開始。

1日頃、卒塔婆の祝い・奉納を始める。村人、近隣住民が卒塔婆に様々なタルチョーをかけ

るために集まる。ラダック・チベットでは仏教の（祈りの旗）タルチョーを卒塔婆にかける

のが伝統的なならわしだが、この場合タルチョーは科学的な意味を持つ。氷河を溶かす二大

要素、強い春の日差しと春の風から卒塔婆を守るのだ。

そのため、祈りのタルチョーによって天界が卒塔婆の溶解を遅らせると私たちが村人に言っ

たことは嘘ではありません！　試作の卒塔婆はそういうふうに作り、とても美しく完成しま

このプロジェクト実施のために素晴らしいチームが結成されました。

私以外の構成員は、ドクター・ツェワンティンレー。デリー。IITの博士号とIITムン

バイ修士 で水文学の学位を修めた専門家。インド国内、国外からのボランティアと

SECMOLスクールのスタンジン・シャラの支援を受けることになります。

お坊さんであるリグジン・ドルジェ。彼はピャン僧院のマネージャーで、同僧院の建設を15

年間に渡り管理していた経験があります。また、3年間、3ヶ月、3日の間孤立した中で瞑想

するロスム・チュスム（３年３か月３日の瞑想）というリトリートを成し遂げた僧侶でもあ

ります。彼は僧院の僧たちの支援を受けます。

ドキュメントフィルム　チーム

スタンジン・ドルジェ・ギャはSECMOLスクールの元学生です。彼は羊飼いから映画監

督に転身した面白い経歴の持ち主です。インドやヨーロッパで数々の国際的な賞を

受賞しています。彼はツェワン・パルダン、スタンジン・デツァル、ラールス・リドウトロ

ムの支援を受けています。

ピ・ツェリンはあらゆる技術を自作する『技術オタク』で、デリーで生活しています。都市

のテクノロジー市場の表から裏までを知り尽くしており、本プロジェクトに必要な材料と製

品を揃えてくれます。ジャムではSECMOLスクールの元学生でありジャム大学の学者で

あるスタンジン・ナムギャルの支援を受けます。彼とそのチームはジャムからの材料供給を

あなたの参加をお待ちしています！

１．寄付はいくらからでも受け付けます。千円でも１００万円でも寄付への気持ちは変わり

ません。貴方の寄付がもたらす影響を今すぐ感じるのは難しいかも知れません。でも貴方の

千円が積もって多額の寄付金となり、実験が成功しメジャーな開発機構（政府や企業）がラ

ダックの村々のために動く結果になり得るのです。

2．クレジットカードでの寄付以外にも出来ることはあります。友人、家族や親戚へ、ソー

シャルメディアで、このニュースを伝えて下さい。

金銭的援助が難しくても問題ありません。それだけが支援ではないのです。資金集めのキャ

ンペーンであると同時に、教育的なキャンペーンでもあるのですから。

３．ご自分で、フィルム上映会を企画して、気候問題と生活スタイルへの関心を広げ寄付を

サポートする方法もあります。

そうすれば貴方は氷卒塔婆大使になれるのです。興味のある方は 

icestupa@gmail.comまでご連絡ください。

４．この物語を語ることで、海や山で暮らす人々の行動やライフスタイルについて子供や生

徒達に学んでもらうことが出来ます。

５．貴方がプロジェクトに関連した専門スキルを持っている、または冒険心に溢れているな

ら、11月から始まる氷卒塔婆制作にボランティアとして参加することも出来ます。ただし、

マイナス25度の夜に活動することを忘れないで！

6．日々の生活の中で気候変動の原因を減らすことも支援の一つです。例えば移動に自家用

車や飛行機でなく、公共機関、自転車、電車やカープールを使用することです。

日々の不健康的な行為の節制によって、プロジェクトへの寄付が生まれるとしたら、嬉しい

限りです。飛行機旅行を止めましょう。要らない靴を持つこと、何台もの車をもつことを止

一番素晴らしいのは、このクリスマスシーズンに普段通りの工場で作られたものを贈るので

はく、大事な人にヒマラヤの氷卒塔婆の一部を贈ることです。貴方の気持ちを代弁して美し

いクリスマスカードをお送りします。同じようにディワリーのヒンドゥー祭りでは、騒いだ

りゴミを出す代わりにプロジェクト支援によって山で生活している農民たちの生活を豊かに

することが出来ます。

プロジェクトのために浪費をやめたことを1分間のメッセージビデオをして世界に伝えれば

それも素晴らしいことです。ソーシャルメディアに投稿してください。

必ず寄付や貢献をした後にビデオをシェアして下さい！（先にビデオを撮って貢献するのを

忘れてしまうのは止めてくださいね。貢献してビデオ撮影を忘れるはokです。）ビデオの

最後に大事な友人3人をこのプロジェクトに招待してください。（どこかのチャレンジとは

違います。）『氷卒塔婆インビテーション』です。

ビデオ撮影のために必要な3か条です

1．世界へ向けたメッセージ

2．寄付のためにあなたが我慢したこと

ビデオと意見とをシェアするにはFacebookかTwitterの登録が必要です

。https://www.facebook.com/icestupa 

　https://twitter.com/icestupa

もちろんビデオが好きでない方は、ソーシャルメディアへの投稿で構いません。

実際のプロジェクト予算は10万ドル（約一千万円）です。その他、綱領・銀行/クレジット

カード手数料、報酬・心づけ・郵送費用などが追加されます。

プロジェクトはSECMOLとピャン僧院の共同事業ですが、僧院の銀行口座にて聖下の個

人的監護の下に資金は集められています。SECMOLが、冬の間プロジェクトの計画・実

施と同様資金調達のため、専門知識・コンサル・スタッフなどをオーガナイズします。予算

については補償されます。金額の一部は、授業内の太陽エネルギーのコース実施のため使用

目標金額の11万9500ドル（約１１９５万円）は材料費・人件費の市場標準額です。実際には

多くのボランティアが労働を提供してくれますが、現時点での算出は不可能です。そのため

プロジェクトで少しでも余分な資金があれば、1円でもピャン僧院とSECMOLの夢のプ

ロジェクトに費やしたいと考えています。オルタナティブ・マウンテン・ユニバーシティ（

僧院の近くの砂漠にあります）を設立し、山の研究や気候変動適応戦略についてヒマラヤの

若者向けの授業やR&Dを実施するのです。あなたの募金は1円とも無駄にはなりません。

もし世界の人々が目標金額の10倍を寄付してくれたとしても、同じことが当てはまります

！　もし寄付の100倍の影響が気候変動にもたらされたとしたら、それは決して不当な見通

しではありません。なんにせよ余資金はオルタナティブ・ユニバーシティを通じ、気候変動

のための調査と実行に慎重に使用されます。

どうぞ、躊躇しないでこのプロジェクトに参加してください！　そして出来ればビデオを作

ってメッセージを世界に向けて投稿し、『氷卒塔婆インビテーション』を活用してください

ご清読頂きありがとうございました。

Sonam Wangchuk

icestupa@gmail.com

最後にピャンの鳥瞰図です。僧院近くの氷卒塔婆、完成図のイメージです。この冬３～５体

の卒塔婆を建設する予定です。

クレジット・デビットカード・NEFT・ネットバンキングでのお振込みを希望の方は、又

は上の口座にお振込みができなかった方々はicestupa@gmail.comまでお

問い合わせください。折り返し詳細をご案内します。

特権を選択する：

10ドル　初めての方用

金額は関係なく寄付は大歓迎です！　10ドル寄付の方には、本プロジェクトチームからの感

謝のメールをお送りします。またメーリングリストへ登録させていただき、プロジェクトの

状況やここでしか見られない写真など新情報をお送りさせていただきます。　

20ドル　溢れる感謝

寄付に感謝致します。プロジェクトチームからの感謝メールの他、技術者Sonam 

Wangchukからのカードをお送りします。スペシャルメーリングリストに登録させて

いただき、プロジェクト詳細と画像をシェアさせて頂きます。

50ドル　壁に名前が！

ヒマラヤ山脈に囲まれた壁に貴方の名前が刻まれます！　50ドルの寄付で、氷河の敷地内の

壁に一言残すことが出来ます。加えてチームからの感謝のメール・カード、メーリングリス

トへの登録と情報のシェアをさせて頂きます。

100ドル　『ゾ』パッケージ

技術者Sonam Wangchukからのチベットモチーフの特製感謝カード、チームか

らの感謝メールが届きます。厳選メーリングリストへの登録に加え、後世へ残す壁への名前

250ドル　ヤククリスマス　ギフトパック

お祭りのシーズンに、大事に人にユニークなギフトを贈りませんが？　氷河プロジェクトの

贈り物は決して忘れることの出来ないものになるはずです。250ドルの寄付で、4枚のクリス

マスカードをお届けします。そのカードで氷卒塔婆への想いを大事な人と共有して下さい。

もしくはカードの代わりに吉兆を意味する白いスカーフを高僧からお送りします。

500ドル　タルチョパッケージ

タルチョとは伝統的な祈りの旗のことです。タルチョは幸運と平和への祈りのため頂上から

山路へと飾られています。貴方の寄付と貢献に感謝して、高僧からタルチョをお送りします

。加えて高僧と技術者からの感謝カード、名前の刻印、クリスマスカード7枚のお届けなど

特典がいっぱいです。

1000ドル　カタックパッケージ

カタックとは純粋な絹紡のスカーフで、ラダックへの訪問者を歓迎していることを意味しま

す。貴方の寄付と貢献に感謝して、高僧から絹のスカーフをお送りします。またプロジェク

トのDVD、クリスマスカード8枚をお送りします。

5000ドル　外交官任命

是非レーにいらして下さい！

します。（宿泊費・食費は不要です）スペシャルゲストとして除幕式に参加し、高僧に謁見

して下さい。そしてインダス谷でのツアーを楽しんで下さい。

10,000ドル　ヒマラヤの輝き

素晴らしい貢献に感謝致します。友人・パートナーと一緒に除幕式にいらして、ラダックの

伝統的なおもてなしを楽しんで下さい。スペシャルゲストとして歓迎いたします。レー到着

後、空港からホテル・ゲストハウスへ送迎します。（宿泊費・食費は不要です）除幕式にて

高僧に謁見して下さい。インダス谷へのツアーもご用意します。

※本キャンペーンに禁止事項があればお知らせ下さい。
story_txt:
Hi, I am Sonam Wangchuk from Ladakh, a beautiful trans-Himalayan mountain desert on the Tibetan plateau, in the extreme north of India. I am a mechanical
engineer by training, but have mostly worked in education reforms in my region. This included setting up the SECMOL Alternative School (www.secmol.org) well known for its
innovative solutions to the region's educational and environmental problems.  Apart from children, I like to play with fire, ice, earth and sun, meaning I have been studying and doing experiments with efficient stoves, artificial glaciers and ultra-modern mud houses that are heated solely by the sun.  I won’t write more about myself, you can Google my
name (an unusual name helps). Typical landscape of Ladakh near our school and a closer-up view of the school.Over the years, students and teachers at the SECMOL School Campus have been working on various innovative projects ranging from solar heated mud buildings that need no heating even in -25C,
low cost greenhouses that enable large scale farming even in Ladakhi winters, underground mud pipes that are one tenth the cost of the cheapest water pipes, solar rickshaws, solar heated bio-gas plant and rocket stoves that cook and heat with a fraction of the wood needed by other stoves and even bake bread with the exhaust heat... just to name a few.

THE ICE STUPA ARTIFICIAL GLACIER PROJECT


In January 2014 at this school some of our students worked with me on
an interesting project that we called the Ice Stupa.  Our aim was to find a solution to the water crisis facing Ladakhi farmers in the critical planting months of April and May before the natural glacial melt waters start flowing.
By the end of February we had successfully built a two-storey prototype of an ice stupa which could store roughly 150,000
liters of winter stream water which nobody wants.  We
called it an Ice Stupa because the shape resembled the traditional  stupas of Ladakh and Tibet.
 
A traditional mud stupa.

This large stupa of ice was meant to test an
idea that could save many villages in the Himalayas from the water crisis
caused by fast melting glaciers.  As the natural glaciers are becoming smaller and smaller in size there is much less water in early spring and then they release lots during the hotter summers and become even smaller. With these ice stupas the fresh snow and ice in the mountains that melt even in winter and goes waste can be frozen and stored until spring when farmers need the most. 
However the idea of making artificial glaciers is
not new. I had heard stories of how people in Ladakh and Baltistan would go high up
into the mountains above 14,000 feet and do what they called glacier grafting,
to 'grow' new glaciers. Their methods were not very scientific, but in recent years a senior Ladakhi civil engineer Mr. Norphel worked on freezing
the waste water in winter through diversion canals to make vast fields of ice at high altitudes. His work inspired me
a lot, and he asked me to work on overcoming the limitations that he was facing in his technique.  These artificial glaciers needed regular maintenance of
the canals. Since they were possible only above the altitude of 13,000 feet (4,000 m), villagers were not inclined to do the hard work of climbing up and down those heights. Secondly even at these heights these glaciers had to be made
at special spots shaded from the sun by a north facing steep mountain.  These conditions are not easy to find in
most villages.
So I started thinking of ways to solve these problems. I questioned the fundamental belief that
these glaciers had to be made so high up, and in the shade. I
observed that for the spring sun and winds to melt the ice, they needed large
surface areas. So if we reduced this area exposed to the sun and
wind, then the ice could be stored in the village itself, thus eliminate the need for villagers to climb the mountains.  That’s when we came up with the idea of forming cones of ice rising vertically towards the sun with much
smaller surface area exposed to the sun compared to ice fields formed on flat
ground, for a given volume of water. 
For example one Ice Stupa of 40 m height and 20 m radius would store roughly sixteen million litres of water.  If the same amount of water were frozen as a flat ice field 2 m thick, the area exposed to sun would be roughly five times more. Therefore the sun and the warm spring winds would melt it roughly 5 times faster.
The technology used for making the ice cones is very simple. As explained in the video, it is based on the principle that water always maintains its level, whether in a cup, a lake or inside a pipe. So we are able to make the water at one end of a pipe rise many stories high, simply by dipping its other end higher up-stream.  And in Ladakh water falling out (or sprinkled) from such heights freezes immediately due to the cold air temperature. It gradually takes the shape of a natural cone.
PROOF OF THE (ICE) PUDDING IS IN THE HEATING!
It was to prove this hypothesis that we
built our 6m (20 feet) high prototype.  And sure
enough, while all the ice on the flat ground melted by mid-March, the Stupa lasted
till 18th May i.e. early summer, when trees were all green and temperatures
had started approaching +30 C.  Our
deadline to call this experiment a success was 1st of May but on that date it still stood 3m tall. 
By mid- March all the flat ice on ground had melted, but not our Stupa.


By May it was an unusual sight of ice and greenery at the same time.
The prototype was built in the warmest possible conditions, so that if it succeeds here then it can succeed
anywhere.  It was built at the lowest
possible altitude in the whole Leh valley, right on the bank of Indus river at
10,400 feet (3,170 m), and exposed to sun (except for the
prayer flags, mentioned later).


The Monk (HH the Rinpochey), The Engineer and The Artificial Glacier on 1st of May 2014.
Pleased by this outcome, His Holiness Drikung Kyabgon Chetsang Rinpochey who visited and blessed our School and the Ice Stupa on 1st of May,  wanted SECMOL to build a full scale
version of the Ice Stupa artificial glacier at the top of the vast deserts
of Phyang village. His Holiness is one of the highest incarnate Lamas in Tibetan Buddhism, and is also known for his green activism in the Himalayas (http://www.drikung.org) .  HH wanted to green the Phyang desert under the Go Green Go Organic movement. 




The famous Phyang Monastery and the vast deserts below:


WHY CROWD FUNDING?
In the olden days Ladakhi people used to build stupas near the monasteries by a system of democratic labour contribution called hala. We thought it would be interesting today in the digital age, to build ice stupas using global contribution in the form of a digital hala.  Besides, it only makes sense to invite global contribution to help solve the problems we are facing here in the mountains, since whether we like it or not, we receive more than our fair share of the impact of your other global (warming) contributions  :P
So this winter people of the world get together to build a field of ice stupas near the Phyang monastery to help the villagers and the monks in greening the desert. 

In September there was a meeting of HH the Rinpochey and villagers of Phyang to discuss the project. This included Buddhists as well as Muslims from the village.


Monks and village leaders of Phyang gathered at the monastery wave and thank the people of the world for their support in greening the deserts.  Once this project is complete there should be enough water to green the entire desert of roughly 1,500 acres. They also discussed the possibilities of turning the Phyang desert into a sustainable eco-city where all the houses would be built of earth and powered and heated solely by the sun.
THE FORMAL LAUNCH OF THE ICE STUPA CAMPAIGN


Then on 13th of October His Excellency Sh. NN Vohra, the Governor of Jammu and Kashmir State, launched the Ice Stupa Artificial Glacier Project at an international conference on climate change and adaptation. He did so by clicking open our short film - The Monk, The Engineer and The Artificial Glacier.

The Monk, The Engineer and the Governor of the state... just after the launch.
SCHEDULE:
Mid-October to mid-November 2014Work on ground preparation starts,
End of NovemberPipe laying will be completed .
End of NovemberFirst ice experiments will start.
Early December till end of February 2015Main work of raising the stupas will happen.
Early March 2015A festival to celebrate and consecrate the
stupas will happen around 5th of March.  People of the village and surrounding areas
will come to put prayer flags of different religions on the Stupas. Putting Buddhist
prayer flags on Stupas is a traditional practice in Ladakh and Tibet but in
this case the prayer flags will have
a scientific function too.  To partially
shade the stupas from the strong spring sun and to break the speed of the warm
spring winds… two main factors that melt any glaciers fast in summer.
So it wouldn’t
be a total lie if we say to the villagers that their prayer flags would please
the heavens and the ice stupas would last much longer :P .  This is what we did on the prototype stupa
and it looked beautiful.

THE TEAM


To execute this project we have an amazing
team.
Technical team: Apart from myself we have Dr. Tsewang
Thinlas. Specialist in Hydrology, with a Masters degree from IIT Mumbai and PhD from
IIT Delhi.  He will be assisted by
Stanzin Shara from SECMOL School and many volunteers from India and
abroad.
Execution team: Lama Rigzin Dorjai.  Venerable Rigzin is the manager of Pheyang
monastery and has 15 years of experience in managing constructions at the
monastery.  Apart from this he is a monk
who has completed his Lo sum Chos Sum
meditative retreat of three years, three months and three days in isolation.  Ven.
Rigzin will be assisted by other monks in the monastery.
Film and documentation team:
Stanzin Dorjai Gya:  A former student of SECMOL School.
His is an interesting story of a shepherd-turned-film-maker.  His films have won many international awards
in India and Europe.  He will be assisted
by Tsewang Paldan and Stanzin Detsal and Lars Lidstrom.
Logistics and supplies:
P Tsering: 
A self-made technical geek, he lives and works in Delhi and has great
knowledge of every lane and back alley of the city’s techno-markets to get any
products and materials needed for our project. He will be assisted in Jammu by
Stanzin Namgyal, a PhD scholar at Jammu University and former student of SECMOL
school.  He and his team will look after
the supply of materials from Jammu
city.

HOW  YOU CAN JOIN THIS ?
1. You can contribute however small or big.  $ 10 or $ 10,000, it is the spirit that counts.  It may not be easy to see the possible impact of your contribution at present;  but your $ 10 could pave the way for billions of dollars when this experiment is successful and is picked up by the mainstream development machinery i.e. government and other agencies for all the other villages in Ladakh and beyond. 2. Apart from contributing with your credit card after you
read this story you can also spread the news among your friends and relatives
and on social media. If you are not able to make a financial contribution don't worry at all, that's not the only way to help. This is as much an Education-Campaign as it is a Fund-Raising campaign.
3. You can host small events in your
neighbourhood to screen the film and discuss and spread awareness about climate
issues and people's lifestyles and then help them make their contributions if they like. 
This would make you an Ice Stupa
Ambassador. If you want to do this you should get in touch with us at icestupa@gmail.com .
4. You can also use this story to educate your
children or your students about the consequences of their behaviour and
lifestyle on people in the mountains and the seashores.
5. If you have a particular skill related to the project or are the truly adventurous type you can join as a volunteer to work on the
ice stupa making starting November. Don't forget: we will be working in -15 C nights!
6. You can support our cause by cutting down
on a lifestyle that causes climate change. For example you can pledge to use
public transport, bicycle, train or car pool where possible instead a private
car or air travel. 
I will be happiest if the amount you donate
to this project comes from cutting down on a not so healthy activity in your life.  Say from that avoidable air travel you were
considering, or by saying 'No' to the 12th pair of shoes or the third car
in your family.
Best of all will be if this festive season you
decide not to buy conventional industry-made products as Christmas gifts, and
instead gift your dear ones  a portion of an Ice Stupa in the Himalayas. We'll send you a beautiful card that says so, and expresses your sentiment.  Similarly for the Hindu festival of Diwali you could save your city the noise and pollution of fire crackers,  and brighten the lives of mountain farmers
by supporting the Ice Stupa project.
Whatever you do, it would be great if you could make a one-minute video with your message to the world and if possible, state what unhealthy practice you gave up or forgo this year, to
contribute to this project. You can then post it on social media just after
making your contribution.
Please share such videos only after you
make the contribution and not before (we don’t want you to make a video and
forget the contribution, the reverse would be more acceptable !). And at the end of
the video you can invite (not challenge) three of your closest friends to make
a similar gesture.  We could call this “the
Ice Stupa Invitation”.
In short your video could have three
components:
1. Your short message to the world,
2. What did you cut down to make your
donation?
3. Which three people would you invite to do the
same?For sharing such videos and your opinions in general you could use our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/icestupaand on Twitter: https://twitter.com/icestupa
Of course if you are not comfortable with video you could just make a written post on the above social media sites saying the same things.

BUDGET
Our actual project budget is $ 100,000.  The rest has been added for covering platform fees, bank/credit card charges, rewards, perks and shipment costs for supporters.
Although the project is a collaboration of
our school (SECMOL) and  Phyang monastery, we have requested that the final amount should go into the
bank accounts of the monastery under the personal supervision
of  His Holiness.  Our school will provide and organise all the
expertise, consultation and project management staff/volunteers etc. for fund-raising as well as planning and execution of the project throughout  winter. For this we will be
suitably compensated from the project budget. Part of this amount will be used to run a course in solar energy at the Campus.
The above target amount of $ 119,500 is based on standard
rates of materials, labour etc. in the market. In reality we may have
volunteers donating their labour equipment etc… but we cannot count on such
things at this stage… Therefore we pledge that if any money is saved or left over from this project then
every penny will go towards a dream project of the Phyang monastery and
SECMOL -  setting up an Alternative
Mountain University (on the desert near the monastery) that conducts research
& development and higher educational courses for Himalayan youth in
mountain studies and climate change adaptation strategies, apart from other
themes. We assure you every dollar will be accounted for.
Same holds true in case people of the world
decide to surprise us pleasantly by contributing 10 times more than the target
amount ;) . Not an unfair expectation , if you consider that we receive perhaps 100 times
more impact than our contribution to the climate change scenario!  In any case we will remain prudent and use any extra funds for research and action on climate change through the proposed Alternative University.
So don’t please hesitate to surprise us
pleasantly and if possible please make and post a one-minute video or post with your message to the world.  I mean the...   ICE STUPA INVITATION!
Many thanks for your time and amazing patience.

こんにちは、ソナム・ワングチュクです。私はインドの極北、チベット高原にある美しいヒ
マラヤ山脈の砂漠、ラダックの出身です。機械技師としての教育を受けましたが、専ら故郷
の教育改革のために活動しています。このエリアの教育・環境問題に革新的な解決策をもた
らしている有名なSECMOLというオルタナティブ・スクール
(www.secmol.org)の設立もその一環です。子供以外では、火、氷、地球、
太陽と戯れることが好きです。つまり、効率的なストーブ、人工氷河、太陽の熱だけで暖め
られている究極の現代的な家、土の家。それらを研究しているのです。私自身のことはこれ
くらいにしますが、私についてさらに知りたい方は私の名前（珍しい名前であることに感謝
！）で検索いただければと思います。
これが私達の学校のすぐ側、典型的なラダックの風景です。そして学校の近影です。
何年もの間、SECMOLスクールキャンパスの生徒と教師達は様々な革新的プロジェクト
のために研究しています。マイナス25度の温度の中でも暖房の要らない土の建物を太陽熱で
暖める方法や、冬のラダックでも大規模農業を可能にする低価格の温室や、最安の水パイプ
の10分の1の価格の地下の土パイプ、ソーラー人力車、バイオガス工場、少量の木材で料理
・暖房出来ておまけにその熱でパンまでも焼けるロケットストーブなどなど。これらは研究
のほんの一部です。
氷卒塔婆、ラダックの人工氷河プロジェクト
2014年1月、私はこの学校の生徒数人と『氷卒塔婆』という興味深いプロジェクトに着手し
ました。自然の氷河が解けて流れ出す前の四月と五月、ラダックの農家は水不足に直面しま
す。それを解決することこそこのプロジェクトの目的です。
二月末までに、二階建ての試作模型を作ることに成功しました。この卒塔婆は冬の間、誰も
使わない川の流れから大体15万リットルの水を貯めることが出来ます。私達これをは『氷卒
塔婆』と呼ぶことにしました。形がチベットとラダックの伝統的な卒塔婆に良く似ているか
伝統的な『土の卒塔婆』
この巨大な氷の卒塔婆は、温暖化によって、氷河がどんどんなくなっている現象によって起
こる水不足からヒマラヤの村々を救うというアイデアが有効かを試すものです。自然の氷河
は年々小さくなっているので、特に早春に溶ける水は少なく、逆に暑い夏になると、多量の
水が溶け出して、さらに氷河が縮小します。この氷の卒塔婆を作ることによって、冬の間も
解けていて、無駄になっている氷や雪を春まで凍らせておくことによって、農家の人たちが
水が一番必要な時期に使うことが出来るようになるのです。
しかし人工的な氷河を作るというこのアイデアは新しいものではありません。ラダックとバ
ルティスターンの人々が1万4千フィート（約４３００ｍ）の高さの山に上り、新しい氷河を
「育ててきた」（彼らが言うところの『氷河移植』）という話は何度も聞いたことがありま
した。その方法は科学的なものでありません。しかし近年ラダックの土木技師ノーフェル氏
が、高地で広大な氷を作るため、分水路を通して余分な水を冬の間に凍らせる活動をしてき
ました。私は彼の活動に多大な刺激を受けました。そして技術の限界を感じていた彼は私の
参加を求めてきたのです。人工氷河は水路の定期的なメンテナンスが必要です。この方法で
は、水路は標高4000メートル以上のところだけが可能であり、村人が山と水路の間を往来す
るのは大変です。更に、氷河は険しい山の中、太陽の光を遮る場所で作られなければいけま
せん。こういった条件をクリアすることはほとんどの村で難しいのです。
私はこれらの問題の解決策を考えるようになりました。私は「氷河は標高の高い日陰で作ら
れるべき」という根本的な考えに疑問を持ちました。そして春の太陽と雪が氷を溶かすため
には広大な表面積が必要なことに気づきました。つまり太陽・風が当たる面積を減らせば、
氷河は村に貯蔵することが可能で、そうなれば村人が山を登る必要はないのです。その時私
は太陽に向かって垂直に氷を作るというアイデアを思いつきました。そうすれば平らな地面
に作る氷のフィールドに比べ、当たる太陽光がかなり削減されます。
例えば、半径20メートル・高さ40メートルの氷の卒塔婆は、一体で大体1600万リットルの水
を貯蓄できます。もし同じ量の水を厚さ2メートルにして平らに凍らせた場合、太陽熱に晒
される面積は卒塔婆の５倍になります。陽光と春風は５倍の速さで氷を溶かしてしまうわけ
氷の円錐を作る方法は非常にシンプルです。ビデオで説明されているように、それは、カッ
プや湖、パイプの中であろうと変わらない水の性質にのっとっています。つまりパイプの片
方側の水を数階の高さに吹き上げ、もう片方側をただ上流に垂らせばよいのです。そしてラ
ダックでは、空気中の温度が低いため、流れた水（または、まかれた水）はあっという間に
凍ってしまうのです。それが繰り返されることによって徐々に自然の円錐が形作られていく
暑さに負けない氷のプリン！
6メートルの試作模型を作ったことでこの仮説は証明されました。平らな地面の氷が三月半
ばまでに溶けてしまう中、この卒塔婆は5月18日、木々の葉が緑になり温度が30度近くにな
る初夏まで残ったのです。実験成功が決定した5月1日には卒塔婆はまだ3メートル残ってい
3月半ばまでに、地面上の平らな氷は解けてしまいましたが、卒塔婆は残っていました。
五月まで、緑と氷とが並ぶという珍しい光景を見ることが出来ました。
試作模型は最も温暖な条件の中で作成されました。つまりここで成功したということは、他
の場所でも成功するということです。レー峡谷で最も標高の低い場所、標高3170メートルの
インダス川沿いに作られ、お祈りの旗（タルチョー）以外は、太陽光にあたっていたのです
から。（タルチョーについては後述します）
僧侶の高僧。技師で2014年5月1日の人工氷河の製作者です。
ディグン　キャブゴンチェツァン高僧（リンポチェイ）はこの結果に喜び、我がスクールと
卒塔婆を訪れて祝ってくれました。そして、ピャン村の砂漠の頂上に試作でなく、完全な氷
卒塔婆を立てて欲しいとSECMOLに要請したのです。聖下はチベット仏教において最も
位の高い生き仏であり、ヒマラヤでの緑化活動 
(http://www.drikung.org)でも知られています。彼は『Go 
Green Go Organic』活動の下、ピャン砂漠を緑化したいと願ったのです。
有名なピャン寺院と広大な砂漠。
何故クラウドファンディングか？
古代、ラダックの人々は僧院の側に卒塔婆を建てていました。その行為は市民による民主的
な労働貢献で、ハラと呼ばれていました。このデジタル全盛期の時代に、地球の力でもって
氷の卒塔婆を作ることは「デジタルなハラ」と言うことも出来ます。この考えは面白いと思
いませんか？　その上、この山脈で直面している問題を解決するために地球に貢献してもら
うことは意味のあることです。なぜなら好むと好まざるに関係なく、私たちは地球温暖化の
影響を自分たちのシェア以上に受けているからです。
そしてこの冬、世界の人々はピャン寺院の側に氷卒塔婆を建てるために力を合わせます！そ
して砂漠を緑に変え村人と僧侶たちを助けるのです。
9月にはプロジェクトについて、高僧（リンポチェイ）とピャンの村人たちとで話し合う場
が設けられました。村からは仏教徒だけでなくイスラム教徒の人々も参加しました。
僧侶と村のリーダーたちは僧院に集合し、砂漠緑化計画を支持する世界の人々に感謝しまし
た。プロジェクトが完了すれば、6百万ｍ2もの砂漠を緑に変えるのに充分な水が生まれるこ
とになります。彼らはまたピャン砂漠を、自然資源で建てた住宅と太陽光のみでエネルギー
と熱をまかなう持続可能なエコシティへと変える可能性についても意見を交わしました。
氷卒塔婆キャンペーン、本格始動。
10月13日、ジャム・カシミール州の知事でもある、 エヌ・エヌ・ ヴォホラ閣下は気候変動
適応のための国際会議にて、『氷卒塔婆・人工氷河プロジェクト』を立ち上げました。そこ
で私たちのフィルム『僧侶、技師と人工氷河』を使用したのです。
ラダックの僧侶、技師と人工氷河。プロジェクト立ち上げの後。
2014年、10月半ば～11月半ば。
パイプ取り付け完了。
12月はじめ～2015年2月末
卒塔婆の形成が開始。
1日頃、卒塔婆の祝い・奉納を始める。村人、近隣住民が卒塔婆に様々なタルチョーをかけ
るために集まる。ラダック・チベットでは仏教の（祈りの旗）タルチョーを卒塔婆にかける
のが伝統的なならわしだが、この場合タルチョーは科学的な意味を持つ。氷河を溶かす二大
要素、強い春の日差しと春の風から卒塔婆を守るのだ。
そのため、祈りのタルチョーによって天界が卒塔婆の溶解を遅らせると私たちが村人に言っ
たことは嘘ではありません！　試作の卒塔婆はそういうふうに作り、とても美しく完成しま
このプロジェクト実施のために素晴らしいチームが結成されました。
私以外の構成員は、ドクター・ツェワンティンレー。デリー。IITの博士号とIITムン
バイ修士 で水文学の学位を修めた専門家。インド国内、国外からのボランティアと
SECMOLスクールのスタンジン・シャラの支援を受けることになります。
お坊さんであるリグジン・ドルジェ。彼はピャン僧院のマネージャーで、同僧院の建設を15
年間に渡り管理していた経験があります。また、3年間、3ヶ月、3日の間孤立した中で瞑想
するロスム・チュスム（３年３か月３日の瞑想）というリトリートを成し遂げた僧侶でもあ
ります。彼は僧院の僧たちの支援を受けます。
ドキュメントフィルム　チーム
スタンジン・ドルジェ・ギャはSECMOLスクールの元学生です。彼は羊飼いから映画監
督に転身した面白い経歴の持ち主です。インドやヨーロッパで数々の国際的な賞を
受賞しています。彼はツェワン・パルダン、スタンジン・デツァル、ラールス・リドウトロ
ムの支援を受けています。
ピ・ツェリンはあらゆる技術を自作する『技術オタク』で、デリーで生活しています。都市
のテクノロジー市場の表から裏までを知り尽くしており、本プロジェクトに必要な材料と製
品を揃えてくれます。ジャムではSECMOLスクールの元学生でありジャム大学の学者で
あるスタンジン・ナムギャルの支援を受けます。彼とそのチームはジャムからの材料供給を
あなたの参加をお待ちしています！
１．寄付はいくらからでも受け付けます。千円でも１００万円でも寄付への気持ちは変わり
ません。貴方の寄付がもたらす影響を今すぐ感じるのは難しいかも知れません。でも貴方の
千円が積もって多額の寄付金となり、実験が成功しメジャーな開発機構（政府や企業）がラ
ダックの村々のために動く結果になり得るのです。
2．クレジットカードでの寄付以外にも出来ることはあります。友人、家族や親戚へ、ソー
シャルメディアで、このニュースを伝えて下さい。
金銭的援助が難しくても問題ありません。それだけが支援ではないのです。資金集めのキャ
ンペーンであると同時に、教育的なキャンペーンでもあるのですから。
３．ご自分で、フィルム上映会を企画して、気候問題と生活スタイルへの関心を広げ寄付を
サポートする方法もあります。
そうすれば貴方は氷卒塔婆大使になれるのです。興味のある方は 
icestupa@gmail.comまでご連絡ください。
４．この物語を語ることで、海や山で暮らす人々の行動やライフスタイルについて子供や生
徒達に学んでもらうことが出来ます。
５．貴方がプロジェクトに関連した専門スキルを持っている、または冒険心に溢れているな
ら、11月から始まる氷卒塔婆制作にボランティアとして参加することも出来ます。ただし、
マイナス25度の夜に活動することを忘れないで！
6．日々の生活の中で気候変動の原因を減らすことも支援の一つです。例えば移動に自家用
車や飛行機でなく、公共機関、自転車、電車やカープールを使用することです。
日々の不健康的な行為の節制によって、プロジェクトへの寄付が生まれるとしたら、嬉しい
限りです。飛行機旅行を止めましょう。要らない靴を持つこと、何台もの車をもつことを止
一番素晴らしいのは、このクリスマスシーズンに普段通りの工場で作られたものを贈るので
はく、大事な人にヒマラヤの氷卒塔婆の一部を贈ることです。貴方の気持ちを代弁して美し
いクリスマスカードをお送りします。同じようにディワリーのヒンドゥー祭りでは、騒いだ
りゴミを出す代わりにプロジェクト支援によって山で生活している農民たちの生活を豊かに
することが出来ます。
プロジェクトのために浪費をやめたことを1分間のメッセージビデオをして世界に伝えれば
それも素晴らしいことです。ソーシャルメディアに投稿してください。
必ず寄付や貢献をした後にビデオをシェアして下さい！（先にビデオを撮って貢献するのを
忘れてしまうのは止めてくださいね。貢献してビデオ撮影を忘れるはokです。）ビデオの
最後に大事な友人3人をこのプロジェクトに招待してください。（どこかのチャレンジとは
違います。）『氷卒塔婆インビテーション』です。
ビデオ撮影のために必要な3か条です
1．世界へ向けたメッセージ
2．寄付のためにあなたが我慢したこと

。https://www.facebook.com/icestupa

もちろんビデオが好きでない方は、ソーシャルメディアへの投稿で構いません。
実際のプロジェクト予算は10万ドル（約一千万円）です。その他、綱領・銀行/クレジット
カード手数料、報酬・心づけ・郵送費用などが追加されます。
プロジェクトはSECMOLとピャン僧院の共同事業ですが、僧院の銀行口座にて聖下の個
人的監護の下に資金は集められています。SECMOLが、冬の間プロジェクトの計画・実
施と同様資金調達のため、専門知識・コンサル・スタッフなどをオーガナイズします。予算
については補償されます。金額の一部は、授業内の太陽エネルギーのコース実施のため使用
目標金額の11万9500ドル（約１１９５万円）は材料費・人件費の市場標準額です。実際には
多くのボランティアが労働を提供してくれますが、現時点での算出は不可能です。そのため
プロジェクトで少しでも余分な資金があれば、1円でもピャン僧院とSECMOLの夢のプ
ロジェクトに費やしたいと考えています。オルタナティブ・マウンテン・ユニバーシティ（
僧院の近くの砂漠にあります）を設立し、山の研究や気候変動適応戦略についてヒマラヤの
若者向けの授業やR&Dを実施するのです。あなたの募金は1円とも無駄にはなりません。
もし世界の人々が目標金額の10倍を寄付してくれたとしても、同じことが当てはまります
